review.title: Great location to everything.
review.reviewText: Great location to everything. Not very expensive and has everything you need to stay for a short trip

review.title: Old and terrible
review.reviewText: Overpricy. super old, it's inclined, the room was uneven the bed was like it was on a hill, the towels were stained super gross, the room is tiny. I swear I went the next day to a MOTEL in Yosemite and it was lot better, cleaner and espacios than this hotel. The parking is super expensive too. Oh! And the breakfast is a JOKE. Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, I went for part of my honeymoon, and it was really disappointing!

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean but i think the price is too expensive for the condition of the place. The carpet needs to be replaced, the floor is squeaking and not level, the hallway is scary. Although the bed is comfy, It's hard to sleep I can hear our neighbors close the door, showering, flushing, talking plus the street is unbelievably noisy from Police car and fire truck siren almost every 10-20 mins all night. We were already in the top floor so i can't imagine the other guests on the lower levels. No airconditioner in the room and you can't open the window because of the noise. The room and hallway has also a weird smell. Free breakfast is okay.. Waffle, Bread, cereal and yogurt. They need to add atleast one or two more toaster because one is not enough for all the guest in the hotel. Hotel is close to union square, chinatown and cable car.. The staff are super friendly but one cleaning staff in the morning not so friendly.. Not even an excuse or sorry for sweeping the floor behind me while I was waiting for the front desk (She was sweeping towards me and our luggage without saying anything).

review.title: Decent hotel for the price in a good location
review.reviewText: Although it should come as no surprise to anyone, San Francisco is quickly becoming one of the more expensive destinations to visit. Cost of living is skyrocketing and this is reflected in the high cost of hotels in downtown. The Adante Hotel, although slightly less expensive than the higher end hotels, was still way overpriced for what you get, in my opinion. The walls are paper thin. You can pretty much hear conversations happening on the other side of the wall and in the hallway, which is consistent with the age of the building. This is only an issue when you're trying to sleep while your neighbors are still up. The rooms were relatively clean; I'll give them that. And the continental breakfast was decent. But the overall age of the hotel, creaky stairs, slow elevator, etc. make it tough to swallow for the price. But when compared to the competition, this hotel is in line or slightly cheaper than the others. The location was good, only a few blocks away from Union Square, but definitely a few seedy individuals on the streets outside at night, but we found that everywhere in downtown.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location was good. 
Relatively clean.
Large bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could be extended beyond 9:30am. After all, you're on vacation and some people like to sleep in.
review.locationRemarks: Some good restaurants nearby. In particular, we enjoyed Tacorea and Mensho Tokyo (lined up down the block, so go early.

review.title: Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Good location for centre of city. Secure parking nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had a really nice and pleasant experience staying in this hotel room. The check-in was pretty fast less than 5mins. The two ladies were really nice and polite to help me with anything. When I got to my room it smelled really good, I would love if anyone from the staff see this comment can tell me the spray that they used? lol  I would appreciate it. The room was really tiny than what I was expecting. I didn't really like that outside my window was like another apartment and I can see people looking at me from the other side but me and my friend just close the curtains and problem solved. The bed was big but very comfortable to sleep in. The maid clean up my room every morning but there were some days where I can still see some stains on the sheets and I didn't really like it. I felt safe even walking at night although I was impressed by how many homeless people I saw on the streets, I felt really bad. There are some people who don't like this in an area but hey I come from NYC and guess what, we also have homeless people everywhere it's not only in SF. That didn't really bothered me since one day I was walking around by one of the most expensive hotels and I also saw that their location was just like this one, there were a lot of homeless people. I wouldn't rate the hotel by their location but more of the experience in general and how well the staff treats you.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location because everything was close and I had to just walk a few blocks to get to my destinations.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are HUGE! which makes the room look even smaller than it is. However, I think it was a very comfortable bed. Kinda expensive.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great because is pretty close to everything and if you are a walker like me then you wouldn't mind walking a few extra blocks.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, very tiny room, old building, very small lobby area for breakfast.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We are glad you enjoyed your stay at Adante Hotel. We do apologize for this error sir and we do try our best to accommodate every guest. We hope you enjoyed the city and we will take this feedback for future reference. We wish to see you in the future and we hope you have a nice day.

review.title: Convenient for everywhere I needed to go.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, I was pointed in the nearest and cheapest overnight parking. They were then able to get me early check in, but put me in a room that had not been cleaned yet. They were quick to fix this error. Staff were super friendly, especially Marissa. Easy to get to, from the North Bay. And easy to get out of town as well once my shenanigans were done. Will definitely stay here again.

managementResponses.response: We are delighted that you made the most of our wonderful location, and enjoyed all of the local attractions. We're also thrilled that enjoyed your stay in our hotel, and that you found our staff to be so helpful. Thank you for your review, and we hope to welcome you back to the hotel sometime soon.

review.title: Small and quaint
review.reviewText: You definitely pay for what you get, but the. Again that is ALL of San Francisco. My room was tiny little room to move around but the bed made up for it in comfort. The location is on the edge of the scary part of town but didn't really mind. If you don't have a car ( I recommend  you  don't bother) most uber rides to all your main tourist  attractionspots were only 7-10 per ride, airport about 30. I would stay here again, was budget  friendly and the Mediterranean restaurant  downstairs  is a must try.

managementResponses.response: Dear guest, thank you for your review. While we are glad that you enjoyed our hospitality and your stay in general, we are disappointed to hear that you felt the room was too small. Please know that we do have different rooms available. As for the room being too hot, we will surely look into this and see what improvements we can make. Thank you for your feedback.

review.reviewText: Convenient location but too too small!!! Friendly staff. Tiny area for breakfast and not enough space to sit. Room is cleaning but it can get too hot and can't open the windows.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and for you feedback. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

review.title: Tight space for 2 queen beds
review.reviewText: It's a small hotel with tiny rooms, especially tight with 2 queen beds. There's no loading/unloading zone, but there is a parking garage just a couple doors away. The lobby is fresh, but the rooms and bathrooms are dated. The rooms have radiators but no A/C. The attached Egyptian/Mediterranean restaurant is good and is open until midnight.

managementResponses.response: Rachael, We strive to provide our guests with flawless service and product delivery. Our apologies that we did not live up to your expectations. We were very distressed to learn of your first impression of the hotel. We've brought your feedback to our room service staff's attention. While we are glad that we were able to get you another room, we sincerely apologize for your inconvenience. We understand that you did not have a favorable impression of our hotel, but we sincerely hope you'll give us another opportunity to restore your confidence in our hotel and hospitality. Thanks again for your feedback Rachael.

review.title: Hate to say that I wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: Maybe this is normal for SF, but it was my first time in the city. The room was over fragranced (bad for allergies), the room is shockingly small (and I live in Seattle), and the staff didn't remember me 5 minutes after check-in. I was upgraded, so I at least appreciate their effort to make my stay better. And it was pretty in the lobby area.

managementResponses.response: We are so pleased that we could be your host during your recent visit to San Francisco. Professional customer service and comfortable rooms with great amenities are always what we strive for and I'm so pleased to hear that we achieved our goal your visit. Thanks for your stellar review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Found this hotel by accident upon arrival in San Fran. Ended up staying a second night. Hotel taff was excellent, hotel had quite the character. Absolutely recommend.

review.title: Shocked in Frisco
review.reviewText: As you find the hotel, there's no parking to be found, unless you pay for valet ($50) or Public Overnight Parking ($32). Rooms are very small, but clean, and walls are paper thin. I would not recommend this hotel.

managementResponses.response: Sharon, thank you for your thorough review. review.title: Decent hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to union square just like other reviewers say. Not a good location but then again you have to remember that hotels in cities are usually next to small restaurants, liquor stores, or bars. If your looking for a safe area then pay extra to stay at Hilton or another big chain hotel. The room is small but you get your own bathroom and the bed was comfy. This hotel is good if you plan on staying 1- 2 nights more than that stay somewhere else so you'll be comfortable. The lobby is nice and modern but everything else is older looking (the stairs, the carpet in the rooms/ hallway). We didn't hear any outside noise or neighbors so we slept comfortably. We only stayed one night for a romantic getaway since we only live 40mins away. we took Bart not sure where you would park your car if you drove. We did a little research and parking overnight is anywhere between $35 and $50.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked how check out time is noon. For once we didn't feel like we had to rush to get out of there.

managementResponses.response:
Glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay overall. We apologize for the cable. Please know that we have taken care of this issue. We hope to welcome you back again next time you visit San Francisco.

review.title: good location

The hotel is at a very good location in the centre of San Francisco.
However, if you get a room on the first floor (aka ground floor) you won't sleep very well. The doors are very thin and you can hear everything that's going on outside. This might not be a problem if you are on an upper floor, but on the ground floor you can hear all the guests arriving and leaving, using elevator, or staff rolling some barrels at midnight. 
Additionally, room was extremely hot despite the radiator being turned off.

Overall, the perfect location for a San Francisco trip.

review.title: Good for tight budget, but nothing else
review.reviewText:
A good place to stay if you're strapped for cash.  However, the walls were like paper: I could hear noises from outside and inside the hotel as if they were in the room with me. I also heard a lot of mechanical noise, but that could have been my proximity to the front office.
The area the hotel is in is a little rundown. I was told by a garage valet that parking in the street might end up with a window blown out. I'm glad that there was a garage right there, but it's a steep expense at $30.00/night for overnight. I recommend that this not rate if you're driving in.

Overall, if you need a quick place to crash, definitely worth it. If you're looking for something more, I would suggest elsewhere.

managementResponses.response: While we are  happy to see that you found the room to be clean and comfortable, we are disappointed to hear about your dissatisfaction about the room temperature, as well as your friend being locked out. Also please know that we are always there to help, so if you need anything during your stay we'd be happy to help. Thank you.

review.title: Comfortable for the budget conscious

Breakfast is basic, but convenient and a $$ saver!

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, rooms were clean but very small. The shower was terrible and barely any space to move in the bathroom. Our room constantly smelt like smoke even though the hotel was no smoking. Very noisy, we were on the top floor and constantly woken up by other noisy guests. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The location was good, we walked everywhere but a little too close to some dodgy areas. Could probably find better.

review.title: Cool hote!
review.reviewText: I had a wounderful stay at the hotel. The hotel was close to everthing from shopping to night life. Also the hotel had great architrctual detals.

review.title: Photos of property are missleading.
review.reviewText: Good value if you just want a bed to crash in and a clean bath. Staff very helpful. If you need to spend time in your room for work or play. This is probably not the place for you. Great location. Free wifi.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: The building is old, and the rooms are very narrow. The hallways look kind of scary, so does the elevator that creates a shocking effect when it passes 2nd floor. However.. my room was clean, it had a closet and nice bathroom (they even have makeup remover tissue). It is also nicely located, not very far from union square. Breakfast was basic at best, they served white loaf bread, pancake that you put in the toaster, cereal, coffee, tea, and some juice. I think I am leaning towards good, and would recommend it for people who want to have cheaper option for downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Heat from the radiator made it impossible to sleep
review.reviewText: It was mot good.  Couldn't sleep due to the heat emanating from the old radiator.  And you could not turn it off.

review.title: The only good thing was the location.
review.reviewText: The room was very dirty. My husband had white socks walking around, when he sat with his feet up his socks were black. The sheets had stains on them like if they were burned with cigarettes. The walls were thin we heard people fighting, laughing and having intimate relations. Kids were running up and down the halls it was annoying.

review.title: Continental breakfast was good!
review.reviewText: Good continental breakfast. Made for a convenient morning. Added value to the cost.

review.title: While close to Union Square...
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to a falafel shop, lobby is horrible and smells, dirty couches, noisy, front desk staff not empowered to make quick decisions.  The first room I was provided was next to lobby and elevator, no tv remote - when they finally delivered one the tv did not work, additionally the walls were paper thin - I could hear the phone ring in the lobby and the front desk staff talking.  I switched rooms after demanding a refund to leave the hotel (they were initially “sold out” with no other rooms but magically found one after calling the manager).  The higher floor room was still really noisy under the stairwell as I could hear everyone tromping up and down the stairs as the elevator takes 5 minutes to arrive.  I would never stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Would've been acceptable, but NO AIR-CONDITIONING!
review.reviewText: This hotel is old and shabby, with cheap modern furniture to try to dress it up. The room was clean and fairly comfortable, but if you happen to be staying there on a warm night, like I was, the lack of air-conditioning is a killer. I spent the night vacillating between closing the window and trying to sleep in an 80-degree room and opening it and listening to a cacophony of horns, sirens, roaring trucks, and shouting drunks from the busy street below. Also, the staff was surprisingly sketchy and unfriendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Air-conditioning, staff.
review.locationRemarks: It's downtown San Francisco, you name it, it's there.

review.title: Comfortable room, good location and value
review.reviewText:
The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful and the location is good.  Valet parking is available.  They offer a complimentary breakfast in the mornings, which includes things like coffee, yogurt, toast and fruit.  The hotel is located in an older building, which only has one elevator.  It wasn't a big deal because you can take the stairs once you get your luggage up to your room.   The rooms are small (or at least mine was), but it was fine for one person.  It would be okay for two people as long as you don't have a lot of luggage.  The room and the bathroom was very clean and my room had a nice television and a coffee maker.  Note that there is no air conditioning.  I was there October 1-3rd.  The weather was nice (no rain) and I kept the window open.  Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.   

For the area, this hotel was the best value.  I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very cozy,friendly staff.nice breakfast.clean and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It was all .ok
review.locationRemarks: Great Irish pub ,trolley and close to union square for the hop on hop off bus.and great shopping

review.title: Not like the pictures
review.reviewText: Staff was pleasant and friendly,but hotel is old and not well maintained.  Pictures online make it look modern...but it's not.   Bed was comfortable, view of roof and pigeon droppings.  Not particularly clean.  Breakfast OK but not much beyond toast & bananas.  Nearby restaurants were awful, but a few good ones if you walked 4-5 blocks away.  I wouldn't stay here again, OK to spend a night but you wouldn't want to linger in the room or lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean it up; modernize the rooms.  Toilet seat cheap plastic that moved on you, mattress kept sliding away from wall.
review.locationRemarks: Not a great neighborhood.  Within walking distance of Chinatown

review.title: Good location, that it.
review.reviewText:
Staff is not friendly, no smile, no helpful.
Web photo looks very good but real motel is terrible especially room. No recomend for family trip.

review.title: Place is clean; location is not the best
review.reviewText:
No free parking although Expedia lists as free parking.  The front desk staff recommended that city tour package be bought at the front desk.  It appears the hotel get a commission.  You can probably get a better deal if you purchase city tour package outside.  Do your own research, and save money.
Continental breakfast is right next to the front desk.  Very small area.  Crowded and no place to sit in the morning.  There were not any eggs, hashbrown, sausage or bacon. Very simple breakfast.
Rooms/bathroom were very clean.  Overall Okay.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service
review.locationRemarks: Busy street in San Francisco.  No curb side appeal

review.title: Bad service
review.reviewText: So to start there is no AC in this hotel, just ceiling fans. It was super hot when we went and the room had no air circulation. The staff members that we dealt with were rude and not so friendly. We had kids with us and it's hard enough trying to deal with the kids and an unfriendly staff.

review.title: Would not recommend. Not worth the $$.
review.reviewText: The customer service was awful at the front desk. They charge you for a deposit , which then takes a week to credit on your account and they charged us for parking we never authorized. They removed charge when we noticed it but still.

review.title: Sketchy
review.reviewText: Nasty area, beds squashed in room, wet carpet, and NO WATER the evening I checked in so couldn't use bathroom or wash up before event I was in town for. Window low to floor and no air so dangerous in warm weather. Never ever again!!!

review.title: Having drinks
review.reviewText: Ok so me and hubby go to frisco every year to get away from kids and go bar hoping shopping and dinner I'm not trying to spend $240+ for one night so for the price Of $140+ wasn't a bad deal we did all that we wanted to do and more... And for those who are disappointed of homeless around that area is crazy there is homeless down by the Hilton so what's the problem I mean your in the middle near Union square very close to everything bars clubs everywhere & shopping right at fingertips no real need for trolly since so close unless u wanna go to warf but as for location it's PERFECT the room decor is updated its just an old hotel if you know what I mean so bottom line if you want a place to sleep comfortably without breaking the bank you won't be disappointed but if your looking for FANCY ASS SHIT then go a block down as for customer service they were rude but we dropped of our stuff and hit the streets so kinda forgot about it lol would I stay again yes I would if I could get it for $140 again i used Expedia 😀
review.positiveRemarks: Location!! It's very close to everything bathroom and decode is up to date
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner and staff training they seem stressed so become very rude of general questions
review.locationRemarks: Lots of bars & a lot of food spots open till 4 am. And down the street from Union square shopping & taxi was only $9 to punchlime comedy andsports bar

review.title: Walk to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite old and not fancy but it was very clean and the staff were very good.  The breakfast area is small so arrive early to avoid a lineup and get a seat.  It is within easy walking distance of Union Square .
review.negativeRemarks: Another toaster at breakfast would be a good idea.
review.locationRemarks: It is within easy walking distance of Union Square.  We also walked to Chinatown, Little Italy and Fishermen's Wharf although those were much further.

review.title: Hotel not nearly as good as expedia makes it sound
review.reviewText: Was very disappointed. Could have booked any other hotel but the Expedia recommendations showed it in a good area, close to where i needed to be. Neither were true.

review.title: Stuffy room!
review.reviewText: Even with the window open for hours and all night and the fan going, the room was incredibly stuffy. It was so uncomfortable, especially for being in SF where it cools down at night! Not exactly relaxing to sweat while I sleep.

review.title: Small room, no AC, noisy front room
review.reviewText: SF is expensive, but for $260 a night I was assuming there was AC. If you get a room that faces the front of hotel, it will be noisy outside all night. Room had a ceiling fan, but it was on a sensored switch so it wouldn't stay on if it didn't sense movement, so worthless if you're trying to sleep. Room was clean, beds were comfortable.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I saw this hotel on Expedia and booked it because the photos of the lobby looked super chic, but once I got there I realized the rest of the hotel was quite outdated. The elevator is pretty old, the rooms have NO AC, the windows have no screens so I was afraid a pidgen was going to fly in our room all night. Overall, the staff was friendly and it was a good price, but if I was to do it all over again I would book a place with AC.

review.title: Updated, Older Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very willing to help and so kind. The hotel itself is obviously older but has been updated and is very nice.

review.title: Over-priced
review.reviewText: This is a tired hotel.  The rooms are modest; some of the staff are unhelpful and uninterested; and there is a lot of noise. It is, simply, overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be better trained. The breakfast is not of a high standard.
review.locationRemarks: The location is satisfactory, but just be aware that it is adjacent to the Tenderloin District, which is (still) to be avoided.

review.title: Would never go back.
review.reviewText:
Smells terrible. Staff was weird.
All I can say is parking was easy (next door) and there is a great middle eastern joint attached. 
Would never return.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: It is grimy at night. I don't often express negativity but this place sucked.

review.title: 2 nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We booked with the Adante hotel as their price was an incentive (paying $500 a night at a regular hotel was not in our budget).
The hotel has been remodeled but is still an old hotel.  No air conditioning (we were aware of it, the nights being cool, an open window helped cooling the bedroom temperature).  fan ceiling only. That being said, you can open your window (with no screen and could have a feather visitor on your window seal)   the room was very small (but it was for sleeping, so was OK with it).  One elevator, which we barely have to wait a long time for (6 floors, about 20 bedrooms per floor).  breakfast, complimentary, with coffee, tea, infusion, cereals, toasts, yogurts...satisfactory.
Room and bathroom were clean, bed comfortable.  
close to cable cars, the shopping area but also close to the "shady"  area too.  Wouldn't have walk there late at night.
review.positiveRemarks: close to cable cars to get us to the Pier, reasonably price compare to other hotels
review.negativeRemarks: Sincerely I think they do their best with what they have
review.locationRemarks: Close to the shopping area and city transportation

review.title: sf
review.reviewText: There was a conference in the city, so all rooms in town were sky high. We found this hotel at a very affordable rate and decided to give it a try. The neighborhood is sketchy. Its a close walk from union square area (less than 10 minutes) but as 2 young women, we were uncomfortable returning to the hotel in the evening. There are a lot of homeless and shady characters lurking the nearby streets. We just kept our heads down and walked fast. The hotel staff was very friendly and checkin was quick. The lobby is nice and modern. The room itself was small, but it is an old building, so it was as expected. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and in good working order. There was a free continental breakfast including ego waffles, yogurt, and oatmeal. Overall, for the price we were pleased. Besides the neighborhood, we have no complaints and would consider staying here again.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a

review.reviewText: At check in I was surprised by the extra person charge, when it was a double occupancy. The door to the dresser wouldn't close. And the Cable wasn't working.

review.title: Family vacation to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was much smaller than the online pics made it look. There were stains on the walls, cracks in the ceiling, and overall rundown feeling. There was someone else's dirty q-tip and piece of tissue behind the door when we got there....and they stayed there the entire three days we were there. The cleaning staff made our beds every day but left this garbage sitting on the floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Union Square location was close.

review.title: Eggo's and toast
review.reviewText:
To be fair I was really only in the room to sleep and Shower. But the Modern redo of this hotel is already showing its age. the rooms are dark and have very little cheer in them  I think due to the wood being painted black. I know bathrooms from the age of this hotel use to be outside of the room and the updates added bathrooms, well mine was huge, I believe it was an old retrofitted room. It had all the charm of a gas station bathroom. Though I did really like the towels. 

The bed was a raised platform bed soft enough for me but it was on a close second to sleeping on a big rock, I actually like firm so it was good. 

Don't really plan on breakfast here. I stuck with a banana and some water. It literally looked like Eggo's and toast was the main  choices I think their may have been yogurt and Bran cereal. So if you are thinking this into your budget for food it may not be the right place to stay.

Almost forgot there is a valet parking sign but you are not allowed to park there and the front desk said it would take 30 min for the car to be picked up, but it will be towed away long before that. If you stay here there is a parking garage 30 ft up the road the parking is 30 dollars for 24 hours and that is better than the hotel at 45.

The hotel rate was reasonable and I would possibly stay here again, but I travel for a living and as long as the bed is clean and the shower works I am good.
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff was friendly, the location was not bad and it was clean

I did love that it was very quiet
review.negativeRemarks: maybe a refresh to more of boutique from stark modern
review.locationRemarks: Its fairly close to shopping but I was there on business in the city so I did not have time to check out the surroundings.

review.title: Good location for the price
review.reviewText: Only a few blocks from Union Square, it was the best price I could find for the location. It is somewhat close to the Tenderloin area, which might be off-putting for some. The hotel room was nice and clean and not as small as I expected. The staff was helpful. The hotel doesn't have AC (typical for SF, I assume) so we had to crack the window to sleep comfortably, but that meant we had to wear earplugs to attempt to drown out the noise outside. The continental breakfast does leave a bit to be desired.
review.positiveRemarks: For the price and location, I think this was a great hotel. Clean, friendly staff, and so close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: The "delicious breakfast" was an over-exaggeration. Bananas, sandwich bread, frozen waffles, Activia yogurt, coffee, and a couple cereals.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty within walking distance. The Bellissimo Pizza joint and Pearl's Deluxe Burgers are really great inexpensive places to grab lunch or dinner.

review.reviewText: Very small rooms with bad insulation from the street.

The street was very noisy. the building is very old. The Doors almost broken. Something like a beds & T.V is new but generally it's look like a motel.
No parking at the hotel other than a valet service but that costs $ 50 per night (with tax) and it took the valet 40 minutes to arrive with my car in the morning.

review.title: Affordable boutique hotel
review.reviewText: For the price, I was pleased with the hotel. Definitely an older hotel but you can tell they've updated it as best they can and I had everything I needed. You can't really complain for the price. Parking overnight was pricey and given my current condition I had to use the hotel valet. That was the only drawback.

review.title: Ok hotel on a budget
review.reviewText:
Not the greatest experience. The staff seemed to hate their jobs, and the included breakfast was basically just cereal. 

My room was very noisy - there is a restaurant attached to the hotel which washes its dishes between midnight and 3am every night, and they are LOUD. Hotel management didn't seem to be able to do anything abut it. Probably needs some better soundproofing on certain room windows.

The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean, despite it being dated.

Location - as long as you are walking toward union square and not up into the loin you won't have any troubles.

So all in all... not a horrible stay, the noisy nights were my biggest complaint. If you're on a budget trip and can deal with certain imperfections and annoyances this place is worth a look.

review.reviewText: This hotel was pretty awful. First, the young man at the hotel desk was RUDE RUDE RUDE. The second we walked in the door he was argumentative, bossy, and rude. Second, the rooms were incredibly tiny. We had four people in one room (thinking two double beds would be plenty of room) and we were SO wrong. There is barely any space to move about in the room at all. The only redeeming qualities of this hotel were the location and the room cleanliness. It is in the Tenderloin, which can be a rough area, but it is only a few blocks from Union Square. And the hotel rooms themselves were VERY clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Young male hotel desk clerk was incredibly rude.

review.title: no wifi anywhere even at the front desk.
review.reviewText: night parking $35. No taxi service. Registration too long. Not be back ever.

review.title: Good location...
review.reviewText: I was really excited to stay at this hotel for NYE first it was a decent deal for my last minute choice and secondly it was in the general area where I was going to be. The check in process was irritating to say the least. A Indian staff member stood there looking at his phone and didn't ask to help me until he was prompted by the valet attendant  who had to knock on the glass window to get his attention. The staff member looked perturbed and begrudgingly began to help me. He was crude and barely explained what was going on. He asked for my ID and payment card and all but threw it back at me after he was finished with it. The other issue I had was that the cost of parking doubled and I explained to the staff that I called to verify the parking rate and was quoted a cheaper price, the staff refused to honor the original price and I had to end up paying  $85 for parking! The plus side is that the room was clean, however, the cost of the room was not worth it. It's old but to be fair I believe they're renovating the hotel.

review.title: Eh..
review.reviewText: Check in was awkward...the clerk took a while to find my reservation that I had just made less than an hour before. He wasn't very friendly and was very abrasive about parking. Expedia says it was 35 for valet but then he insisted it was 45 (plus tax making it 52$). They also said my car had to be out right at 12 and couldn't leave it any longer while I went to an interview. So I ended up using the parking garage up the street and had to drag my luggage down. Room was TINY. Loved the king bed but it took up a lot of space. Bathroom could use a remodel. No view from my room. Wifi code written on my room key was wrong. Don't ask them for a late check out! They were reluctant to even give me an extra half hour. Probably wouldn't stay there again unless I HAD to...

review.title: Small, noisy, poorly kept rooms
review.reviewText:
Room was too small to open my suitcase. Okay, you expect a smallish room when you book a budget San Francisco hotel, but this was the smallest I've had. That's annoying, but I can live it.

The deal-breaker for me was the noise from my front facing room - both week and weekend I was kept awake until 2-3am. I thought staying on Market St was bad, but staying on Geary was considerably worse. Rumbling buses, emergency vehicles, and strange people on the pavement outside kept up a constant racket.

And to top it all off, there was a constant 10 minute wait to get hot water, the TV didn't work, and the Internet was extremely unreliable.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean. Staff were helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks:

Floor & nightstands dirty. I would not recommend more than a one night here or more than 2 people to a room, you would literally be climbing over each other. It was also pretty loud all night. Thin walls I guess... I wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Horrible Customer Service! Never Stay There!
review.reviewText: A $231 room ended up totaling $475 with all of the hidden fees, such as for parking (which you don't get access to your car anymore once they park it). The customer service is horrible, the front desk is so rude and not helpful. You end up spending so much more $$$ and it's not worth it.

review.title: Good value in SF!
review.reviewText:
Just on the edge on the Tenderloin, great location, I did not feel uncomfortable walking around at night. (Contrary to the other reviews). 5 min walk to Union Sq., 10 min walk to Chinatown...close to public transpo and is an ideal location as a base for visiting lots of neighborhoods in SF.

Hotel is old, not luxurious by any means. Bed was very comfy and room temp was ok, walls were very thin but I slept with ear plugs no prob. My partner doesn't wear them and she was awoke many times throughout the late night/early morning. 

I would stay here again.

review.title: Ghetto hotel, unfriendly staff

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Conveniently located and fairly good value for money. I was attracted by the location, free breakfast (which was adequate, but my expectations weren't high!) and free wifi (generally good reception). Room was fairly small but very comfortable and some quite funky decor. Very friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is average, but since it's free it saves me time and money when I am rushed in the morning (I was visiting for a conference).
review.locationRemarks: About four blocks form Union Square, many restaurants, shops and tourist attractions nearby - very good location

review.title: Hotel close to attractions and public transport
review.reviewText: friendly, helpful staff; older building but remodeled nicely; European styling; nice breakfast

review.title: Cheap hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is a cheap place to rest for the night if that's all that you want to do. The building is on the older side so do not expect resort like amenities. The rooms are clean and well kept despite the age of the hotel. One peculiar thing is that the windows do not have bars or nets so you can literally poke your head out from the top floor. The location is perfect if you don't have a car as you can pretty much walk to anything and everything in SF. Most of the other attractions are a few min away by public transportation, which is also very close by. Overall I had a good experience with the hotel and the staff aside from the valet guy scratching the hood of my Lexus without notifying me of the damages. It's a minor scuff but definitely noticeable and will require a complete detailing to remove.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is perfect. It is centrally located nearby Union Square and is walking distance to most of what SF has to offer.
review.negativeRemarks: The building is very old so don't expect anything extraordinary. We got a room on the highest floor but it was still looking at the building next door
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market St, SOMA, Chinatown, etc...

review.title: Clean hotel and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Very affordable hotel,everything is new and staffs are friendly.

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText:
First, there was check in clerk with a room full of guests at 7pm. I give it to the sole clerk in the room handling all of the foreign guests. He did the best that he could considering how overwhelming the room was. Valet also took about 25min to arrive. We ended up leaving our car at the garage right next door to the hotel. Better this way because it was $4 cheaper for 24hrs and with in & out privileges. Good thing I didn't mind waiting patiently. 

Second, the room is cozy. The decor in the lobby is a little tacky but hey, that's the SF experience. The king size bed was incredibly comfortable but the pillows were pretty flat and hard. Fix this one factor then the room would have no complaints ! :) 

Third, we asked and was given late check out. But I suppose that news doesn't travel very fast throughout the hotel staff. We got a call from the clerk asking us why we were still in the room past 12pm. Sorry for the confusion ! But we were granted a later check out time.

You get what you paid for: cozy accommodations; an energetic atmosphere; diverse staff. My biggest plus: it's not too far from Union Square ! For the price, I would gladly pay it all over again to be that close to the heart of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Why are the pillows so flat and hard?
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a couple blocks away. Bart transportation is so accessible. Plenty of food and shopping nearby. We are so close to everything !

review.reviewText: The hotel check in person wasn't very kind, nor pleasant. The room was hot and stuffy even during a cold night. I didn't care to open the window for fear of what might enter, and no a/c was available.

review.title: rooms are small, tolerable for 2 nights
review.reviewText: the rooms are really small, my roommate and i had trouble going around fixing our stuff. they had hot showers but it was so weak. The carpets were dingy as well as the hall and elevators, and had a funky smell to it. The staff were nice though and were helpful. the complimentary breakfast were just slices of bread and ready-to-eat waffles and yogurt. you have to pay for the drinking water in your room. it was ok because we were out mostly and only used it for sleeping.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff. in proximity to union square and the bart station

review.title: Do yourself a favor and book elsewhere
review.reviewText: The hotel looks sketchy outside but reception looks OK. I arrived at 9am to drop off my luggage because they couldn't offer an early check-in, which was fine. However, when I came back at 6pm, one of my bags was returned filthy. The toilet in the room I was assigned didn't work, so I called immediately after entering the room. They did send someone up to fix it but things didn't end there. I had to leave for the airport next day at 4am and to my surprise, the shower did not work either and it's not like I had time to have them fix it. As I checked out, I brought this up to the guy in the reception. His reply was to ask if I had reported this, as if the guest had the burden to audit the room and file an exhaustive report before sleeping. Simply ridiculous.

There was a free continental breakfast at the lobby. It might be useful but not good at quality. During my last stay I tried only once because coffee maker and toaster was not working.  I stayed two years and four months ago and it was good last time.  

It was two-bed room and bed was too big in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was near to my son's apartment and to Union Square.

review.title: Not as bad as expected
review.reviewText: From reading other reviews I was very apprehensive about staying here. The hotel was more updated than I thought it would be. It was not a terrible experience and the location was not horrible. Within 2-3 blocks of Union Square and a good location for the price. Some downsides, that I would not consider deal breakers: room temperature was essentially uncontrollable, except for use of a ceiling fan; the hallways were very outdated, but we're not sleeping out there; the breakfast was minimal, but was expected from other's reviews; and it smelt a bit off, not a horrible smell, but it was strange. I would consider staying here again, but it would not be my first choice, unless the updates continue which it seemed they might be. The hotel staff were very helpful in providing directions and a airport shuttle for the end of our stay. Also, I wish the $100 deposit upon check-in was mentioned prior, just for financial planning.
review.positiveRemarks: Not as expensive as others, not a horrible location, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: The smell

review.title: Good location very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was a excellent price for San Francisco. It was just enough it had a clean bed and bathroom. I stayed two nights and felt safe. The location is one block from The tenderloin so you just need to be careful at night not you go down and stay on Geary of Powell Street.

review.title: Not a walking area
review.reviewText: Very close to Tenderloin. Very old room, but not bad. Next time I will spend the extra 50-100 a night for a safer part of town.

review.title: Old Hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and the rooms are tiny. We were near the stairs and it was noisie. It is located in a sketchy part of town. It worked for us because it was walking distance to the start of the Nike half-marathon. I wouldn't stay here alone.

review.title: Doing their best with an old building
review.reviewText: The place was pleasant and well furnished with a very helpful staff. There were some oddities like an extremely shallow closet. Overall fine for a business trip, but not for a romantic vacation.

review.title: A decent place in Union Square
review.reviewText: For its price, actually cheaper than other hotels around Union square..it is pretty decent and accessible to all areas especially the public transportation like the Muni bus, cable car and Bart station at Powell st....and you don't have to worry going to the airport because they have a shuttle for $15...compared taking the Bart train for $9 with all the hassles etc...and they have free breakfast! Lots of resto and stores everywhere...Cons: Poor WIFI internet is super slow and noisy streets at night time...
review.positiveRemarks: The accessibility to all public transport and location...you can actually just walk around downtown...
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the internet services esp the Wifi connection...poor signal

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Just enough. Good bed and shower close to what you want to see and do. Nice staff

review.title: Nice budget hotel, great neighborhood
review.reviewText:
This is a very basic hotel in a great neighborhood very close to downtown.  It seemed strange to us that this room didn't have central AC, but we didn't really need it.  Other than that, the room had everything that we needed for our stay.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Though we couldn't get an early check-in, they were more than happy to store our bags.  They also stored them the next day even though we weren't spending another night!  HOWEVER, do NOT expect much from breakfast.  We were warned when checking in that it would be small, but a table of bread, Eggos, and rotting bananas was what was a "free continental breakfast."  But when one is on vacation, eating out can be one of the best parts!

Overall, this hotel was worth the money we paid for it, and I would stay here again if traveling to San Francisco.  I hope you have found this review helpful.

review.title: Fine hotel but too expensive for standard
Loud Night Life
review.reviewText: The hotel is old. Not as nice as the pics on the web make it seem. No air conditioning and a lot of street noise and people yelling until after bars closed. I think a person could find nicer for the price. Positives were comfortable beds and good Chinese restaurant across the street.

review.title: Very average hotel but friendly staff
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a great location in SF but it is very expensive for what it is. The bathroom was unappealing and the shower was not working well. There was barely enough room to walk between the bed and the desk. The staff is extremely helpful though, and that definitely made my stay better!

Good for people on a smaller budget, especially given how expensive hotels are in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice location

The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you want a clean comfortable room and don't want to spend a fortune I would recommend it. Strictly no-frills. If you expect a plush room with fancy furnishings you should go to the Ritz or Westin but they will cost you 4 times as much.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Security. Close proximity to restaurants, tour buses, cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: The renovation being done right now is rather inconvenient. Completion of it will be a definite improvement.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. Within walking distance of lots of attractions for us. 3 blocks to Union Square, 6 blocks to Chinatown. Lots of restaurants.

review.title: Old everything
review.reviewText:
Stayed there for 1 night since we were on a waiting list for a flight. The lady at the front desk was rude and unhelpful when we checked in. The room we had was not good at all, the carpet was eaten through in some places, dirty with dust and stains in others looking as it hadn't been vacuumed in some time, and the transition from carpet to bathroom tile had a screw sticking out about 1/16" from the ground and I got a small cut from it in the bottom of my right foot. In out bathroom the toilet looked like it had a blocked pipe or somehting because the water would slowly drain out. We stayed there for a necessity, it was only 1 night, but I would still advice anyone to use this hotel as a last resort.
PD The pizza place next door is amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was good, but that's about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Definitely make the rooms look clean, and make sure the facilities are working properly.

review.title: Cheap and close to city
review.reviewText: Room near street  was noisy , was no problem tomove
review.negativeRemarks: Decor,  floor level, breakfast

review.title: Close to downtown. Kinda scary though.
review.reviewText: Check in was a breeze. Hotel was being renovated so there was nothing pretty about the inside. Room wasn't as nice as picture. Could use a lot of maintenance.

review.title: Fair value
review.reviewText:
The room was small but quaint. The bathroom was very small. Received trial size "packets" of shampoo/conditioner. The problem was staff disposed of unused portion so by day 4 I was out of hair product. There is construction, so there was no lobby.  There were no paintings in room, only a mirror above desk. The power strip was plugged into an extension cord in the wall behind the bed/mattress which came unplugged so my phone didn't charge. Not sure this was up to fire code. 
Appreciated room safe. Hotel was convenient and I felt safe walking at night. View was of the building behind us. Travelers were friendly when met in elevator which made trip interesting. 
Might go back once construction is complete.

review.title: Stayed at San Francisco Value for money
review.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights fm 17 to 20 June. Hotel lobby is under major renovation Indian Receptionist not helpful when ask for airline number to call Room window unable to lock
Breakfast place over crowded and lousy
review.negativeRemarks: Near better hotel service staff
review.locationRemarks: Location great walking distance to Macy and bus stop outside hotel

review.title: Older hotel close to Union
review.reviewText:
The biggest negative was that we arrived and the front was boarded up, we go inside and everything is under renovation. It would have been nice to be informed of this, I checked their website and there was no mention of renovations going on. Everything was loud and dirty and under construction with tarps separating the little table they set up as their front desk and the construction area.
The others in our group asked to see our room first before we checked in and they said the room they saw was much worse than the one they ended up putting us in.
The room we were put in was relatively clean but definitely old - window coverings had holes (either torn or burned - didn't inspect them too closely), and one of the sheets had some stain.
Takes 20+ minutes to get your car back if you valet and when we tried to call ahead no one was answering their phones so we had to walk back to the hotel to tell them we needed the car and then wander around for 25 min killing time until they brought it back. Also kind of expensive - $39/day.
Overall the location was good, but for the price I think you could definitely find something better.

review.title: This hotel is under renovation.
review.reviewText:
The entire first floor including the checkin office is under construction.
I called this hotel and requested late checkin, as we were driving in from a long.
We arrived really tired at around 1am and found that hotel is under construction.
The computer system was down, as the checkin office did not exist.
It took over 1hr to let us in to the room, which was on the 3rd floor and considered "finished"
The room had really old, smelly carpet a 1000 year old TV and plumbing. We had to accept it as it was really late and we were tired.
review.negativeRemarks:
this hotel require total demolish
they serve a really mediocre breakfast in a room which is half constructed.
antisanotry conditions

review.title: Noisy hotel in poor neighborhood
review.reviewText: Unsafe neighborhood. Small room with no air conditioning. Windows painted shut

review.title: Solid but not great
review.reviewText: Tight fit for 2 grown men but nice location...During the day...Easy access to downtown and AT&T. Good rate. Nice staff, a little slow but nice. Worth the money.

review.title: Construction is in the way, Breakfast too simple.
review.reviewText: The room itself was not bad for my four nights. My only complaint would be the difficult step into the shower which is in a high-sided Jacuzzi tub. Breakfast, while free, gave you what you paid for, either toast, or toaster waffles, juice or coffee, no more! And it was in a room with bare wood (not hardwood!) floor, and an odd collection of outdoor and indoor furniture. I was happy the fare was the best in walking distance to Moscone where I was attending a conference. It worked, but I would have a hard time recommending it.
review.negativeRemarks: It's breakfast, completing the construction, making it easier to get into the shower.
review.locationRemarks: I was busy at a conference at Moscone the whole time, and it worked fine for that. It was about a 20 min walk there, and another 20 min walk back.

review.title: Poor service, bad smell, and cockroaches ...
review.reviewText: Our room (and especially the bathroom smelled) smelled quite a bit - the carpets need to be changed at the very least. We found two cockroaches. I had to call my room three times in one day and apparently that was an annoyance for the staff at the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell and pests need to be addressed
review.locationRemarks: Good mexican restaurant across the street.

review.title: You must put this hotel in your avoidance list
review.reviewText: You must put this hotel in your avoidance list. Mismanagement, poor Wi-Fi, hazardous rooms and horrible breakfast are the main features of this hotel. I booked a Prepaid Junior Queen Suite in this hotel from expedia for four nights. However, when I checked-in, I was given a cheaper standard queen room. The reception staff could not differentiate between the Junior Queen Suite and standard Queen Room. So, I had to make an overseas call to expedia.sg at 1AM (in San Francisco). Finally, in the morning, I was given a junior king suite. However, that free upgrade could not satisfy me as I could not connect to Wi-Fi properly. Whenever I managed to connect, the speed was horrible. Room heater did not work for a single night. Moreover, in breakfast, they provide only bread, butter, pancake, and coffee. Yes that's all in breakfast! The hotel looks completely different in the pictures provide on expedia.sg. However, in reality, it looks nothing more than an old shop house. I have been to San Francisco multiple times before and I know that much better hotels are there within the same price range. It was a mistake to chose Adante Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is very close to Macy's and all the major branded shops. Historic trams station is also within walking distance.

review.title: Decent stay

review.title: Decent hotel at reasonable price
review.reviewText: The hotel is nothing special, and the rooms are extremely small, even for San Francisco. It is just close enough to Union Square that you don't feel like youre in the heart of the tenderloin district. Overall a nice place, and the staff is very helpful. Be advised it costs $35 + tax, so almost $40 a night to park your car there. They also require about 30 minutes to get you your car via the valet (its in a lot about 8-9 blocks from the hotel).
review.negativeRemarks: room size and price for parking
review.locationRemarks: look online

review.title: Convenient location at a great price!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is an old building...that you should know. It's located right on Geary street, 4 blocks from Union Square and just a walk up the street one or two blocks and you have everything you need...restaurants, liquor stores, good looking and seedy looking bars and very close to shopping. The mattresses are old and the beds are small. The place is heated with radiant heat so that is nice. The windows open so you can get some fresh air and there is a ceiling fan in the room.

I think they must constantly renovate/update this place as it's on the old side but still got plenty of life left. The best part of this visit was the staff. You can also have room service from the mediterranean shop next door, which is convenient. They'll charge $35-$45 (higher price for oversized cars) to valet your car with ins and outs, which is good in SF.

All in all, a great spot that is clean, comfortable and welcoming in a neighborhood known for it's quirkiness and mix of offerings.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the valet parking and the cable TB
review.negativeRemarks: Mattresses could be more comfortable.

review.title: Good location

review.title: Nice hotel despite the area
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice. Clean room, staff was nice, small breakfast. The area surrounding is not so nice. Don't walk around by yourself. But overall a nice experience. I'd recommend it for a weekend.

review.title: Adante Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is undergoing renovation. You are in walking distance of a beautiful environment,; Trolley. Streetcar. shopping, and excursion to most attractions.

review.title: Not a relaxing stay
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco for a short trip to see the A's game & picked a cheaper hotel to save money. It's pretty close to the bad part of San Francisco, but not quite in the ghetto. Just be careful which way you walk leaving the hotel it goes from a decent neighborhood to bad real fast. The room reminded me of staying at my Grandma’s house. It does not have a hotel feel to it at all (not in a good way) you can barely fit 2 people conformably! The walls are sooooo thin! You will see this review a lot but without going into too much detail you can hear everything in the room next to you. I was woken up at 2:00 a.m. to "moans" from a few men. Yes a few men. These were not vague sounds, unfortunately you can hear exact conversations, sounds and banging. There is no a/c just a fan that shuts off randomly throughout the night so it gets hot. Bottom line you want cheap it's a place to keep your things, but can't say you will sleep well. You want to kick back after exploring the city and relax? This is not that hotel either.
review.positiveRemarks: cheap, close to BART, and shopping
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old hotel. They could not fix many of the issues.
review.locationRemarks: If you dont mind walking it's close to food, drinks, shopping, and public transportation.

review.title: Uncomfortable beds, but the location was good.
review.reviewText: It was a last minute booking, didn't expect much for the price. I didn't sleep good at all for both nights, there was huge gaps underneath the doors so it was kind of noisey. When I asked for a receipt when I left and a conformation that I checked out, the woman replied " I'm sorry I can't do that". ??? And the liquor/grocery stores in that particular area were way overpriced, let's just say book a room in advance, and not 4 hours before arrival, haha.

review.title: At the edge of Theater District, okay value
review.reviewText: It is almost too close to some undesirable streets of the city. But still within walking distance to the theater district and union square area. I booked the hotel at the last minute because I missed the conference registration at nearby Hilton. It is okay for the price. No bed bugs or unpleasant experience. Free wifi is a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Update of facility.

review.title: Good location

However, there were no drinking fountain and it does not serve water anywhere so that needs to be improved. There is a water bottle in the room but you have to pay $2 to drink and I think that it expensive for just a bottle of water. But other than that, everything else seemed perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was big for the price and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Shower was a little bit weak. Also, the smell of the room and the elevator was bad.

review.title: Be cautious and have cash ready
review.reviewText: I got there and it took the desk about 15 minutes to decide I had to give them a cash deposit. The amount of the requested cash deposit exceeded the price of the room that had been charged to my credit card. It was near midnight and I wanted to just get to sleep, or I would have gone to another hotel. I had to push hard to get a receipt, but ultimately the desk staffer wrote it out longhand. Later they came to my room with a computer output that did not say I gave them cash and wanted to exchange for the handwritten one; I did not want to risk them putting the cash back on my credit card so I refused to give the handwritten one back. They agreed and allowed me to keep the handwritten receipt. But I felt I was being pushed around. Hotel was not crowded; mainly it was Saturday night and the location is in the SF Tenderloin. A fair number of drugged up people and prostitutes on the street just outside. But I did feel safe in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: A drugged up guy followed me on the street up to the entrance of the hotel. He did not follow me in.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy and lots of drugs/prostitutes on a Saturday night. Might be OK on a weeknight.

review.title: 4 Day Stay
review.reviewText:
Besides the price and the convenience of this location, I cannot say much positive things about it. The building is very run down internally in a part of downtown area with very interesting people on the streets (that is why the hotel entrance is locked from 11am-7pm). The couches at the foyer/waiting area are worn with holes and wears. There is NO bar or a separate quiet sitting area in this hotel. The staff is friendly but tries very hard to selling you various vacation packages. The cleaner or air fresher used in the rooms are absolutely intoxicating. I have to open the door/window for hours to get the odor out. The bed sheets are worn with holes and you can see lint all over the blanket - So if you are allergic to lint - you will have a problem. There is no mini fridge or kettle. Water is provided at cost. There is no personal cleaning supplies provided, besides a very small bottle of shampoo and location. There is a Walgreens 1.5 blocks west where you can get your supplies.

If you are a light sleeper, you will have a serious problem. The walls are paper thin, and you can almost hear everything being said next door. A very good pair of earplugs are highly recommended!!!

If you are out day and night and just need a place for your luggage and to lie down for a few hours over the night, this is an okay place.

Recommended: open the window and door upon arrival if you do not want smell cleaner during the rest of your stay. Check in is not until 3pm.
review.negativeRemarks: New bed sheets, change cleaner/air refresher, a mini fridge needed
review.locationRemarks: good restaurants, art galleries, lots of shopping

review.title: Convient hotel near everything
review.reviewText: It was our first time to San Fancisco & when looking for a hotel we came across this one & decided why not! It was convient & close to everything! All in all it was great!!!

review.title: When nothing else is available
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and, while clean, its facilities are barely adequate. What we did not know when we made the last minute reservation was that its only elevator was not working and scheduled for "upgrade maintenance.' We ended up with a fourth floor walkup. The bathroom was tiny, barely room to turn around. The online photo is misleading. They used a wide angle lens from a very deceptive position making it look like it was bigger/better. Not! Supposedly it is scheduled for a renovation. It needs it.
review.positiveRemarks: It was available at a modest price.
review.negativeRemarks: See experience above

review.title: Not the Greatest
review.reviewText: We were trying to book a four star hotel. The one's we sought were booked. We were booked into this hotel, which by the way is very old and not in the best part of the city. When we arrived the person on duty was very knowledgable and pleasant. He said he hoped that we had been advised that the elevator was broken. (The sign said until December 21 - about 7 weeks from our stay.) The only room we wanted was on the fifth floor. After hiking up the stairs and in the room, we found a bug in the mattress. My wife refused to sleep on the bed and slept in the bathroom, which incidentally had been refinished and was actually fine. The room was OK but very old. The mattresses were not top rate. Those around the outside of the hotel at night were suspicious

review.title: Great value for downtown San Fran
review.reviewText:
This hotel offers the best value for downtown San Fran we could find. The rooms are comfortable and clean; the bathrooms spotless and spacious. The decor is nice, but not to everyone's taste. Some of the basics needs updating, like comforters (looks like they're from the early 90s), TVs, toilet seats, etc... A little inexpensive facelift is just what this place needs.... but then I suppose they would raise the price and the value equation would change.

Good accommodations for your money.
review.negativeRemarks: Some inexpensive updating is needed. Also, parking is extremely expensive if you're not willing to hunt for a cheap parking garage.
review.locationRemarks: Head out of downtown and get to the North Shore or Mission district. Easy to get there by public transit; ask a local.

review.title: Great room on a budget in SF
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in the middle of the city. Considering its only a couple blocks from some of the most expensive hotels in SF, the Adante was a good value. We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was small but very clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was helpful when I needed to print an email. The maid service was prompt.
The hotel restaurant and menu had an Egyptian theme (?) mostly fried stuff. Didn't eat there since there's a lot of good Cafes nearby. Overall I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator is limited capacity. They need to get rid of the amateur jungle paintings on the room walls, we're in the city, right?
review.locationRemarks: Central city location. Close to Union square, Powell St. Bart station, Blues & Biscuits music venue. Also near the classic sports bar Lefty O'Doulls

review.title: Upgraded to a king suite, hotel close to everythin
review.reviewText: We had a better stay then most I read about, because though I had booked a queen room for us to keep prices down, they upgraded us to a king suite on a lower floor, as the elevator was down. This worked great for us! While the place is a little shabby, our room had a huge comfy bed, was dark, and quiet, as the windows faced away from the madness of geary st. The front on the room had the living room section with couch, chair, desk and another tv. It was a very comfy room for us, and an added bonus the have the resting space. We only had to walk up the the second floor, so not a big deal. If we had stayed in the room we booked which was several floors up, and small, maybe we may not have enjoyed it much. The front desk staff we super helpful with giving us maps, directions, booking a wine tour, and giving us safety info of what to avoid in the tenderloin, nearby. The free breakfast was small, but for me bananas toast and a great tea selection was nothing to complain about. Lastly, the location is so close to nightlife, bars, union square, the bart (you can easily get there from the airport), the cable car, all sorts of stuff. I would say that if you are looking for a lower priced hotel in a pricey city, this is a good choice, as it will save you a lot of money on cabs, due to location.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator did get fixed while we were there, which was good.

review.reviewText: My husband and his friend were not as impressed as I was. I thought the room was adorable and was close to most areas of S.F. We basically just slept there. The breakfast was comical, consisting of toast, bananas and Eggo waffles. The wifi was great and overall the stay was pleasant. The gentleman that was the day clerk was rude and aggressive. The evening clerk was very pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the murals in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Have the day clerk enroll in a customer service seminar. Put a safer elevator in the building.

review.title: Handy hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located near union square and easy walk from the Bart ( railway/ underground ) . We caught the Bart from the airport which was easy, to powell st station .

The room was adequate, considering you only sleep in it. Everything worked but just be aware there is no air conditioning and the room can be a bit hot. We managed with the fan going all night.
The lift was abut of an issue as it only holds 3 people and luggage at one time.

BUT having said that I would happily stay there again purely got convenience and the fact the room was nice and clean.

Good value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location , clean and comfy beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a bit hot and the lift antiquated and slow.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to union square, the team (go early morning as it gets very busy), near trolley bus to gishermans wharf (only costs $2).

My roof was a suite for only ____ - a great deal considering 2 blocks down are several very high end hotels.
The bed was comfortable. Free wi fi which would be charged for down the block. Breakfast was nothing much but what can you expect for the price. Teeny elevator but it makes it more like a funky Paris hotel. All the Europeans visitors staying there made it feel that was too.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff I would definitely recommend it to people who like myself, don't spend their time in their rooms but like a good deal.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator stopped working seemingly without any great worry on the part of the staff. Luckily I was on the second floor
