review.title: Hotel in need of repairs
review.reviewText: The day I checked in staff was rude.The hotel in need of repairs.The elevator can hold only 4 persons or 3 persons with baggage also very slow .I stated on the 7 floor and had to go to the 6 floor using the stairs to get ice. The stairs are very steep and there is large window in the stair well. If you happen to miss a step on stairs you could fall out building.
review.negativeRemarks: Customers relationship classes to improve communication .

review.title: S.f. Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was really small, everything looked like it hadn't been remodeled in awhile.
review.positiveRemarks: It wasn't far from market street. Which was nice!
review.negativeRemarks: The whole room. New tvs. New wall paint, bigger space.
review.locationRemarks: It was near the mall. Nice breakfast place called Pinecrest thats a few blocks down.

review.title: good price and location
review.reviewText: Very old hotel. Rooms could do with a makeover. Location and price were good though. Our toilet broke on our last night. Were told it couldn't be fixed until the morning. Toilet in lobby also broken so we just had to persevere and use our broken one. Gross!!
review.negativeRemarks: Old, broken toilet
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to the centre

review.title: Very Disappointing
review.reviewText: At check in, we were very surprised at how dingy the hotel was. The room was tiny. Two people could have touched hands and touched all walls. The toilet over flowed and what they called a continental breakfast was just frozen eggo waffles and a toaster. The pictures online are very deceiving.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovations and if they are going to serve breakfast, at least make it decent.

review.title: Perfectly Adequate
review.reviewText: This was a basic, yet comfortable stay for a place to lay your head after a day of sightseeing. As a budget travelling couple the Adante was perfectly adequate. Right on the edge of the Tenderloin (where although it seemed a little sketchy, we never felt unsafe), the hotel was easy walking distance to Union Square, the cable cars and transit, and lots of eateries. Our room was clean and cleaned everyday. Overall, we were satisfied with our accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Less adventurous travellers could be a little apprehensive

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: no problems great location clean older hotel but room was comfy and clean"
review.positiveRemarks: price and walking distance from bart
review.negativeRemarks: elevator old and slow
review.locationRemarks: Right near bart and cable cars

review.title: Nice hotel not far from downtown
review.reviewText:
The position is good considering the rates. 10 minutes from Powell Station/downtown. The building is obvious not new but rooms are nicely refurbished, especially the toilet room. I asked a back room which is quiet and clean. 3 of us stayed in a 2 double beds rooms and we felt confortable.
Elevator is old but usable. Breakfast is simple, but it's complimentary so I can't complain. Also free wifi is included. At this price, I think it's doing well.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator. Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Not too much nearby. But walking 10 mins you will be in Union Square and downtown. A walgreens is 3 minuts walking.

review.title: Fair facility but good location.
review.reviewText: Locates very close to Union square, room condition is only ok.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The Adante is a lovely little hotel. We loved this hotel because it was only a few blocks from both Union Square and the Cable Car line. It's very close to Market Street and there was Tina of great restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel did offer to book sightseeing and an airport shuttle, both for a small fee, which we didn't do. If English is your first language you'll be fine,oitherwise they can book you stuff in a wide variety if language or multilingual tours. The rooms were clean, the artwork adorable. My husband and I loved it. The rooms are a little small and the free breakfast kind of lacking (just toast, waffles, bananas, coffee and juice) but we spent all of our time out and about in San Francisco (who cares about room size when you're in SF, there's so much to do!) and the food in San Fran is so good, it's worth splurging on some breakfast some days. We enjoyed the hotel and it was great for our honeymoon!
review.negativeRemarks: Not much, maybe the Complimentary breakfast...but I can't complain, it was free!
review.locationRemarks: The location is great! Perfect and close to Union Square, Market Street, Cable Cars and wonderful restaurants are all around.

review.title: Convenience and Cleanliness.
review.reviewText: Good experience but one suggestion...... make sure the bottom sheet on the bed is long enough to "tuck" under at the bottom of the mattress. I do not like when my feet hang over the end of the mattress and touch "bare mattress". There should always be a sheet between the guest and the mattress as a minimum. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: Interesting location..... especially late at night the neighborhood locals come out. I had to go out at 3:45 A.M. and it was interesting to see.
review.locationRemarks: Interesting location..... especially late at night the neighborhood locals come out.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
- cheap hotel within walking distance to the Union Square and the cable cars
- very basic hotel, you get what you pay for but all in all not a bad place to stay for a short period
review.positiveRemarks: very close to market street and Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: unhelpful staff
review.locationRemarks: very close to Market street, cable cars, Union Square

review.title: great stay, excellent front of house staff
review.reviewText: Front desk lady was fantastic, she helped us out with the map of the city and pointed out her favourite places and told us which areas were safe, where to get good food etc. The hotel is in an older building so you can tell its a bit worn but it is cozy, clean and comfortable. Great location a few blocks from union sq and market st for all public transport needs. Plenty offered for breakfast - toast, toaster waffles, fruit, coffee, juices, hot choc or tea selection. Overall had a great stay
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a little bit uncomfy
review.locationRemarks: Great, close to public transport

review.title: Not good for families.
review.reviewText:
The ceiling fans in the room did not work and there was only one girl in the front desk and she could not leave the front desk, there was nobody to help us out hence, the heat in the room was unbearable.

You needed to be a telecommunications expert to be able to figure out the remote control for the TV in the room. The same thing, we called the front desk and no way - José, the person who could have helped out was not in - would be back at 11:00 PM!
review.negativeRemarks: Room service or lack thereof.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Bathroom acts as a bonus room
review.reviewText: Large bathroom made it possible to put a portable crib in it so that nap time doesn't mean everybody has to be quiet when your baby / toddler is sleeping. Other than that the hotel was typical for a SF downtown hotel that does not cost much more than $100 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is rough if you have a car. Garages range from $30-50 a night. Street parking is metered from 9-6pm.
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to Union Square and most downtown attractions.

review.title: Nice and cheap hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean room, nice bed. Downtown, easy to find.

review.title: Perfect location, Quiet
review.reviewText: Only 5-6 blocks from BART stations, 3 blocks from cable car. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Condition of building VERY nice for age of building (1920ish?). All around a very pleasurable stay. would definetly use again when in town. Be sure to try the Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant across the street- no asian decor, but incredible food!

review.title: Decent, clean, well located hotel in union square
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for one night and had their light continental breakfast in the AM. Even though I was early for check in, the concierge let me keep my bags with them, and I ended up being able to check in an hour early. The staff was very polite, and the rooms were clean - nothing fancy but clean. There is a Mediterranean fast food place connected to the downstairs entrance, but you don't hear any of the noise from either the eatery or the street. All in all, an affordable place to stay for a night. Nothing grand but it did the job!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was really friendly and let me keep my bags free of charge in their bag room all day after I had already checked out.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress was pretty lumpy - woke up sore the next day. But if you're only there for a short stay, it's not that bad.
review.locationRemarks: You're only a five minute walk down the street to the heart of union square. Probably not the best area to walk around late at night, though.

review.title: Room smelt like urine and hotel run down, but good
review.reviewText: Room smelt like urine and hotel run down, but good service

review.title: You could do much better.
review.reviewText:
The bathroom was newer than the bedroom, however the hot water didn't work properly, if at all at times, in the shower. There was no air con (which I initially thought was fine as the weather was pleasant enough) but then I realized that some pigeons have a nest nearby my window. I couldn't open it, as if I opened it wide enough, I was sure one of them would fly it. There was a ceiling fan, with one setting.

I have partly myself to blame, I left searching for accomodation til the last minute on a weekend in San Francisco that was very busy (a Google convention, Beach to Bay, 2 art fairs etc). Still, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Nikki
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were pleasant enough. The location was good.

review.title: recommende
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is very good and convenient. It also has free WIFI and free breakfast. However, I wish the staff at the front desk could be more friendly. Also the elevator limit is too low--only 3 passangers with luggages at a time!
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast included; free WIFI; good location.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff at front desk should be more friendly. The elevator feels unsafe.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good. Cable car station and bus station are near. Union Square, Macy's, Forever 21 and a lot of restaurants are all within walk.

review.title: Pretty nice for the price
review.reviewText: Room was very clean and simple. Union square is a 7 minute walk away. For travelers on a budget, this hotel serves nicely.

review.title: Nothing wrong with a traveler's hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a work conference because they had a much better rate than the fancy hotels down the street. I paid $200 less per night than my colleagues. It's obviously not a new hotel, don't expect Taj Mahal, it's a quick small place for people who need a bed and a shower. Adante needs a bit more upkeep, but at the same time it better than a lot places I've been before. No smoke or mildew smells anywhere I was in the hotel (and I have a pretty sense of smell). I didn't eat the breakfast because I'm not an Eggo eater but everyone else seemed to enjoy them. Overall the hotel itself is fine for quick travelers but I wouldn't bring my daughter to these streets. Hotel personnel were excellent. But you have to understand you're not staying at the Ritz, there's no doorman or anything and it takes a moment to get your key, but they were always curteous and offered help before I asked. They are as accommodating as they can be given there are some things out of there control. They let me check in very early, but the next guests couldn't because there was not a room available for their reservation but that's not Adante's problem. The housekeeping staff was kind and kept my room well. Overall they were great for what they are, a small and perfectly fine hotel for people on the go.
review.locationRemarks: It's on the border of when the neighborhood began to be a little sketchy. Not a family location but fine for adults on the move.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Staff helpful. Nice and close to Union Square. Did bot quite expect the shared toilet/showers which were a bit audible from other spaces, but should have checked more closely. Fine on value for money.

review.title: A Place to Sleep
review.reviewText: Hotel is older, but well kept. Elevator holds only 3 with luggage, so that could be a problem. Room was clean but small. Breakfast was primarily frozen waffles, bread and jam and bananas, as well as coffee.

review.title: Great location, stuffy room
review.reviewText: Great location, bad air quality in the room, hotel is a little outdated,
review.negativeRemarks: Air quality in the room
review.locationRemarks: Location

review.title: Ok for just a night to sleep.
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for only a night, it was ok. The building is very old and needs to be updated.
A lot of things needs to be fixed: The door knobs, shower knobs, bathroom floors...
Service was good. Complimentary breakfast was ok too, just a little something to fill your tummy before you head out, not much in there, bread and banana, and a few drinks, coffee, tea, and a couple of juices. If you are driving do not park where the hotel say you park...it is very expensive (30$-45$) we were able to find an overnight parking and a descent one for only $10! Only half a block away. This hotel is good for just resting or sleeping, only 1, maximum 2 night stay.

review.title: Good but can be better
review.reviewText:
Close to Powell cable car and many things to do downtown, you dont need a car if you sleep there !
This is a great hotel by it's location. The breakfast is ok, Wifi has to be paid though.. :(
By night, despite the safe area of downtown, there are many homeless or alcoolics people around the entrance.. this is quite ennoying.
If I can suggest the Thai restaurant just at the end of the block, cheap and so nice, this would complete your trip :)
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi and -really- slow elevator
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell cable car and many things to do downtown, you dont need a car if you sleep there !

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Very good experience. Location is perfect if not fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Personnel.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great Area, great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and the rooms are very spacious, the staff were amazingly accommodating when I had flight issues, and they let us keep our bags in their luggage locker until the flight even after we checked out. Only complaint was a few floors smelt like guests were smoking in the rooms, but I don't think the hotel can be blamed for a few bad eggs. Definitely would consider going back. Plus the Egyptian restaurant connected to the lobby is fantastic and hotel friendly. Consider shopping around for the best price though-- found out after the fact.

review.title: ok but not exactly in union square
review.reviewText: hotel is on the border between the lively union square area and the much poorer tenderloin neighborhood. the room/hotel was generally clean but not very comfortable.

review.title: Not too much to offer.
review.reviewText: You really do get what you pay for. Parking was difficult at best--told NOT to use Valet?? Really? Breakfast was frozen waffles/bananas/toast/coffee/juice. Good location--easy to get to everything.

review.title: Worth it!
review.reviewText: The decor is a bit old-fashioned, but the hotel works on every aspect it should work: cleaning is well done, staff is nice and willing to help (with one exception), there is a lift, ice machines, coffee-maker, coffee and tea in the room; breakfast is simple but ok, there is a computer and printer for guests to print documents and boarding passes, they can also book a good shuttle for the airport. The location is also good, around 15min from Union Square, 20min to cable car station. I think it is definitely worth the money, compared to more expensive hotels in the city.

review.title: Best deal in SF
review.reviewText: I've stayed in numerous hotels in San Francisco over the years, and The Adante is the best bargin you can find. It's about half the price of the other "2-3 star hotels" and a lot better!

review.title: change the toilet seat please
review.reviewText: Hotel is really.run down. Wish they will pay more attention to basic upkeep the hotel. My room toilet seat is so worn out. I dare not even sit on it. don't expect warm friendly welcome. But generally they are efficient. They will do the stuff you request in a very chop chop manner. guess overall, for the price i should not expect much right? Just hope that they will keep to their minimum upkeep of the hotel. Toilet seat needs to be changed. Location is very convenient. But i really don't like Geary street, apart from the theatre there. It is usually dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet seat
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, just 3 blocks from union square.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText:
OPINIONS:

The room was small, but ok. The price was excellent compared to the other rates I was seeing that week. Not the best block in the area. Lot's of homeless and random people milling about. Many of the people that I saw staying there looked a bit sketchy...

FACTS:

The water pressure and temperature were severely lacking. I could barely get what I would call "luke warm" water in the shower...

The main issue I had was the day I checked in. The police had one of the other guests on the floor in the hall when I got there. Not exactly what you expect to see as a business traveler.

It was cheap though ($79/nt) and it served the purpose. Lots of restaurants and shopping within 5 blocks. I wouldn't want my wife to stay there alone, but it was fine for me.
review.negativeRemarks: neighborhood, other guests, safety
review.locationRemarks: lots of dining and shopping within 5 blocks. Homeless people.

review.title: Opinion from Down Under
review.reviewText: I thought the price was excellent compared to similar hotels. The room was certainly clean enough and with good room service. The position is central and very good. It is a busy hotel and on one occasion a young female guest engaged in a huge fight with a guy that woke myself and others guests up in the early morning. It took a long time for the police to arrive. Having said that I can still recommend this hotel. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great budget hotel
review.reviewText: It s quiet. I enjoy my sleep. The room is clean. The service is decent.

review.title: Student friendly accommodation
review.reviewText: Everything was fine apart from checkout. I've been to hotels before where they let you extend your stay a few hours extra without charge if you have a late flight to catch. The same courtesy would go very far
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy extracted/ventilator in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great, union square.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price, really great location. Near to union square and lot of restaurants. Breakfast could be better.

review.title: good for students, economic hotel
review.reviewText: the service is very good, and the location is very convenience, you can walk to the union square, many restaurants nearby. it is not a luxury hotel, the breakfast is very simple, but consider of the price, I think it is worthy.
review.negativeRemarks: the whistle of the fire truck
review.locationRemarks: very good, convenient and safe

review.title: bad customer services!!
review.reviewText: staff never answered call from our room, and frontdesk person is NOT kind at all. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Not so cheap near Union Square, and noisy hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is an old, small hotel. I knew this going in so that was not a surprise. I was disappointed by how noisy the hotel was. The stairs (which EVERYONE seeemed to take because the cramped tiny elevator was too small and very slow!) made alot of noise. Internet access was very slow and intermittant.

I am VERY surprised by how many hotels that seem to cater to business travelers have such poor internet access. The price of service and routers has come down so much that it is surprising how many hotels just have bad internet!

Also, there is a single person working behind the desk. When there is any kind of a line to check in, it can take forever(!!!!) to check in.

If you are just looking fr a tiny place near Union Square to sleep and bathe, then this might be the hotel for you, but be ready for a slow and noisy time while you are here.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was OK, for a last minute rental near Union Square, but I certainly would not say it was cheap!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, noise, noise!
review.locationRemarks: Rough location, lots of homeless people around

review.title: good place to stay in SF downtown
review.reviewText: Quite good and affordable hotel near union square.

review.title: Comfortable and very clean hotel!
review.reviewText:
My experience was good. My girlfriend and I really enjoy our staying for almost a week.
The service was very good.
Some disadvantages are: location is three blocks from main street where you take most of the buses, but If you don't mind walking everyday this is a good choice; another thing is there's only one elevator and quiet slow.
Overall I had a wonderful week!
review.negativeRemarks: one elevator and breakfest.
review.locationRemarks: It's three blocks far from Powell St, which is the primary street to take buses and cable car.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: Great experience. Great location, if you like downtown areas.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: Though there was no problem in bath tub, no hot water was in shower.
review.negativeRemarks: No hot water in shower

review.title: Very pleasant experience
review.reviewText: This hotel will celebrate its 100th anniversary in 2014. It is an old, small hotel but very well maintained. Rates are extraordinarily low considering what you get: a clean room, a large bathroom (at least in our room), a firm bed, coffee machine, TV, iron and board, great shower with lots of hot water, and a continental breakfast (coffee/tea, assorted muffins, toast, and bananas). A 5-min walk from Union Square. Very courteous and pleasant staff. Neighborhood has MANY small cafes within a block, including a tremendous Chinese fish restaurant across the street and the Marakesh restaurant a block away (on O'Farrell). Downsides: rather small room, no closet (but a clothes rack on the wall), streets a bit dicey after 10pm. But overall, the value cannot be beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Favorites: value, location, clean, courteous staff
review.negativeRemarks: Least favorite: smallish room, no clothes closet.
review.locationRemarks: A 5-10 min walk from Union Square, Macy's etc. Right on the 38 bus line.

review.title: First time excellent, second time just OK
review.reviewText: It is my second time in this hotel. I came back because my first experience was excellent. A big room with a nice bathroom,.... This second time, my experience has been a little worse, but anyway the location, cleanliness,... was OK, but the size of the room, the bath and the WIFI were quite disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed of Internet and the size of the room

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: The breakfast is free, wifi too. But the locatione is a litte far from downtown.

review.title: Good hotel for my needs.
review.reviewText: Older hotel, not a 5 star, but, easily fulfilled my needs. Centrally located. I will stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: close to bars, restaraunts, the theatre distric and Union Square.

review.title: Meh, Save Some Bucks and Walking
review.reviewText:
Well, you get what you pay for. Room was small BUT clean. Older hotel, could use updating the wall paper and paintings drawn on the wall and framed??! The continental breakfast was like buying a cupcake and juice at 7 eleven. The lobby's ok, but who sits in a lobby anyway? Parking is $35 but you can save yourself $5 bucks by parking two doors down from the hotel at the enclosed parking lot and paying $30 for 24 hour parking with an attendant there around the clock. The really good thing? Is that is only 5 blocks from Union Plaza! Just walk left out of the hotel, and straight down Geary and you're there! Yes Martha, there are bums asking you for change but just say no and your good (the bum's are looking for the rich folks anyway). Walking out of the hotel to the right towards Polk and Van Ness Streets will cause you to walk through the "Tenderloin" where it's gets pretty sketchy and you will encounter a lot of bums.
Overall, this hotel is a place of convenience and not luxury.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Located between "the Tenderloin" and Union Square

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Small cozy rooms. Bed wasn't most comfortable but would stay here again. Great place for the price. Great location. $30 for 24h parking next door.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The location was excellent. Some might be turned off by the room size and or by the amount of homeless people in the downtown area but that is San Fran. I would stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: Located in downtown San Fran. We were able to walk to China town and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: staying during a professional meeting
review.reviewText:
Stayed four nights for a conference and we were on a tight budget. The hotel is located very close to key places like chinatown and market street. We were able to walk several places without difficulty or fear. Some streets are edgy but the hotel is still in a safe place. The room was small but clean and had everything we needed. The beds were not the most confrotable ones. If you are going for a resort type of experience, not your place. If you are under a budget and looking for a nice place to stay, where your things are safe, and you get clean bathrooms, towels, tv and such, then this is it. I would stay there again, since we don't like to spend all our traveling budgets in hotels you only go to sleep on.

Our flight was late at night, so we were able to store our bags in safe room which was nice. The room came with a coffee maker which was very handy, and they give you coffee and tea bags. Breakfast was simple: coffee, tea, orange juice, bread (a toaster), bananas and jelly. Enough to get the day going.
review.positiveRemarks:
small, quaint. good service.
free internet and breakfast
coffe maker with supplies
Egyptian restaurant next door
storage for bags after checking out.
review.negativeRemarks:
upstairs neighbors were loud and we could hear them a couple of times
room was a little dark
no cell-phone reception in the rooms, only in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: close to everything

review.title: Cheap and Run-down
review.reviewText:
Not a great place at all.
1. Bad area (very loud and lot's of homeless people, etc.
2. Staff did not make wake up call that I requested even after I reminded them five hours earlier.
3. Poor breakfast....very limited variety. (toast, coffee, juice)
4. Small, run-down rooms.
5. Elevator very slow.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff...not friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Very unsafe.

review.title: overall reasonably great stay and recommand

My sister and I enjoyed staying hereexcept: 1. Homeless people and drug users all around 2. Holes on my blanket for entire stays although I stayed first 4nights then another day after 5th night at other hotel.we got same room and blanket got worse condition somehow.probably by drug addicts. 3. No refregerator no microwave so a bit expensive stay 4.key problems and slow small elevator that could only fit 3ppl at a time. Other than these I was very please to stay

review.title: Functional Lodging

review.negativeRemarks: limited breakfast selection. No water at breakfast. Room water bottles were provided but were $2 per bottle.

review.title: Adante hotel
review.reviewText: The Adante hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Union Square, and for the price, is good value. It is an older, slightly run down hotel though, so you do get what you pay for. The staff were pleasant, and offered us a room upgrade on arrival.

review.title: ok room for this price and in SF
review.reviewText: good room, but don't expect anything special. Elevator is up to 3 persons which is a annoyance during check out time when everybody is leaving. Breakfast is minimal, don't let it play a role in your choice for this hotel. But when you just want a clean room with bathroom then this hotel is ok for this price.
review.positiveRemarks: nice bed, clean bathroom and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: elevator is unusable considering the amount of people that need to use it.

review.title: Good budget hotel
review.reviewText: It is a OK budget hotel. Being very close to Union Square it is a good choice. Do not expect a hearty breakfast that includes bare limited items.

review.title: no hotel parking.
review.reviewText:
No hotel parking.
Not enough electric outlet for devices.

review.title: Good location but...
review.reviewText: We were forced to pay $50 for parking which we were not made aware of until after our bill came, as the hotel desk attendant when we checked in did not provide us with correct information. The room was clean; however, the comforter looked very old and had rips in it. It was extremely hot in our room and we couldn't keep the ceiling fan on because it made a loud clicking noise. Our sick didn't drain, and while the front desk offered to move us, by the time we noticed that there was a problem we had already unpacked and it was late and we just wanted to go to sleep. Overall, the staff there was very friendly and tried to be helpful; however, I am just glad we only had to stay there for one night.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy check in and check out
review.negativeRemarks: Paying a LOT for parking.

review.title: Nice and basic, proper hotel

review.negativeRemarks: The shower's dial was confusing to us Europeans

review.title: bad hotel

review.title: Alright to stay in downtown
review.reviewText:
I guess overall it's an OK hotel for the price in downtown SF. It's within blocks from union square and has bus route right in the front if you know how to take the bus.

Room was really small but it's ok since we didn't spend too much time there. There are diff groups of people staying there, it makes me a little scared. The neighborhood is safe from my experience, but there are several homeless walking around the street though.

If you choose to stay here and coming from Bart station, get off from Powell Station, NOT xxx-center (the previous one which may looks closer on map) and walk on Powell and Geary. South part of Geary is dangerous with crazy people.
review.positiveRemarks: a very good restaurant next door

review.title: Horrible

The only available area was on a street where parking was not allowed. The beds we small, the staff wasn't helpful, and the hotel was a dive. DO NOT STAY HERE.

review.title: Not a good hotel !!!

The hotel is one of the worst ever , I know that it is a 2 starts but the room was tiny the bads was not a queen size but a normal single size. The bathroom was so tiny that i could not turn on myself.
The guy of the night shift was really rude and not friendly.
For sure i will not raccommand it.

I wish i could have pictures.

review.title: Great value for the location

Older hotel, but with the murals painted all over, it was very quaint and pleasant. Only problem we had was that the cable was out, so we were unable to watch television and catch up on the news. Parking was only $25 two doors up, so very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Television didn't work
review.locationRemarks: Great location just a few blocks from Union Square.

review.title: do not stay here
review.reviewText: staff where soooo unfriendly and unprofessional never seen this before ever...........

review.title: No frills, but serves the purpose.
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located to bus lines, food and other areas of town. If you're on the streets after dark, you might want to keep your eyes open, but that's true about many areas downtown. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Will stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Questionable after dark. Small room.

review.title: Not too shabby.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel last minute. It was a good deal for the area. The room I was in was VERY small, but worked for what I needed. Bathroom was clean, nice shower/tub combo, and the staff was nice.The free breakfast has very little variety (toast, bananas, apples, muffins, yogurt, coffee and juice). If you are looking for a hotel to relax in and spend time in your room, this would not be a place you would want to stay, but if all you need is a shower and a decent place to sleep, this is a good deal.
review.negativeRemarks: The SMALL and SLOW elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square. Walking distance to shopping and places to eat.

review.title: Good for business and fast trip.
review.reviewText: Nice experience, room was clean, continental breakfast every morning, nice location.
review.negativeRemarks: No room service
review.locationRemarks: Good for the purpose I needed it

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText: Check in and out was a breeze. A very pleasing stay, and all we needed:) Great for folks on a budget. Front desk clerk was very nice and approachable. Continental breakfast was timely replenished. Four minute walk to union square, and easy 15-20 minute walk to AT&T park. Saved $5 on overnight parking by parking myself at the garage right next door (and I think that's where the valet parks the cars anyhow). Probably a better hotel if you are only staying a couple of nights and will be spending the majority of your time out exploring the city (no pool, gym, spa). I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: close to a variety of restaurants and cuisines, shopping, and BART

review.title: San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: A comfortable clean hotel. Room was well prepared with good amenities, free safe was particularly useful. Close to bus route, cable cars, shopping and metro station enabling access to all tourist attractions in San Francisco. Continental Breakfast was basic but adequate. Good value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: Situated just beyond Union Square but handy for central amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Lift was designed for '3' people, so families beware.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for bus, metro, cable car access.

review.title: Cozy atmosphere
review.reviewText: The deepest impression about Adante is its cozy atmosphere, which makes my parents like it a lot. The room size is not big, and the elevator is very small and can hold only three people with luggages. But those aren't much of a problem to me.

review.title: I will stay here again
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this hotel. Highly possible that I will stay in this hotel again when I travel to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator was slightly slow

review.title: The Best budget hotel

review.negativeRemarks: size of the room

review.title: The worst hotel I have ever seen
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I have ever been at in my whole life. Even if I got a room here for free, I would not go. They are good at Internet advertising. That's it. The room was dirty. The sink in my bathroom was cracked in the middle. The bed looked like it had been used in WWII. The room was small and last renovated in the 60s and even then it must have looked awful. The people at the reception were unhelpful. And beware: I am not picky. There are no positives.
review.negativeRemarks: Stench in the room coming from the bathroom.

review.locationRemarks: 1st time in San Francisco, stayed 1 night, very centrally located to downtown & the Port. I was able to get some great exercise in while site seeing.

review.title: Adante
review.reviewText: wanna give 3.5 stars to this hotel. Pros: cheap, coveniently located, clean, and helpful staff. Cons: no air conditioner (only ceiling fun. I caught cold because of this), many homelesses. If the hotel told me that I could control the room temperature by opening the window, I would give 4 stars.

review.title: Great vacation!
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly. A unique boutique hotel. A great european feel. Really enjoyed our stay. Close to public transportation. Bus right outside door. Would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Its European feel. Authentic San FRan experience.

review.title: Adante Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located to Union Square and accessible to public transportation. There are many coffee shops, a few clubs with live music and many restaurants. It is great value for the price.

review.title: not bad!
review.reviewText: Great location, room was small, but what do you expect in the city?! It was perfect for the price, and I will probably stay there again on my next visit
review.negativeRemarks: nothing too bad

review.title: Quaint artistic 100 year old hotel in San Francisc
review.reviewText: It was a wonderfully artistic 100 year old building with lots of charm and character. and modest. it was well located. A pleasure to stay if you don't want your hotel to be your entertainment. I am going to stay there every time I go to the city. Interesting art and murals. Great staff.

review.title: A real cosmopolitan, Franciscan experience
review.reviewText: This hotel isn't luxury by any means, but that is what made the stay more enjoyable. It was perfectly located away from Union Square toward the Tenderloin and Cathedral Hill. It was also great for public transportation as the Route 38 to Sunset goes right past it, and it is very accessible to other lines as well. Finally, because it is a budget hotel you have a wide variety of guests. I met people from Denmark, Scotland, Germany, Mexico, Spain, France and Japan. You get a better San Francisco experience staying this little place.
review.negativeRemarks: Stairs were narrow and the elevator was too slow
review.locationRemarks: Just west of Union Square (about 3 or 4 blocks) on the periphery of the Tenderloin. Good walking distance to downtown and bus lines.

review.title: old bldg
review.reviewText: Toilet didn't flush, i will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Nice little hotel, not for Mr/Ms Clean.
review.reviewText: Friendly staffs and helpful front desk. The room is comfortable, but the toilet lacks maintenance. Linens are clean but the bath towels are yellowish and aged. Overall acceptable and definitely worth its price. Recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful front desk staffs. Cheap groceries from marts nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath towels, trashy toilet bowl cover.
review.locationRemarks: While the glam part of town is on the left side, the right side is a ghetto. Full of homeless people and hookers. Not safe for girls to walk alone.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText:
This is a get what you pay for hotel. Better than cheaper hostels. However, not as nice as some other slightly more expensive hotels.

This was a comfortable stay.

On the down side i left my phone in the room on check out and when i returned it was gone :-(

review.title: Good - only to sleep for the night.
review.reviewText:
I stayed on the Hotel four nights on my visit to San Francisco. The room was clean, decent and safe. However, the shower did not work properly, it could be set either too hot or too cold! In addition the ironing table had some issue with the lock, so once opened I could not close it again.

The WiFi access from my room was spotty, always dropping. On the other hand, WiFi worked perfectly from the lobby, which was useful to check the news before going out.

If you want to catch some fruit (bananas) for breakfast you should go early morning. After that it will be muffins, bread and jam.

Location was great, very near Union Square, and BART and Muni stations. On the surroundings of the hotel there were always people begging.

It is an affordable alternative if you are only staying there to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: shower and neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance from Union square, China town and Market street.

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Very friendly, but the rooms are fairly small and it seemed very noisy outside in the surrounding area at night and we could not fall asleep til late. Also, the bed was uncomfortable! But the rooms were clean and service was nice.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText:
I had a really nice stay. The staff were friendly, and helped me with any issues that I had, and the hotel room was clean and comfortable.

I was on the 7th floor, and the hotel is situated in downtown San Francisco, coming from a big city, I knew to expect loud people on the street, and sirens throughout the night and day, which did occur. This didn't bother me one bit for I had my window open the whole time.

If you are looking for a great hotel, located right in the middle of downtown, walking distance to everything, then go here. I stored my car in the parkade a few doors up the street in the which worked out great. $25/day for three days of parking. No hassles.
review.locationRemarks: right downtown, not the classiest place around, but also not the grungiest place.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: It's a disgrace to call it a hotel lift gets stuck nobody for bags laundry you have to fetch at reception nobody tells you to fetch it there continental breakfast in the foyer of the hotel although it was included I ate breakfast elsewhere it should come off your site as it was more expensive than the Washington hotel you recommended building is dilapidated can go on and on for more but it's enough
review.negativeRemarks: All
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: Very reasonable for the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very good deal considered the price per night. You're in downtown SF, close to Union Square and to the Moscone conference center. Every now and then, there is a receptionist that tries to sell you something that does not make sense (e.g. a ride to the airport with a shuttle that needs twice the time of the BART and costs four times the money), but with a healthy portion of common sense, you skip that anyway. Don't even try the breakfast it's the standard continental brown water + sugar cone (called muffin), but there are a bunch of nice places very close (Grand Cafe, David's Delicatessen) that serve very good breakfast. Overall, it's clean, pretty quiet and reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: borderline

review.title: Will try a different one next time
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine and location is good, the room was OK, I didn't like the wall paintings, the water in the bath tub was not hot enough, there was no complimentary breakfast, not even a cup of coffee
review.negativeRemarks: No hot water

review.title: good and convinent location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located in the very good location. a few blocks to the left is the union square and few blocks to the rights has lot of homeless people. Bus station stop outside the front door of the hotel and very easy and short distance walk to other public transport likes cable car, tram, train and other bus route.
Continental breakfast is OK and free access to WIFI
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi and close to public transport and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: too many homeless to the right of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: a few blocks to the left is the union square, short distance walk to other public transport likes cable car, tram, train and other bus route.

review.title: Great value, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: For the price this is a great place to stay in San Francisco. It is clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful and it is close to union square. Continental breakfast is fine. The area is a little on the border of a less desirable neighborhood, but the bus is right outside and walking to union sq or market street shopping is not a problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish the juice bar was opened for light meals or snacks.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to union square was fine. A little scary going the other way!

review.title: It's just okay..
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient coz it's in downtown but I can hear upstairs when I tried to fall asleep.

review.title: Union Square is walking disntance
review.reviewText:
The hotel is cheap and close to Union Square.
Is old but the people is working together and cooperative.
review.locationRemarks: union. square and Fishermas wharf

review.title: best you can do on a low budget
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were polite and prompt. The architecture is interesting, although the building's a bit dingy. My chief complaint was that my room had a faint odor, sort of like sweaty armpits. All in all, it's nothing to get excited about, but it's satisfactory if you're on a tight budget and want to be a few blocks away from the Civic Center area.
review.locationRemarks: I found the business center of the city depressing because of the skyscrapers and homeless people, who were a bit more agressive than beggars I've encountered in other cities. The bay, on the other hand, was more pleasant, with a better perspective on the surrounding landscape. Also the architecture in Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf was more appealing. There were panhandlers everywhere, but they were more thinly distributed outside the main business district. The pigeons are aggressive too! I saw one fly into a girl's face. Pigeons and panhandlers were my main impression of San Fransisco. Not too eager to go back. I saw one bum holding a cardboard sign which read, "Pigeons stole my parents! Need $$ to buy a gun to fight the #!*% pigeons!"

review.title: Please choose other location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located near the Union Square and that's it.
review.locationRemarks: I definitely recommend Intercontinental Hotel. One of my colleagues stayed there and it was nice!

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText:
The hotel is small and the ventilation in room is not good. The service is also not great. Only the location is good. But I guess there are other hotels in the same location. Breakfast is useless. There are no proper tables to sit and have breakfast. Just has bread, toaster and a coffee/tea vending machine.

Room TV is useless. Shower is not all that great. Had to wait for the water to heat up.

Overall, it's not a good hotel especially if you are staying for more than a night.

review.title: convenient San Fran Location
review.reviewText: ideally situated near Union Square, the Adante proved to be a fine place to stay. Not expesive, and the rooms were good- it is an old building, but full of character- ice machine outside our door was a pain ( seemed to be a magnet for us this holiday!). breakfast- basic but adequate- plenty to eat, refills tea, coffee and juice.

review.title: Happy with this hotel
review.reviewText:
On arrival, the female receptionist did not look up or greet us. I stood at the desk for some time before she made eye contact after which she was always abrupt. Until I asked her name and then her manner changed remarkably.
We stayed for a week, the male recption clerk was pleasant and obliging.
Our room was somewhat small but adequate and comfortable and clean. The beds were very comfortable and housekeeping was excellent.
A very nice breakfast was available every morning.
review.locationRemarks:
After 1 night at a hotel on Lombard St. then 3 days at Yosemite, We came back to the Adante in the Union Square area. This is the place to stay. Close to the hotel we had a variety of restaurants, all good and not expensive. There was also a shop that sold groceries, fresh fruit, wine, cheeses etc.
We were close to the trolley to go to Fisherman's Wharf. We were walking distance to the park with outdoor restaurant and bar and a variety of other restaurants, bars, pubs and shops from Maceys to Saks. We could walk to Chinatown. I was comfortable walking down to the shop for chocolate after dark. Place to be !

review.title: The rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms stink, they need to be cleaner, good value.

review.title: Good hotel for traveller
review.reviewText: Good location, near union square; bus stops nearby and can easy to go any place. Room is small but comfortable and clean. Reception is warm and helpful. Free wifi and breakfast. It is a litter noisy in the evening but it did not disturbance my sleep. Satisfied.
review.locationRemarks: near bart station or union square. Convenient.

review.title: do not stay at the Adante
review.reviewText:
No air conditioning. Fan set to go off after about 30 minutes! If you open the windows it is so, so noisy!
No hot water for shower if on the seventh floor. Enough space for about five people to sit for continental breakfast.
It smells so we had to buy a can of air spray!!
DO NOT STAY HERE!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square . Easy to get everywhere.

review.title: Will Not Recommend This Hotel... Hotel Staff is very unfriendly
review.reviewText:
Hotel Staff is very unfriendly and the breakfast time is very unpleasant: There is not a seat available to have breakfast, no spoons, no milk...

The room service is nice and efficient. The room comfort is ok.

Will not recommend this hotel and will not come back because the hotel staff service is very limited and not nice and the breakfast is extremely limited.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square: close to the main attractions and transportations

review.title: Pathetic
review.reviewText: the experience is simply pathetic. Choose some other hotel in the area.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Handy location. In suspect neighbourhood. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast could be improved especially with more seating. Unfortunately the lift broke down which seems to be quite common, we were on the 7th floor!!!!!!

review.title: Boutique?
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel with some remodeling and a fresh coat of paint. It's worn and not uncomfortable, but not what I think of as "boutique". It's a short walk to Union Square, but the neighborhood drifts quickly from tourist status. It's a decent budget hotel.

review.title: Good Overall
review.reviewText: The neighboorhood was a little iffy. But the hotel and staff was great. I would go back again. There was also good Thai restaurants in walking distance.

review.title: Reasonable, but loud
review.reviewText: Clean, reasonable rates, but thin walls--had to get ear plugs.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: OK

review.title: Do Not Stay Here!!!
review.reviewText: This way, by far, the worst hotel I have ever visited. The light over my bed turned on by itself every hour my 1st two nights. I called the desk and they did nothing. The walls are paper thin...you can hear everything in the hall, the next room and outside. The maids did not replace toiletries. The front desk people were very rude and not helpful. This is not a great location. Lot's of homeless and beggars. I was not expecting a 4-star hotel, but this was insane. The breakfast consisted of toast and coffee and juice. Now you have been warned. Don't stay here.

review.title: When did "boutique" come to mean "expensive for no good reason?"
review.reviewText: We were in town for SF Pride, so we wanted to be near things. We waited too long to get our lodging, but we thought that for the amount we were paying we would get something decent. What we got was okay. The room was big but shabby, we called a couple of times for help with things and were invariably told, "I'm the only person here and I have to manage the desk, so can you wait til the morning?" (then, in the morning, we had to remind them about the problem), and the window was barred over, spider-webbed, and looked onto the alley below. The area it's in, the Tenderloin, is not nice at all: very rundown, lots of homeless people, although good shopping is just a short walk away. The one good thing I can say about Adante is that we accidentally left something there and they found it and mailed it back to us (though we did have to pay fee, which is understandable, but for some of the better hotels, they might not have charged us for it.)

review.title: OK if you want this location
review.reviewText: We've stayed twice at the Adante, only because of its location, a couple blocks from our son's apartment, and affordability. Both times we had a small bedroom and huge bathroom. With all the space in bathroom, why is there only a tiny counter for toiletries? The room was cleaned well daily, but we never saw the "please change sheets" placard again after using it on our fourth day out of seven. Many days we were not given full sets of towels until I requested them from the desk. (And many of the towels would be deemed rags in my home.) Continental breakfast consisted of bread for toast, butter and jelly, assorted muffins, bananas, juice, coffee, hot water for tea and cocoa, served in the lobby where there's only room for about 10 people to sit. Better to walk a block west to "Angel Cafe." My son is moving soon, and I'm ready to try a different hotel when we visit San Francisco again!

review.title: Good deal for the money
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good deal for the money. It is conveniently located a few blocks from the bus and cable car stops and Union Square. The rooms were small, but clean and quiet. The continental breakfast is nothing to be excited about (coffee, toast, muffins, and bananas) every day, but it works.

review.title: Reasonable stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was reasonably priced, fairly well located, and adequately comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was a bit small, but clean. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great location and good value for money - will be back!
review.reviewText:
Aside from the decor being dated we were pleased with our stay as we feel we got good value for our dollar. The room was clean (as was the rest of the hotel) and the bathroom roomy. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and gave us prompt attention. If you are looking for a good, clean place to stay and not spend all of your dollars on your hotel this is a good choice. The Adante is centrally located near the BART and all muni transportation. The restaurants and near-by shopping are great and you are within walking distance to Chinatown and designer shopping.

Regardless of where you stay in San Francisco you will be dealing with homeless at some point and this is no different but at no time did we feel that the area was unsafe. There are many pubs, restaurants and shops in the area - a real neighbourhood that just adds to your experience in San Francisco.

We would be pleased to stay there again.

review.title: Average hotel, in decent location for very not so much
review.reviewText:
Pluses:
* working! complimentary wireless network (checked on several floors in a few rooms),
* good location - several blocks from Union Square, but much calmer place that other hotels
* clean
* price

Minuses
- continental breakfast (very frugal) served in a hall (at the reception) - little place, crowded
- some renovation would be welcome
- staff at the desk did not look experience (they tried to convince me that my Expedia booking was for other number of rooms/people).

review.title: Could have been better
review.reviewText:
All I wanted was a place to spend the night since I planned to be out on the town during the day. Unfortunately, there was loud Mariachi music playing in another room until 3:00 AM so the sleep part didn't work out too well.
They also advertised a 'continental breakfast' in the lobby every morning, but since it ran from 7:30 til 9:00 I wasn't able to get around in time to take part. They should realize that most people on vacation won't be getting up that early.
On the plus side, the hotel was relatively cheap. I guess you get what you pay for.

review.title: The Decline Of American Respect
review.reviewText:
$ 30 parking which we were told was included
No A/C in our room
Had to use the ironing table to put things on !
No need to continue !

review.title: OKay i guess would b the best word
review.reviewText: This hotel is no double tree, hilton, marriott or other common hotel names you can think of. Average would be giving this hotel too much credit. If you just want a place to stay and sleep and shower then adante would be one choice i may give. However, beware because the room i was in had a bathroom door that did not lock and a window that did not stay opened when the room was stuffy. Unless you have a lot of luggage, you may want to take the stairs only because the elevator seems to shake a lot. The service was okay. There was nothing spectacular but there was nothing dreadfully awful. If you are claustrophobic then this hotel may not be the best for you.

review.title: Good hotel, good price
review.reviewText:
I liked the hotel and all the pluses it had in the room.
The only thing was the wi fi it wasnt working good.

review.title: Nice and quiet
review.reviewText: Convenient quiet spot I liked it a lot. Great price comfortable room.

review.title: Small rooms, great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the middle of the SF nightlife...great location for pubs and restaurants. Lots of street people asking for cash, but a safe location nonetheless. Rooms are very small, but very clean and comfy. Great hotel for a lone traveller, or if you are on a budget and don't need a lavish hotel room.

review.title: Satisfied overall
review.reviewText: Check in and check out was good, access to public transportation was good. Not enough space to lay toiletries in bathroom. It was clean and felt safe. Price was acceptable. Will recommend it.

review.title: if you think in quality and price, this is the option!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a very well located place, price you pay it values

review.title: OK for price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel well maintained. Our room was over looking the street unfortunately making it very noisy at nite from the bar that was next door.

review.title: Great hotel deal
review.reviewText: Adante Hotel is in a great location. It's within walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown and Japantown. The hotel staff were nice. Complimentary breakfast consisted of bananas, muffins, bread, coffee and tea. The rooms were satisfactory. The pillows were too thin though. Also, I stayed on the fifth floor and the day I checked out, the elevator was not working so I had to bring my luggage down the steep, narrow stairs. Besides that, the hotel was great. I would stay here again, especially because of its affordable price.

review.title: Internet service is bad!!
review.reviewText: It's not a horrible hotel for the price, but the biggest problem was that I was on the 5th floor and there was very intermittent (if any) internet connection. Honestly, had I been on a lower flower, everything would have been OK, but as it was, this disappointed me greatly. However, I did get internet service in the lobby, because this is where the routers were obviously. If you stay here and you want internet, make certain to tell them you want a room as close to the lobby as possible. Other than the internet, I guess it was OK. It was clean and that was a good thing. The pizza joint next door is also very good.

review.title: Okay Hotel with an amazing location.
review.reviewText: If you are going to stay in your hotel room for hours during the day then don't stay here. But if you are just needing a place to sleep while your in San Fran then this is a awesome hotel. The location is awesome and the room is not that bad for the price. Yes you have to put up with a few things, but for the price to stay there it is worth it.

review.title: reminded me of european htels
review.reviewText:
this is an older hotel which is no frills but provides all of the basic necessities for a great vacation

staff were pleasant and accommodating and the morning continental breakfast was a welcome addition

it is a hotel that is great if you want to be close to union square yet be frugal

we did not go to san francisco to sleep or to hang out in our hotel room

this hotel allowed us to save money for other fun things to do but still provide a clean room, a comfortable bed and a warm bath shower at the end of each day

i would stay here again

good value for the money

review.title: I will not stay in this hotel anymore
review.reviewText: The hotel should improve their services like coffebrack and roons

review.title: It requires refurbishment and improvement in service.
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a great place to visit, transportation is very accesible and there are beautiful places to visit on guided tours such as carmel and monterey, napa valley, bay cruises and many more.

review.title: "A bit downscale, but the right price"
review.reviewText:
This isn't the fanciest hotel, but it was clean, the tv, internet etc were all included as was a very decent continental breakfast. The area was fine, although right on the edge of seedy. I loved the price, and the staff was helpful when I had issues with door, needing to leave luggage for several hours after checkout, etc.
It is a bit of "you get what you pay for" but, again, clean, and was the right price for the area (much cheaper than surrounding hotels/chains).

review.title: centrally located, but....
review.reviewText:
very centrally and conveniently located, but the surrounding areas are full of homeless anywhere you look.
Gentle and friendly personnel. The hotel shows its full age.
Rooms very narrow, bathroom not accessible if you're overweight.
Traffic noise from the street is something to consider when asking for a room with view.
NO A/C.... the temperature in the room was too high even during the night.
Very abundant complimentary breakfast.
Not recommended.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Close to BART, Union square, restaurants etc

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The breakfast is quite poor.

review.title: Perfect Location.
review.reviewText: Friendly and warm service, a nice stay. The hotel is located right in the heart of San Francisco, so I found it easy to park over in one of the city parking structures, a short walk away. Within walking distance of most of the main sights in San Francisco.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText:
The elevator was broken one afternoon & I had to walk up 7 flights of stairs.
My room had one wall that radiated lots of heat.
even so, for the money I would stay there again.

review.title: Pleasant, clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Although the room was small and the decor a little strange, for the price this was a good deal. It was very clean, comfortable, staff was pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: 2 days in SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, many paintings. Get used to the stairs because they elevator takes forever and there is only one. Everything is very tiny so I wouldn't recommend it for larger vistors.

review.title: EXCELLENT LOCATION!!!
review.reviewText:
try not to take many things with u when u arrive, because nobody helps, they block ur crredit card and dont unblock until 2 labors days after ur check out, and for more shampoo or soap, remember to live a message in the mirror of the bathroom to the room maker, and ofcourse dont forget to live towels on the tube or the floor.
Ahhh dont use the map, the hotel gives u when u do the check in, the information its wrong...
location, the best, near everything!!!! and if not near all the buses, cable cars...

review.title: What I Expected
review.reviewText:
The reviews I had read were pretty accurate. The lobby was nice, but the hotel rooms are small. Our room was a bit tight for 2 double beds and 4 adult women, but we didn't complain since the price was cheap compared to some of the other hotels in the area. Our room was clean, but since it faced the front of the street it was sometimes noisy in the middle of the night or early in the morning from traffic and homeless people roaming the streets. The hotel is located near the Tenderloin so you will see many homeless people on the streets, however, I never felt unsafe. Most of the homeless people were friendly.

The hotel serves complimentary breakfast, which was nice if you woke up before 9am [I usually don't wake up before 9am while I'm on vacation].

There was only one issue that shouldn't have been an issue - make sure the cleaning staff gives you extra toilet paper because we had to ask for more toilet paper twice.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: The hotel was overall ok. Not bad but not impressed.

review.title: Adante Hotel - Dependable and Affordable
review.reviewText: This is a clean, efficient budget hotel. No frills, but friendly staff and comfortable rooms. We've stayed here 7 or 8 time in the past 7 years, most recently December 2010.

review.title: Add 30 dollars for parking
review.reviewText: The hotel is not dirty, but not terribly clean either. The room was small (bed took up most of it, small bathroom). We spent about 30 extra a night for parking. The elevator's permit has expired and it's a bit shaky. It has a sign posted not to overload it. I recommend this hotel if you want to be in the heart of San Francisco, halfway between Chinatown and Japantown. If you can find a hotel with free parking thats 30 dollars more a night or less, choose that one. One night, there were people on the roof outside our window, I think they were drunk and there illegally, making a lot of noise in the middle of the night, looking over the edge and scaring themselves. Breakfast is free, but it's only tea or coffee and some vending machine style cheese danishes. There is bottled water that they put in the room and charge you two dollars for each bottle you open. I recommend you don't open any and buy your own. On the plus side, they did work with me on a booking problem I had (booked it for the wrong month).

review.title: Good location. Near from everywhere for a tourist.
review.reviewText: This hotel is good choice with fair price. Some of my friends lived in another hotel with better and cleaner room and parking service, slightly higher price. But it's not located as well. For a tourist, you don't even need a car, good places in SF is almost in walking distance from Adante.

review.title: not nice
review.reviewText: Not a very nice Hotel. Strange and small rooms. Bed not comfortable. Loud noises from other rooms.

review.title: As expected but require better service
review.reviewText:
Hotel was nice and as expected in terms of rate obtained.
Frontdesk service and specific one girl in charge was rude and didn't show any customer service orientation

review.title: Overall def a 3* not 2!
review.reviewText:
Location is great. 2 mins from Union square, can walk all over san fran in 20-30mins or catch a tran.

Hotel was clean, cheap and well maintained. Small room, But was advertised as boutique, so no complains. Old style elevator! all good!

Staff were nice but could have gone a bit faster! check-out, had to wait 30 mins!!!! for them to collect the car for us! ohh and they told us parking would be $10 for our 1 day stay, but actually was $20! staff error! but not end of world!

Overall i would stay again anytime! it def deserves more than the 2* rating! maybe a 3!

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Excellent value for the price & great location. Well run hotel.

review.title: Clean Room, Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for travelers who just need a clean quiet room in an excellent location. The room is tiny but it includes a decent TV, a place to hang clothes, and a small work desk. The bathroom was also neat and well-kept. Walking distance to many SF highlights. I would go back to this place in a second.

review.title: Economy hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a no frills, economically sound alternative to the large full service convention hotels. The room was comfortable and clean and conveniently located for the Moscone Center.
Do not expect anything other than a basic place to stay. There are plenty of restaurants and convenience stores in the surrounding area to accommodate your needs, and at more reasonable prices than the typical in-hotel stores.
The only knock is the presence of many aggressive panhandlers in the neighborhood, but this seems to be a city wide problem as I encountered them where ever I was in S.F.

review.title: Shopping in San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel was very close to shopping, other hotels, the cable cars, and restaurants. Also just a short walk to Chinatown. That being said the room was small (I guess that is just how it is in SF) and very hot even with the window wide open in November. The elevator was old and scary but did its job. The hotel did offer free breakfast in the morning but it was just bananas, white bread, muffins and coffee. Overall we had a good time, just a little shocked at how different this hotel was than most we had stayed at in other parts of the country. We never ventured the opposite direction of Union Square from our hotel... it looked a little seedy that way. Never did figure out the free wifi... but went to a cute little cafe around the corner for crepes and internet when we needed it.

review.title: good place for the money
review.reviewText: we liked the hotel... all but the pillows. they were the most uncomfortable things i have ever tried to sleep on in my life. Other than that, the hotel was perfect for what we needed. It was older, but very clean and the location was great for us.

review.title: Comfortable but staff are subpar!
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and had everything we required for our stay. However, the toilet was blocked within half an hour of being there which took the hotel staff til the morning to fix despite only needing to be plunged. The heater in the room wouldn't turn off so it felt like we were in the middle of summer, staff couldn't inform us as to how to turn it off and failed to send anyone to fix it. apart from those problems it was a decent place to stay with interesting (or bizarre really..) murals on the walls. avoid the "healthy" food shop connected to the hotel.. not nice food at all!

review.title: The location is great!
review.reviewText: This modest hotel suited our needs perfectly,...we were close to many attractions and public transportation for the areas too far to walk to. The decor of the hotel was dated but the rooms and common areas were extremely clean. The continental breakfast was perfect to get an early start on the day. The staff were friendly and very accomodating. The hotel was a great value for the cost. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Was okay- for a short stay
review.reviewText:
Person at reception was not receptive to my question about restaurants near the area. Told me to refer to the back of my paper instead of answering me.
The queen bed room I booked from expedia was not available? (it was booked that way)- instead I was given the available twin beds. What is the point of booking a queen room if it's not guaranteed to stay that way?
I had asked to get a wake up call the next morning and did not recieve one- was going to catch a shuttle to the airport.
The carpet had old food on it and was old &unhygenic looking.
The room despite it's artwork of clouds and seagulls on the ceiling was depressing- the view of the alley made it worse. The smell of the closet and room was old and stuffy.
However, okay to stay for a night or two due to it's location. The bathroom and beds looked old but clean.
Bonus: the location is great- only a couple blocks away from union square & the cable cars.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good service helpfull good location

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
It is a correct hotel. Don't expect the best confort but people are friendly.
But warning that you have to make a USD 100 deposit at checking thru your CC which should be refunded 3 days after you leave. I didn t check it yet. Hope they have refunded. When you are not from US resident it can be a problem.
Good location and it is a good way to stay in SF Downtown. It would be my 3rd choice in this price range.

review.title: Good for a night or two.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and the room we stayed in was pretty small with a view to windows of the building next door. The elevator is a bit rickety, but overall it was a fine hotel for the 2 nights we stayed. The parking situation isn't all that great. There is no valet so we had to park in a separate structure and it was about $25 for 24 hours and could only leave once. Not sure I'd stay here again, but it's decent for the price and a quick trip to San Fran.

review.title: What I expected
review.reviewText: This hotel followed through with pretty much what I expected. For as cheap as it was it was very clean and offered all the amenities that I needed. Check in took about 15 min because there was only one employee working there (and I'm pretty sure he was also working the smoothie shop next door at the same time). Overall the place reminded me of a european hostel, not in a bad way though. It was exactly what I wanted for this trip.

review.title: Terrible hotel except bathroom was clean.
review.reviewText:
The front desk staff was flustered and communicated poorly with guests.

The hallways had terrible florescent lights.

Room was tiny. The wall paint effects made the room look dirty -- or maybe the walls were just dirty. The carpet was dirty. The corners of the walls and furniture were chewed up and dented.

Only good thing was the bathroom facilities were clean.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: First off when you get there you can tell by the creaking stairs and chipped paint its not in the best condition. When you get into the room they are undersized and in need of repair.Cheap is the name when the painting is painted on the wall with a fake frame around it. The toilet clogged within the first hour and then the front desk help said we could grab the plunger and fix it because hes the only one there.And then theres the wonderful view of a alley way that can be seen outta the window that has no screen, so if your a jumper this is the place. After sleeping on the twenty year old mattress you think about hopping out in the morning.

review.title: OK PLACE TO STAY BUT ON THE EDGE OF TENDERLOIN
review.reviewText:
My room was clean and cool with window open and has a ceiling fan but carpet was very gross and dirty and needs to be replaced. Bed was nice and firm with clean linens and bathroom was huge and clean.
The neighborhood was ok.....and not the best at night......could be dangerous.
I told staff about the problem but they did not seem to care........I would only stay here in a pinch again.

My visit to San Francisco was great and it was very warm when I was there.

review.title: Acceptable for the price
review.reviewText:
It is a bit of a walk (with uphills) from the BART station. Luckily, they allowed us to check up early.

We stayed for few nights. I personally did not like that our toiletries were not replaced at all the following days (I had to ask for Shampoo). Also, one morning, my wake-up call did not come through. And some people working in the desk were not nice at all, whereas others were ok.

review.title: Bohemanne Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved the location, in regards to where I had to go. I had stayed in that area before about 15yrs ago..It was great to be back there again. I plan to stay at the hotel in the near future... It reminded me a lot of being in England and Germany. Like that there were world travelers there.... I've already recomended to friends.

review.title: Great Hotel but Staff Literally Sleeps on the Job!
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and neat and was conveniently located to Union Square in SF. For the price I thought it was well worth it. My only "complaint" (if it really qualifies as one) is that during the overnight hours (11pm - 6am) the front desk staff was sprawled on the couch in the lobby snoring. Granted, it's the graveyard shift, but it's very unprofessional to see staff snoring hard if for some reason you come into the hotel late or have to go downstairs for some reason. I had an early check out since I had to catch a very early flight out that morning and came down to see the front desk attendant sleeping on the job. Otherwise, I think this is a good hotel and for the nightly rate and the location to major SF attractions, it's well worth the price.

review.title: Great location and price
review.reviewText:
If you're the kind of traveler that only sleeps and gets ready at the hotel, you can't beat the price and location of Adante hotel. It's a bit to the west of Union Square and downtown, so you're in a pretty central location. There are alot of bums around the area, but that's downtown San Francisco for you. Within a block of the hotel, you can find Pizza, a cool dive bar, mexican food, vietnamese food, and a liquor store.

As far as the aesthetic appearance of the hotel itself, it looks a bit old but is kept up in the cleanliness factor. Our room was very small and had an underwater themed mural painted on along the top of the walls. Kinda cheesy... There were alot of international travelers at the hotel, which I found kind of fun. This is by no means a luxury hotel, but it's pretty quiet and gets the job done. I would stay there again.

review.title: Will return when in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine for our business stay needs, near the Financial District and Union Square, in a decent neighborhood. It's a good value.

review.title: Second visit to Adante
review.reviewText: Hotel is budget priced, but very nice for the money. The main attraction is the excellent location. Our go-to hotel for SF.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: My friend and I both loved this hotel. The location was great: it is a short walk from stores, restaurants and public transportation. I felt safe walking the area, as there were many people on the street even in the evening. The room was clean and quirky. Ours had sea lions and fish painted on the walls, and a window that actually opened! They offered toast, muffins, bananas, coffee, and tea for breakfast. I recommended this hotel to a family member traveling to San Francisco this month and would recommend to anyone looking for a decent and decently priced place to stay in the city.

review.title: Comfort downtown in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
The location of the room was excellent, right downtown.
