No need to rent a car as everything was walking distance or a short cab ride
from where we were. the rooms were clean, the art decore was lovely, however the beds were a bit small, but comfortable. I was OK, however my 6'5'' had his feet hanging, The complimentary breakfast was good, and for the health conscious, there was a juice bar next door. The cost of the hotel was very reasonable. Lots of restaraunts near by, as well as shopping, so there is lots to do as a visitor.
I can easily recommend this hotel for a trip to San Francisco, hope this helpful.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: This is a GREAT little hotel near downtown San Francisco. The rooms and bathrooms are very small but the service is outstanding. They have breakfast available in the mornings with a decent selection. There is a bus stop steps away from the front door and Union Square is only a few blocks away! Overall my stay was good and I definitely plan on returning again!

review.title: Awesome (cheap) boutique hotel
review.reviewText: What a great find! Cheap, near everything and the room decor was awesome! We had awesome murals in our room, and it was amazingly close to everything we wanted. Bonus/Warning: our room had almost no cell coverage (hey, at least to me, that's a plus)!

review.title: Somewhat pleased, not for kids.
review.reviewText: Room was extremely small. So needless to say my kids had no room to rome (crawling infant). The hotel is small, narrow but was quiet and pleasant to stay in. The room/beds were clean and bathroom very clean +. The rest was detail, old walls and paint and carpet needs replaced or deep cleaned...but that's just the details. For the price in such an expensive city, it was good. I wouldn't recommend it for families with kids or families who plan on staying in room much. The location was excellent...central to shopping and fun!

review.title: Dingy and old - needs renovation
review.reviewText:
I know that good hotels in San Francisco come in two types - modern/expensive and "charming"/inexpensive. I was hoping for the latter in this case. Unfortunately, the hotel was as charming as Mae West in her 80s - you wouldn't want to look too closely or in a well-lit room. All the wood mouldings were either dirty or covered with layers of paint (or both). The bedding was sanitary, but the carpets had that slightly greasy feel from lack of a deep cleaning.

The only good thing I can really say was that I didn't feel unsafe - and I *did* save enough money from two nights to spend on a night at a wonderful hotel in Tacoma, WA (also found on Expedia) a week later while driving home from a short vacation on the San Juan Islands.

Sometimes you make sacrifices so you can save money you "have" to spend so you can use it for what you "want" to spend. Next time, however, I'll find a nicer old hotel when I'm in SFO.

review.title: stay away from this hotel
review.reviewText: Only good thing about this hotel is it's location. Rooms are so small and carpet was cleaned I'd guess last year. There are no cell phone signal in the rooms. They charge you 34 dollars + tax for parking even if you can find for 20 two block from there (for 12 hours) what I did. But most disapointing thing was at my check out when they tried to charge me for for two additional nights for parking. But I kept receipts from another place so they couldn't do nothing against proof. Please find some other hotel, there are plenty of them in surounding.

review.title: Good value for money,
review.reviewText: This simple clean quirky hotel (with painted wall murals) was well located a short walk from Union Square. Nothing fancy about this place, but comfortable and good value for money. Fresh muffins and tea/coffee for breakfast in lobby. Good eateries nearby and windows that open! Staff happy to help with local info.

review.title: Simply efficient, in center of everything
review.reviewText: The stay was good. The hotel had old charm. It is nothing fancy, but has the essentials. When we arrived 4 hours before our check-in, they were kind enough to go ahead and give us a room, and it was upgraded. Check out was good and quick. The front desk was helpful with any directions were needed, and provided a very good map for the city. And the windows opened in the rooms.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText:
I was able to do early check-in. Hotel is clean and good value. Very good location. :)

Recommend to go with friends and if you are looking for a good value hotel.

This is not a couple hotel.

review.title: central to everywhere
review.reviewText:
Bus stops outside door
3 blocks to union square shopping

review.title: "Will go back again".
review.reviewText: Nothing bad to say about it. Was very quiet, which I like. Thats why I will go back again.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: San Franciso was a very nice place to visit.The hotel was extremly pleasant.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Well, the hotel is in great location. Very close to the Union Square. Affordable price. The bad thing is that we felt like there was only one wood board separating our room and our neighbors. We can hear everything that happened in the other room. We can hear that guy coughing all the time and the noise of making coffee...we cannot sleep well at night. The hotel staff was nice. We were switched to another room without any problem.

The staff did not change our shampoo during our stay.

review.title: Good location at a reasonable price
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay at the hotel for the most part. I only wish we would have asked for a room with a view instead of a wall. Although it was nice to have a free continental breakfast (muffins & coffee) early in the morning, it would have been great if there was a microwave available at our leisure. This way we could have warmed up some of our leftovers from the different restaurants we went to in the area.

Overall, the hotel was quite affordable and a pleasant place to stay. Since it was our first time in San Francisco we didn't stay much at the hotel during the day. There is plenty of public transportation around the hotel. A bus line right in front. Most of the time we preferred to walk. If we can visit again, it would be our choice over the more expensive hotels around the area.

review.title: great hotel! great location at cheap price
review.reviewText:
pro's...the staff were all friendly and helpful. there is a computer you can use, but it cost to print anything.the shower pressure was great. the ceiling fan is nice if you get warm. also there is free wi-fi in the rooms. there is a juice bar next door that you can go right threw from the hotel. the location of the hotel is perfect to everything. there are many places close by to eat breakfast or lunch.
cons...elevator was slow. room was small and bathroom, but good enough for 2 young people. no a/c, but didnt need it. the queen bed fit us fine.
this is a nice and perfect for couples or first timers solo travelers.
def. will be back!

review.title: Adante provides excellent secure clean sleeping quarters at a very affordable price.
review.reviewText:
The Adante is located just a few blks from Union Square and within easy walking distance of the Moscone Center or a short trolley ride to Pier 39. At about half the cost of the ritzier hotels adjacent to the Moscone Center, I enjoyed a very quiet, clean, albeit small, hotel room that was scrupulously clean and decorated in a whimsical, colorful style.

The staff at the Adante were exceptionally friendly and cheerful. I thoroughly enjoyed my week long stay there.

review.title: Location of Hotel made our trip cheep and easy!
review.reviewText: This was a sweet little hotel located close enough to everything we wanted to do (Union Square, China Town and SF MOMA) The front desk was kind and helpful. The room was small but the bathroom was nice. We enjoyed our stay and will DEFINITELY be back. We wouldn't have been able to do our trip to San Francisco without the hotel being affordable and close to everything.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText:
The service was okay- not good, not bad. However, there were flies in the room when we checked in. My friends and I were pretty busy chasing them out.
Price is reasonable.

review.title: Good place for the price
review.reviewText: If you're willing to give up a few of the luxuries Americans have become accustomed to, you'll find this European-style hotel provides a clean, comfortable stay for much less than other hotels in the area. The bathroom was very small, the room didn't have it's own thermostat, the continental breakfast was just muffins and coffee (no juice!). However, the bathroom was spotlessly clean, the window opened and the room had a ceiling fan. The neighborhood was busy and we (two females) were comfortable wallking the area at night. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: The best hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: The room is comfortable,and the location is converience, the price is cheap.

review.title: Great hotel for the price and location!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, and it was a cheap stay. Hotel was clean and the bed was divine. The staff was friendly overall, except for the lady behind the desk who was horrible and unfriendly. I complained about her to the manager. I would stay again though. I recommend it for the price, conveniency and area....

review.title: Bait and Switch
review.reviewText: The Adante Hotel was by far one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. No parking whatsoever, forcing me to use either the public lots nearby (which have their own rates) or the valet service they have (set at a fixed rate per day.) The valet service takes up to 45min to bring the car to the hotel. Then there's the hotel itself. There was a room deposit that was never mentioned in the booking of the room at all that almost caused me to pull all of my spare funds. The hotel room was absurdly small with no cellular coverage in the room at all. The bathroom had mildew and water leaking from the ceiling above the bathtub. The "free wifi" was slower than dialup speeds and practically unusable. Just an absolutely awful and expensive experience.

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText:
I needed a cheap place to stay while I looked for an apartment in the city. The hotel is located close to Union Square and next door to a good pizza place. The interior decoration of the rooms wasn't my kind of thing, but that didn't matter. I just needed a place to sleep that had Internet access. Overall, my room was comfortable, with no frills.
While my stay was pretty quiet, occasionally, I would hear loud talking and cussing in the hallway. And late in the evenings on the weekend, I could hear screams from people in the street. My room was in the back of the hotel, so I was surprised to hear street noise. And, the very first morning that I went to the lobby for the "breakfast," nobody was at the front desk and two homeless people had come into the lobby and were taking some of the food. (That only happened the first morning I was there.)
Also, the in-room safe wasn't big enough for a laptop computer.
These qualms aside, I really had no problems with my stay. And I really don't think you could beat the price for a hotel this close to Union Square.

review.title: Quaint and cute
review.reviewText: Had no problems. Hotel has a "grandmothers house" feeling to it including bumpily painted stairs and old but fully functional doors. Rooms appear to be hand painted with fish, geese, and other neat things.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: If you want no wifi, shower going from scalding hot to icey cold during your shower, noisy neighbors, lots of beggars in front of building, this is the place for you

review.title: Too much noise on the street
review.reviewText: The hotel is showing it age and having a room on the street makes it very noisy. Parking at all downtown hotels is expensive.

review.title: "Not Impressed"- need to go to charm school
review.reviewText: I feel now days people need work and bussiness need customers, you think they would do what it takes to please the customer. we were only there for not even 12 hours they could have let us stay with out making such a big fuss. the desk clerk was ready to toss us out he did not care... and thats sad..., and the other sad thing is we wanted to do something fun and stay one night so we didn't have to fight the traffic down from Sacramento.

review.title: Best hotel in San Fransisco!!!!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel!!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: it was very close to all the bresfast was only a pice of breed an coffe

review.title: Impressed for price!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was in an excellent location and was the best value I could find in San Francisco. The receptionists were great, very helpful and engaging. The rooms are small, but big enough for a 5 day stay. The breakfast was not the best, defrosted muffins and coffee.
I noticed some disabled and/or homeless people in the building a few times, taking advantage of the low rates. My last morning at the hotel proved this to be an inaccurate assumption. I was appraoched outside or the hotel while smoking (there is absolutely no smoking permitted in the hotel) by one of the hotel guests and asked for a smoke (which happens all over SF... if you smoke, you'll be asked). I gave the man (in his motorized wheelchair) a cigarette, then he proceeded to ask for money to buy his own smokes. I told him he was lucky to get one from me and I'd give him no money. Well, the man got a little upset and started explaining how he lived in the hotel and didn't have a job.. Long story short, he was unemployed and begging for money outside of the hotel he lived at. I thought this was tacky and told the front desk that they should monitor this. There was also an incident where I helped escort a blind/disoriented woman into the building from a cab. It was an uncomfortable situation.. kind of felt like I was helping my grandmother at a nursing home? The front desk knew this woman and seemed to have no problem telling her to wait and they would take her to her room...

review.title: SFA experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is good. Clean and neat. The room was comfortable. internet connection was working fine. The breakfast was a litle dis-appointment. It was just one muffin and tea/coffee/milk. As good as no breakfast..

review.title: WHY DID I LEAVE SO SOON!!!
review.reviewText: THANKS TO ALL THE GREAT PEOPLE THAT MADE MY STAY SO GOOD!

review.title: Vintage Bargain
review.reviewText: If you like vintage architecture and want a central hotel bargain than this place may be for you. My only complaint is the elevator was broken while I was there which forced me to carry my luggage up to the 3rd floor and back down again. Great adjoining cafe for fresh juices and coffee in the morning.

review.title: Simple and Convenient
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located in a very convenient location in downtown San Francisco. The area is not the greatest, however, it is within a reasonable distance to major sightseeing spots. Its about 5 blocks from Union Square and another 6 blocks from there is China Town.
The rooms are a bit small but very clean. The staff are very friendly and willing to accomdate your needs as best possible.
Also, Dotti's cafe is right around the corner from the hotel which gives you a better chance to be one of the first in line to have the most DELICIOUS breakfast EVER!!! Well worth the wait. =)
I would DEFINITELY stay at Adante on my next visit to the bay area again.

review.title: Okay hotel, nothing special
review.reviewText: Our stay in San Francsico was great, the Adante hotel was satisfactory. Nothing special, if your looking for a cheap place this is it. Small but nice, great locatioin to union sqaure.

review.title: Economic place for traveller
review.reviewText: good location, near Union Square.

review.title: Wouldn't stay here
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is close to many things downtown. However, it is just a block or two from the "bad" part of the city. Did not feel safe walking close to the hotel. Rooms are small and in poor condition. Windows did not lock, and many are on the fire-escape. I had two rooms and both had sticky carpet. The first room had stained sheets. The second floor smelled like urine though my room did not. I arrived back at my room after being out and found a man's dirty dress sock laying on my bag. It was not mine and I was not traveling with a man. Staff was excellent. Very helpful and responded to my concerns promptly. Elevator is a little rickety. If you're adventurous this is much cheaper than most in the area.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText:
It's not in the best neighborhood, and the room is big enough to accommodate a large bed, a dresser, a desk and a chair. That's it. But you're in San Francisco and if you're spending time in your hotel room for anything other than sleeping, you came to the wrong city. And it's cheap by anyone's standards.

The place is nice, the murals are pretty funky, but my wife is a mural artist, so take that for what it's worth. Nice bath, jacuzzi included, which is nice if you walk a lot, which you tend to do in SF. Five easy blocks to the cable cars, or a cab to the wharf is about $6. How can you beat that?

When we go again, and we will, we'll stay here.

review.title: Not impressed but ok
review.reviewText: The place is fine considering is in central San Francisco and cheaper than other places. It could use some renovation, but there is a friendly staff, good and free wi-fi and a simple breakfast included in the price. I didn't see the air conditioned, which made think, what if I were to be in SF in full summer.

review.title: Good Hotel Bad Maintainence
review.reviewText: The Hotel Location is very nice and central to many attractions. We booked two rooms, they were small but ok, in one of the room were bug in the bed, we requested change and they promptly changed our room. hotel needs maintainence. it's good for the price and location.

review.title: would return
review.reviewText: room small but nice. not the best location but i would stay there again

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: Old hotel, no hot water in a room. horrible parking conditions

review.title: Small room and twin beds, but good value for location.
review.reviewText: Tiny room with twin beds, but clean and adequate for my needs. The free continental breakfast was an unexpected treat along with the coffee/tea maker in the room. The WiFi connection did not work, so the hotel gave me a cable to connect to the in-room data port for free internet access for my laptop. Many Europeans seemed to stay there to judge from the languages heard in the lobby.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is small but it was located on Geary St close to the Cable cars! for the money it's perfect!! our room was clean! and there was free breakfast! I would recommend it!

review.title: Get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I stayed in SF on a business trip Sept 20-23 2009 and due to a reservation mix up had to spend 1 night at this hotel. The price was very affordable but be warned that you will get what you pay for. I checked in with little problems and my reservation was accurate. The hotel is in dire need of a modernization as the decor is outdated and the rooms are somewhat tacky. My room had fruit flies everywhere I did read a review that said the cleaning staff leave the windows open which may explain but I was still miffed. I was too tired to complain. I slept alright.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Request for twin beds at time of booking was completely ignored. Wireless internet availability was very poor. Television news channels were only available for very short periods of time (energy saving)reason given. Only one tiny lift for over 70 rooms and it had a mind of it's own. Continental breakfast was a joke. Supplied with a muffin and you were required to cook your own toast and nowwhere to sit and eat breakfast due to renovations. Would not recommend this Hotel

review.title: I would choose this hotel for my next visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location, close to Union Sq., Chinatown, Powell Train Station, among others. Rates are very reasonable, I would definetely stay again at this Hotel on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice and decent
review.reviewText: The hotel reception/receptionist was excellent and they were always ready to assist.Checking in and out were smooth. I expected larger room, it turned out to be small but neat. The lift was noisy and the operation could be improved. There were not many television channels to select from. Location is good too.

review.title: close to cable car and uniion sq
review.reviewText: Hotel was value for the money only thing wrong was that the TV was not working due to to being updated

review.title: Very nice for the price
review.reviewText: A friend of mine and I were staying the weekend in SF with a group of friends and just needed a place to rest our heads and unwind. While most of our group stayed a couple of blocks away at the high rise hotels, we decided, based upon reviews, to save a few bucks and give the Adante a chance. We got exactly what we expected, a clean, friendly place at half the price of the big hotels. My friend enjoyed the free Wi-Fi and I enjoyed the nearby bar.

review.title: Good Value, but Could be Better
review.reviewText: Just on the edge of being in a bad neighborhood, but not a bad location. Good place for the price. They say they have wireless access, but it's pretty shotty; we went a few days without access at all. Service is OK, room was just OK.

review.title: Book only if you plan to spend minimal time at hotel
review.reviewText: While there is nothing wrong with the hotel, the rooms are extremely small, the only elevator takes forever, the bed is very uncomfortable and the TV has only a few local channels with distorted images. The front desk staff is extremely corteous and helpful.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We asked for clean towels, had to go downstairs and get them ourselves. Our room was on the 7th floor and the elevator was really slow it was faster to take the stairs. The bathroom light stopped working in the evening before we went to bed, we called front desk he said it;s a florescent bulb and will come back on so we left it. Woke up the next morning and it still wasn't working, so we called front desk again and they said someone would be right up. 15 minutes later no one was still there, so we called again and than 10 minutes after the second phone call someone finally came.

review.title: decent and cheap.
review.reviewText: the location is reasonably good, the rooms are clean and the staff are helpful. No Wifi there (apart from the lobby) so make sure to bring your cable! neither my safe nor my internet connection were fuctionning correctly but the staff switched me to a different room after the first night, so it was ok.

review.title: sufficient
review.reviewText: it is what it is. good value, when you only need a place to hang your hat. hotel needs some updating of rooms, but they are adequate. I'd go back.

review.title: Would return.
review.reviewText: I think because it is so reasonably priced, I would return. It is well-located in the downtown area. Accessible to many tourist sites. Public transportation was close by. Just ask management to make better photocopies. they asked for a review of the hotel. But the copies were really cheap. Go to FedexKinkos to better quality printing. I know it's silly, but that's all I can say that is not the best.

review.title: Hotel is so so...
review.reviewText: Bathroom was renovated and modern. However, the room was run down, no detectable window except of a hole in the wall.

review.title: The hotel staff cooperation is highly appreciated
review.reviewText: Little attention is needed for the breakfast

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: A hotel is close to metro station. It is situated in a safe part of the city. It is easy to take a cable car, bus or from here to the beach...It is also easy to get to the airport from here by metro.

review.title: That's NOT a continental breakfast
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok. But that is NOT a continental breakfast! Provided were juice, coffee, bread with butter and jam, and muffins. That's it. Hope you like carbs. One morning there were no muffins, and they didn't reappear during our stay. The next morning they ran out of butter and it was gone for the rest of the stay as well. Making a small effort by providing fresh fruit, yogurt and cold cereal would go a long way. The location was close to Union Square, but also close to a seedy area of town called Tenderloin. Walk one direction and everything was hotels and theatres. Walk another and it's drunks, panhandlers and hookers. But the room was comfortable and clean, the staff helpful and there were many restaurants conveniently located. But bread and muffins are not a continental breakfast.

review.title: Surreptitious extra charges
review.reviewText: If you are on a budget this may be the place. The room is very small, old, but has been updated. The carpet was due for replacement. I did not appreciate having $2.00 added to my credit card after I checked out for a 16 oz bottle of water which appeared to be provided with the room.

review.title: great place for your buck
review.reviewText: Cosy, clean, cheap and close to everything. Definitely recommending it. Although it can be noisy and the room can get pretty hot.

review.title: good hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: It's the perfect place, the room was clean, big enough and cheap !

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: This hotel served it's purpose for my visit to San Francisco, it was close to where I needed to be. It was somewhat out dated, continental breakfast was at a minimum and barely acceptible. The worse part was the temperature of the room. There was no way to get the room cooled off which made sleeping very, very uncomfortable.

review.title: Small and Simple
review.reviewText: The hotel was affordable and clean and exactly what I needed during my stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Perfectly adequate
review.reviewText: This place is fine. Nothng fancy and probably very similar to all the other small cheap hotels in San Fran. Staff were really nice and helpful. I'd stay here again if I wasnt bored with this section of the city.

review.title: Nice Place------for small budget
review.reviewText: Room is quite small. However, it's clean. Overall, it is a nice place for travelers who has a small budget and the location is very close to Union Square.

review.title: Quite
review.reviewText: Very nice and comfortable hotel. Very close to downtown. Not far from any of the local attractions.

review.title: No Frills
review.reviewText: Don't expect to do anything with this room except sleep....the location is pretty good, but the room was terribly small and the service people were disorganized....If budget is a concern, it will do, but don't have high expectations....

review.title: cheap and cheap
review.reviewText: The hotel has its style, i think it pretty cheap and It is really close to the street which has a lot of noise at night; the sound block is not the best. the internet kind of sucked too. It has wifi in the lobby only.

review.title: Good choice of reasonably priced and central hotel
review.reviewText: Adante was nice. We found the animal paintings and jungle theme in the rooms funny and interesting (not exactly esthetic, but a nice break from other hotels in the same price class without any special detail to their decoration). The receptionist was very helpful when we had problems with our internet. Breakfast was bad (toast and jelly and juice) and perhaps not bad for the price, and practical sometimes to be able to eat sth before going out. Clean and central, I would recommend Adante for budget travellers.

review.title: Just OK!
review.reviewText: Hotel Adante is a grand place to stay if your not too worried about decor or the size of the room! We could not be accomodated with a roll out bed, which ment three of us had to use two small double beds which was very annoying! We booked this hotel for the last two days in America from a month trip and all we were doing in the room was sleeping, so it bet the pants off other places where we paid over the odds for! Good location for Union Square and shopping, not for nightlife. Dont bring your girlfriend, and dont expect fixed internet!

review.title: No way
review.reviewText: Very old and delapedated hotel. The "Tenderloin" is not a desirable part Of S.F. I was approced by a prostitute and givin the oppertunity to buy drugs. No way again.

review.title: Good as a Crash Pad
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel if you are on a budget. Not the nicest, but everything was clean. Their "continental breakfast" was a loaf of bread and grape jelly, so don't expect much more. Cigarette smoke permanently in the walls and carpet that you notice when you first walk in. Staff was very helpful and friendly. In a good location near Union Square and a bus stop right outside the hotel door.

review.title: GReat Location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a romatic break, this is not the hotel!! If you want somewhere central, clean, and close to the station and trams, then this is a very good choice

review.title: Adente Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel ! Great location !

review.title: Comfortable but a bit rough around the edges
review.reviewText: Adante's got some charm. From the narrow stairways to the walls with a dozen layers of paint, the joint's got character for sure. We enjoyed our stay, and it was quite affordable on the hotel+flight plan. The room was quite small, the TV an old school curved-tube job, the walls dingy with an attempt at rough-finished plaster that just came off looking dirty. Breakfast was a nice surprise; it's not well advertised. Basic fare: coffee, juice, toast and muffins. A little something to get you going and save you a few bucks at the diner. All in all a pleasant stay in a hotel that gets a lot out of a fairly limited facility.

review.title: Okay Hotel
review.reviewText: Over all the hotel was just okay.

review.title: The Hotel was ok
review.reviewText: The service was average. The location of the Hotel is central, only a few minutes walk to the bus station and the Central Square.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The room is too small for us considering the 4 luggages inside the room and very hard to open the door. It was only accorded after meeting a Filipino "Kababayan" who works as a receptionist at the hotel and it was only that we felt comfortable and enjoy the stay giving us useful hint in the course of our tour to the city and other areas of interest.

review.title: Good value, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: A decent location and a decent value in a decent part of town. Not far from the Westfield Mall or BART.

review.title: Needs work.
review.reviewText: No air conditioning. Ceiling fan barely helped on hot night. Poor policy to safety charge rooms on additional visitor's cards when pre-paid room.

review.title: big time rip off
review.reviewText: I had to pay $29.00 per night to park my car at the hotel's own parking space. The free continental breakfast offered to the hotel guests consists of a piece of bread+butter+jam+coffee. Wireless internet is available only at the lobby.If you wanna use it at the room you have to carry a ethernet cable. They don't have smoking rooms,if you smoke in the room you'll be charged $110.00 extra per night. Mini bar consists of 3 bottles of energy drinks. Big time rip off,horrible experience.Highly NOT recommended!!!

review.title: I'll never stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was old and run down. It did not have an air conditioner, the tv hardly worked, the fan made horrible noises and looked like it might fall from the celing, and the adjoing cafe was closed.

review.title: Price-Location-Greaat!
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square - City bus stops in front of hotel - clean, quiet room (we were not on the street side). Would definitely return.

review.title: great value budget hotel
review.reviewText: great value , good sized rooms and good servcie- all for a bargain price. Only omission was no AC. Ceiling fans tried hard but weren't up to coolong- I'd not stay here in the summer.

review.title: very good on a budget
review.reviewText: Not a modern facility by any means but for the money it was great. Lots of character.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: The other reviews are generally spot on. It is an interesting little hotel, with something of a funky, hostel feel. Immaculately clean, the rooms have some fun themes painted on the walls and ceilings. The rooms are small, as would be expected in this area, but the bathrooms are surprisingly large and modern. I couldn't get the internet to work in my room, so I took my laptop to the lobby and used the free wireless-- their piped in music was very good, and I didn't mind spending time there at all. On the downside - breakfast is a joke (juice, toast and coffee), TV reception is unusually bad (I tried it in two different rooms), and while the neighborhood may still be called Union Square, it feels more like the edge of the Tenderloin. Overall though, this is an excellent choice for a bargain hotel convenient to everything.

review.title: Value
review.reviewText: If you need an inexpensive place to stay in SF, but don't have a lot of money, this is a good option. No frills, but clean and reasonable location in Theater District.

review.title: Ideal for what we needed
review.reviewText: It's a very modest little hotel, the Adante, but it's very clean and in a great location - just a 5-minute walk from Union Square. There's a continental breakfast thrown in - again, nothing fancy, but it did save us a little $$ each day. We would stay there again!

review.title: stay in the city
review.reviewText: Hard beds, bad lighting, no extra amenities

review.title: Nice little hotel...good location
review.reviewText: I am semi-local to S.F.,(Sacramento) and visit frequently.I attempt to stay at a different hotel each time that I go to the city. The Adante compares well with the others in it's price range. The rooms are a tad small, but we go to roam the city...NOT to stay holed up in a room! The location is awesome, and close to transportation to anywhere that you could possibly want to go in the city. All in all, a nice place for the money!

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Nice room although a bit small; clean; walls very thin - hope your neighbours are not too loud! Breakfast "room" totally inadequate for more than about 4 people at a time. Breakfast was juice, bread (and 1 4-slice toaster), butter, jam and tea/coffee no milk, only whitener powder. Cafe next door "closed until further notice". Overall OK for the price and very convenient location.

review.title: At first not impressed
review.reviewText: Not used to city hotels, we were given a very small room which seemed dowdy with no space. On going to reception and saying we weren't happy for a small amount extra we were given upgraded rooms which we were satisfied with. The hotel staff were always polite and very helpful. We had a free breakfast which were were very happy with. The hotel we found was in an excellent location. Would we go back to this hotel again? Yes we would.

review.title: Good for San Francisco on a Budget
review.reviewText: While I was a little scared from reading other reviews about receiving bad service at this hotel, I went ahead and booked this hotel to save money for our San Francisco trip. It's not the nicest hotel, but it's a decent place to sleep at night if you're on a budget. The location is very convenient -- just a few blocks from Union Square, and not too sketchy of an area.

review.title: Surprisingly good
review.reviewText: I was a little apprehensive about staying here because the price was so good, and the demand for rooms was so high, but it turned out wonderful. We stayed for the Nike Women's Marathon and the location was perfect - just 3 blocks from Union Square! Everything was very well kept - nice carpeting, clean lobby. Our room was very small but clean and comfortable. The only disappointing things were that the cafe was closed (apparently indefinitely) and our room was right by the ice machine. Next time, we will check that before accepting the room.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: The hotel was not too bad, but the valet parking was horrible, it took more than 50 minutes to have my car back.

review.title: Functional hotel
review.reviewText: Not the most romantic or special, but practical and functional hotel. Good location and clean, small rooms make this a good option for a few nights. Breakfast not worth mentioning.

review.title: Great Bargain
review.reviewText: During our recent stay at the Adante Hotel, we found the hotel was the best priced and best location in downtown San Fran. It was easy to get around from this hotel. It was clean, had very courtious and helpful staff and although there was no restaurant in the hotel, there were so many great restaurants in the area, it was not a problem. The only minor thing was that we had a room facing the street. Avoid if you can as it is extremely noisy with sirens, street parties and street cleaners. Because all hotels along these main streets are so close to the street, I am sure that is the case with most hotels' rooms that face the street. Try to get rooms toward the back of the hotel for more quiet.

review.title: Location primo
review.reviewText: The front desk guy was really helpful and we got lots of info to sightsee. Ice machine on our floor was handy and our room was great. The street noise just added to our 'being in the USA' experience. Loved it and recommend it for location. There are homeless all over the place but felt very safe as there are lots of restaurants and people everywhere.

review.title: Great hotel for the price, in good central location
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a girls weekend. The hotel is very basic, a good place to sleep at night but I wouldn't hang out in the room all day. It is located close to the Powell St station which makes it easy to get around SF by BART or bus and to and from the hotel to SFO. Also near Union Square shopping, food, and bars.

review.title: best budget hotel
review.reviewText: we're students and this hotel is perfect for anyone on budget travel. it's close to union square and major attractions. easy access to the muni and bart.

review.title: Comfortable enough for the price charged
review.reviewText: Clerks at the hotel were very warm and the hotel was quiet. A good thing is that is a no smoking hotel.

review.title: decent, clean hotel
review.reviewText: clean hotel with very good front desk service.

review.title: Not too expensive, downtown but poor.
review.reviewText: Staff not too friendly, breakfast served in the lobby where people go in and out with laggage. The hotel is old and needs renovation. We had a problem with the bathroom at 11 pm when we arrived and we were told that nobody would have come before next morning. Go there if you want an hotel close to Union Station.

review.title: Good for a short stay.
review.reviewText: Very close to everything. Walking distance and cable cars are close. No air conditioning,tiny room and ok service.

review.title: Great Location and Deal
review.reviewText: This hotel is located just north of the Tenderloin, which is known for its high homeless population, and just west of Union Square and the Financial District. Friendly and accommodating staff. Lovely and decorative rooms. The two rooms I stayed in both had windows that opened to street views. Continental breakfast is what I expected it to be for a hotel in San Francisco: bread, muffins, and juice. But good nonetheless. I will definitely consider this hotel next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Great value, great location!
review.reviewText: The Adante Hotel was fine for my needs. I basically just needed a place to sleep after being out all day sightseeing. If you are looking for a resort or extras then the Adante is not for you. The free breakfast the hotel provided was fine. I had all the buttered toast I could eat. You make it yourself so its nice and hot. They also have coffee, tea, juice, and muffins. There is no A/C but most hotels, and even homes, in San Francisco don't have A/C. It never gets hot enough for it. You can open your window in your room and there is also a ceiling fan. If you are out sightseeing during the day you won't even be there at the warmest part of the day. At night it gets very cool in San Francisco. The bathroom was very big, almost as big as the room, and very nice. There is free (wired) high speed internet access in the rooms, and also an internet cafe connected to the hotel in case you don't have a laptop. However you will have to pay to use those internet cafe computers. The hotel is only a few blocks from Union Square - the heart of San Francisco and access point for cable cars, BART, MUNI, etc. There is also a bus that stops right in front of the hotel, the #38 bus, that will take you to Ocean Beach. That is the wide, sandy beach they have there. Other buses can be caught on nearby streets. Overall the Adante is a good value for your money, putting you near the heart of San Francisco while not breaking your budget.

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: The location was amazing-3 blocks from Union Sqaure, 4 blocks from Chinatown, 6 blocks from the Cable Cars and SFMOMA, and about a 30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf! The Value was incredible-excellent maidservice. My only complaints are that the Wireless reception didn't reach to our room (6th floor) so we had to go to the lobby to use it, and the "Continental Breakfast" consisted of small muffins and white bread with a toaster. Becomes monotonous after a few days (We stayed for eight)-but if money isn't a huge issue there are several places to get breakfast including the Inferno Restaurant attatched to the lobby. The Panini's are delicious, by the way!

review.title: Small, but nice
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a convenient location, has a nice lobby and the artwork in the halls and rooms is cute. The rooms are small, but that's to be expected in downtown. The building is old but well maintained and clean. The only problem I had with the place was the breakfast left a lot to be desired.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. The rooms can be a little on the small side if you have a lot of luggage, but otherwise no complaints. There is internet use in the lobby downstairs. This place is so close to everything you will want to see. We walked everywhere. Times Square, Madison Square Gardens, Chrysler Building, Empire State Building. What more could you want?

review.title: It was enough.
review.reviewText: There isn't a real breakfast, but you'll be in a good place. The employees are very kind and the room is clean. I didn't like the painting in the room walls, but it's personal.

review.title: No frills, overpriced hotel
review.reviewText: The complimentary breakfast was pathetic - toast, muffins and juice. I love toast and juice, but I wish that there had at least been wheat bread for the toast so I could have been satiated longer instead of getting hungry an hour after eating. I also didn't like the fact that there was no milk, only juice, and I didn't know what percentage of real fruit juice was actually in it...I imagine most places in San Francisco don't have central heating and air, but they could at least invest in window units because we were there during a heat wave and even the window open didn't alleviate the stifling heat in the hotel room. The paint on th walls was peeling, the bed linens were old and full of holes, and we were on the same floor as the ice machine, which kept us up all night because the walls were paper thin and you could hear EVERYTHING.

review.title: OK; needs lots of improvements
review.reviewText: We looked at the pictures of this hotel before booking it and thought it is a nice, clean, boutique hotel. When we get there, the lobby was really nice. We were still keeping high hopes. Everything changed when we got into our room. First; there was no air conditioning. We, as a couple, hate air conditioners because it makes both of us sick. However, this room was so hot, we begged for one. So, even if you do not like it, you need it when it is 100 degrees outside. Second bad thing were the towels in the bathroom. They were so old and had so many stains on them that we could not use them. The bed sheets were OK. The rooms are small. The neighborhood is fine if you do not mind homeless people. We only got scared in the night walking back to hotel, as there were so many bad looking people outside.

review.title: Very good for the price
review.reviewText: People are very welcoming and the hotel is well situated close to the union square.

review.title: Just a place to stay overnight
review.reviewText: . Location is good, within a walking distance to Union Square, BART Powell Station, China Town and other major spots of interest

review.title: no frills, but great location
review.reviewText: a good place to stay if you are in san francisco to see the city, not hang out in a hotel! this place offers very basic, clean accommodations - with oceanic murals on the walls for some reason! the breakfast isn't anything wonderful - toast, muffins, tea, coffee - but you can't beat the location for exploring the city.

review.title: Satisfied many times
review.reviewText: I have been to this hotel several times. This is usually the best deal in downtown SF. Assuming that while staying in SF, the hotel room will be used only for sleeping, it is very satisfying. I will book my room there again when I go back to SF.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and the staff was friendly. The hotel is very close to the Union Square, China Town, cable car stops, several restaurants, and shopping centers. If I visit San Francisco again, I will definitely stay in this hotel.

review.title: in the mist of all
review.reviewText: great place to visit very friendly staff

review.title: Adante Hotel
review.reviewText: Great price for a San Francisco hotel, very close to Union Square.

review.title: Impressed w/service not hotel.
review.reviewText: No smoking room but still smelled like smoke. Would recommmend new toliet seat (worn down to the wood), a full lenght mirror in the room would be nice and shelves by the bathroom sink. I realize it's an old hotel but some cheap conveniences would help. The smoke smell was even in the bedding or mattress, that was my main turn off.

review.title: Stained Towels
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel really try to help you. But half our towels were stained. Every night when we came back to the room, it smelled like smoke (this was fixed). Convenient location, but most nights we heard shouting, sirens, and loud crashes. We felt safe on that street at night, but one street over was full of bums and panhandlers. Could take it or leave it.

review.title: Best budget hotel S.F. Union Square
review.reviewText: if you're on a budget is a good hotel three blocks from union square,malls rest.& trolley,although the rooms are bit small the bathrooms by comparison are roomy and clean.for a 2 star hotel they have very good amenities blow dryers,ironing table,reg.tv cable,vose water,safe,and clean sheets.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Adante Hotel was just what I wanted--a clean hotel that was very reasonably priced. The hotel reminded me of European hotels. Front desk staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Those who don't need a fancy lobby, room service, etc. may find this hotel a good bargain.

review.title: Simple but extremely clean hotel
review.reviewText: Its a simple yet extremely clean and comfotable hotel. the staff is wonderfully helpful. However if you think of walking to the hotel from the Bart station, just make sure you are not carrying too much load.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: The room was a little small but comfortable. It was very inexpensive for San Francisco. I did not like the paint colour on the walls but it was clean and well maintained. The heating system was noisy. It seemed to only be on at night and made a sound like a quiet snore. I will for sure try to get back to this hotel. It was well worth the money

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: nice hotel, recomand it.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: We were satisfied with our stay at Adante. It was possible to walk wherever we wanted to go, and it was several eating places nearby. In the hotel lobby it was a great coffeebar, with great service and great coffee.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect - we were in town for 2 days. The beds were so comfortable, the rooms were clean and there had been upgrades to the bathroom. The hotel captures the feel of old San Francisco is many ways. The front desk was very helpful (even printed our boarding passes for us and provided us a BART schedule), the continental breakfast was great and the location was superb - we did not need a car - relied on BART from the airport and one taxi ride to a location that we could've walked to if we had not been pressed for time. I was very impressed with the hotel and the staff and would stay again and will definitely recommend to friends. Thank you very much!

review.title: Perfect location, great value for money
review.reviewText: I have stayed twice in this hotel now, and I have also recommended it to friends and family. The location is perfect - Union Square is just around the corner - and it is great value for money. Super-friendly staff, continental breakfast included, and the rooms have everything you need, including free wireless internet access. Would definitely go there again.

review.title: Good Hotel for a budget
review.reviewText: It's a very good hotel, with a very helpful and knowledgeable staff. The location of the hotel is good, close to buses and subways. Unfortunately, one or 2 blocks from the hotel there is a bad area but if one avoids that area overall it's a good hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed this hotel, had an internet cafe next door, very handy! Great location a 5 min walk to Union Square. Only problem was the room was extremely hot even with the fan on and it was freezing outside, strange!

review.title: Great bargain & basic hotel
review.reviewText: I read the reviews before I booked the reservation and thought I would be ready for a no-frills basic hotel. I have to admit that even when I got there with that mindset, I was dissapointed. The hotel is an older building (limit 5 person elevator, 4 with luggage) and the breakfast is basic (toast, blueberry muffins, coffee, tea and watery orange juice), but the cleanliness of the room is excellent and the staff is really friendly. The location is within walking distance to everything and is in a decent neighborhood (2 blocks west gets a little scary at night). Overall, I was happy and I will probably stay there again next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: I was a bit skeptical about this hotel at the beginning. In fact, I already had it worked out mentally that I was going to find another hotel after my first day there. However, after arriving I found the hotel to be a great bargain. Fancy, No. Livable, yes. This hotel is great if you are on a budget, albeit a San Francisco budget.

review.title: Quiet, cozy, and cheap!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed for six days and we were both satisfied with the hotel. We arrived early but they let us check-in 30 minutes before schedule. Our room was clean and the bathroom was well maintained and we always had fresh towels even if we didn't ask for any replacements. We would definitely stay at Adante again.

review.title: Not impressed at all very uncomfortable
review.reviewText: First of all my room was so small. My bathroom at home is bigger.The TV made a horrible buzzing noise and I had like 6 channels thet actually worked.The bed was terrible it had a dip in the middle were no matter what me and my boyfriend would end up having to be neck by neck.To top it off I would wake up with some kind of bug bites on my body.I think the bed might of had bed bugs.The only great thing about my room was the shower head it was fantastic.The hotel staff was friendly.And the location was a plus. Do not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, nice service
review.reviewText: Very clean room, no smells in the room (except in the hotel lobby and on the hallways), quiet and decent. Recommended only if you just want to sleep in the room and enjoy the city's culture.

review.title: hotel adente is nice and friendley
review.reviewText: stayed in this hotel 14 nites in sep this year staff very helpfull and friendly good location and good bars not far must do cable cars and alctraz is a must but book early would go back to this hotel but not stay as long next time a week is enough

review.title: save some money on the room then go shopping!
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to many attractions.It was a budget type hotel but the staff was friendly and the place was clean.If you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room this place is just fine.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: Near the Powell street cable cars and Union Square, although the street the hotel is located on isn't the nicest, but usually plenty of people around, even at night. Breakfast is tea, orange juice, bread, coffee, blueberry muffins, and butter/jam. The room was small, bed not very comfortable, no closet, but plenty of hot water for showers. Our view was looking into an alley and directly at another building, so room was dark. Price was good for S.F. but next time, we'll splurge.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very clean, just old. If you want to be able to walk to all of the major transportation sites quickly this place is great. I believe they do the best they can with an older facility. Take Bart for $5.15 from airport to Powell street and then a 5 min walk to hotel. Geary St bus takes you out to the coast in about 30-40 minutes and stops in front of hotel. Several of the recommended restaurants are within 2 min walking distance. For a good deal and a good location this place is great, just don't expect super modern amenities.

review.title: the adante was great
review.reviewText: i really enjoyed my stay at the adante. the front desk staff was very helpful, and the neighborhood was very interesting. there were many great restaurants and cafes nearby, and it was never any problem to get to the bart or grab a taxi. my room was small, but very clean. the murals and art around the hotel definitely give it a 'funky' vibe. i will stay at the adante next time i am in san francisco.

review.title: Nice European style hotel-good for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel reminded me of many hotels I stayed at in Europe, clean but older and not the nice amenities of a Hyatt, Westin or nice American hotel chain I get on businesss travel. My husband and I were being cost conscious so this fit the bill. I wouldn't have wanted to walk around at night in this area by myself but it was a short walk to Union Square and 7 blocks from BART, one of our main criteria. But the walk to BART was VERY seedy, good thing there was a police station right in the middle so lots of police cars were around.

review.title: Has its own kind of charm to it.
review.reviewText: The room wasn't all that big but wasn't too cramped either. If it wasn't for the hand painted sea lion mural going around the room and the two smaller paintings above my twin beds it would have been a very depressing arrangement. My view out the window was basically a brick alley. Then again its not like this is a waterside resort. I actually felt pretty comfortable in the quaint little room. It had some character to it, and I don't mean that in a bad way. For being an old building, I'd say that they have kept it very well maintained. There is no lot and parking on the street isn't very likely, so you're better off using the valet service at the front counter. It'll cost ya, and it'll take a few minutes for retrieval, but its worth. The neighborhood is just on the fringe between a good and bad area of town. As far as Bars go, there are a few up the street that are good for a casual night out with your buds. I enjoyed my stay. It was quiet, clean, priced just right for my needs, and the front desk was really friendly and helpful.

review.title: Comperision to the price it was very good
Bargain with a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very reasonably priced for all the amenities present. The staff was most helpful and the room small but adequate and very clean. The location was extremely convenient to most locations. Almost everything we did was within walking or muni distance. Definitely recommend.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfectly clean but incredibly small room, unsavoury decor and peeling wall paper. Staff were friendly and helpful when asked but not forthcoming with area information.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly. The place was charming. Not the place for you if you are looking for big and fancy. This is the place for you if you are looking for a good deal, quaint and cozy.

review.title: Excellent price and service... Definitely recommend
review.reviewText: Rooms with clean smell as you enter. Sheets in bed tightly tucked in. Iron, Iron board and TV in each room. Excellent service at desk. Wireless internet wasn't working with my laptop so they changed me immediately to a room with cable access included, at no extra fee... Breakfast ok. really near averything if you have a MUNI pass...

review.title: Affordable, centrally located SF hotel
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel is close to Market Street and the Powell St BART station. Excellent quality of rooms and service for the price. The one downside to the hotel is that it sits on the border of the Tenderloin. Make sure to walk up Powell and then make a left on Geary instead of walking up Jones or Leavenworth, unless you are comfortable with the myriad of unsavory activities that take place in SF's infamous red light district.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: The room was small but the location was great. Close to the BART and shops.

review.title: Quiet and Clean
review.reviewText: The only thing I can really say about this hotel is that it was quiet and clean. During our 5 night stay, we had to have our room key re-activated twice. What a hassle when you get back at 11pm or so and are tired.

review.title: Nice staff
review.reviewText: Hotel was staffed with very helpful employees. always willing to explain trolley and tour info. Rooms were a little small, but didn't spend much time there anyway. No air conditioning (which you don't need at 65 degrees), but had a ceiling fan. Bathroom was recently remodelled to include a jacuzzi tub. Convenient to Union Square and China town, but a little too far too walk to the Wharf and ferries.

review.title: Would Definitely Stay at Again--Excellent for the Cost
review.reviewText: For the price, my wife and I were very impressed with the Adante. The service was excellent. The desk clerks were very helpful. Our room was a bit small, but it was just fine for us. We were on the top (seventh) floor, and there was no A/C (there was a ceiling fan), and it was a little warm, but not too bad. We slept better than we do at home--our queen bed was quite comfortable. There was no screen on the window, which was annoying. Our room was very quiet--hardly heard a thing. The bathroom looked like it was newly renovated. There was an Internet hookup in the room--bring your own cable (we did), because I think they charge you to use one of theirs. Continental breakfast was skimpier than most: coffee, orange juice, white and wheat toast (w/ butter and jam), and fake blueberry muffins. The neighborhood was relatively safe--there were panhandlers, but they were not nearly as aggressive as I would have thought. (I gave a few muffins away :). We walked around all over, even at night. (I would have been slightly uncomfortable walking around at night with children, though.) It takes just a few minutes to walk to Union Square, cable car lines, the subway, and regional rail lines -- a few minutes more for the Convention Center and the Museum of Modern Art. Maybe 10-15 minutes walk to Chinatown. Same for Bay Bridge area. Pretty easy to get around.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: i enjoyed my stay

review.title: Good price / quality ratio
review.reviewText: Very centrally located in SF, this is a very good choice, especiallly if you get a room at the backside, and there are many. Valet parking was very efficient.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is somewhat small and old fashion, but you can't beat the price and location. My room was always kept very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'm from a small town and they took the time help me became familiar with San Francisco's public transportation system. I would stay here again the next time I am in town.

review.title: Small but clean
review.reviewText: The room we had was very small but it was clean. Basically just a place to sleep and shower. The continental breakfast was not much. The place is close to transportation such as the BART system and the cable cars.. The employees were very friendly and helpful

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: It was the most perfect location and stay! Very quaint and had loads of character. The themed rooms is a bit hokey but made for a good laugh and a unique stay! Our location felt very safe and was withing walking distance of everything! The staff was superb! Tony at the main desk was really great was always super helpful to help ous find our way around the city! When I come to San Francisco the Adante is where I will always stay! Thank you so much!

review.title: Not as good as I expected
review.reviewText: Although some said that Adante was a good hotel with affordable prices, I found the rooms to be quite dirty. The service was not fast nor good. The TV was not working well sometimes.

review.title: Affordable and comfortable
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Adante. It's close to Union Square and cable car stops and the staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. Would stay there again definitely.

review.title: Cutesy hotel in the city
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the handpainted rooms and bathrooms. The hotel was older and this was definitely apparent, but that didn't put a damper on our stay in any way. I loved the location-- walking distance from Union Square and all the shopping. Continental breakfast in the morning was convenient and filling. Coffee was great. I have no complaints! All in all, it provided a great relaxing girl's vacation in the city!

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: Cleanest bathroom I've ever had in a motel! Modest room, but very low price make this one a steal. Good neighborhood with some nice restaurants and small shops.

review.title: great location, clean, questionable color patterns
review.reviewText: Location was great, staff courteous and helpful, room clean. Noisy fan, 'quaint' (ugly) wall paint and patterns. Good experience in all.

review.title: See you soon, Adante!
review.reviewText: I stayed here in June 2007. The hotel is centrally located. It is indeed not far from the sketchy part of the city (to the right as you exit the hotel), but if you keep to the left as you exit the hotel, no worries. It is safe and only three blocks away from Union Square and all the restaurants and shopping. My room was on the 7th floor. It was definitely neither new nor well decorated, but it was clean and had all the elements one really needs: comfy bed, good water pressure in the shower, spacious bathroom, telephone in the room, TV, hairdryer, coffee maker, iron and ironing board. If you are going to San Fran to hang out in your room, then you might want to pay more and stay somewhere fancy, but if you are there to explore and enjoy the city, this hotel is a great option. Some people in previous postings complained about the lack of AC, but I found the ceiling fan quite sufficient (even for June). The hotel staff was exceptional and very friendly. The internet café staff next door was super cool and you can also count on wicked music there, as well as great recommendations on places to check out. Overall, I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit. I would certainly recommend this hotel for an easy going traveler who appreciates a good deal.

review.title: It was OK.
review.reviewText: I just stayed one night. It was okay.

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: Too much noise and the rooms were very small. The beds hard and the t.v didn't work that well.

review.title: Very good hotel, not the greatest area.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at Adante. The staff were very courteous and helpful.

review.title: good bargain, great location
review.reviewText: this hotel was extremely clean and the staff was friendly. i did not need any special accommodations and was comfortable sharing a room (2 single beds) with my friend. the bathroom was modern and clean. i liked that the hotel is so close to union square and that there is a bus stop right outside the front door. i took bart from the san francisco airport to the powell street station, and the hotel was only a few minutes' walk from there. there are plenty of reasonable places to eat or get coffee nearby, or you can grab a morning cup of coffee or orange juice in the hotel lobby. the only nosh they offer is small muffins and toast. i would stay here again.

review.title: Not too far from the attractions, far enough from the noise
review.reviewText: I heard stories of this hotel when it was privately owned but I took a chance and was pleasantly surprised. The managment seems to have done an absolutely wonderful job in renovating and modernising this place. The lobby was simple yet comfortable, the rooms were very tidy and very well kept. The bathrooms were very clean and of standard size for most modern hotels of this country. This is not my first time to San Fran and compared to other rooms within this area, this by far was the best size, price, and value for the dollar. Note that don't feel you need to go to the mainstream restaurants in the area, some others are cheaper and just as nice.I could best summarize this place in pros and cons... Pros: Very close to public transit (The bus stop is outside), Clean rooms and more spacious then normally found in this area, Friendly and knowledgable staff, Internet Cafe on the main floor at reasonable prices, Lots of places to go at night for a club and a place to eat, Walking distance to Powell street without the noise from it (One of the main tourist drags, and close to other transit) CONS: To get to the hotel at night you have to walk by many pan handlers (harmless though), The street seems to degrade as you walk up it from the hotel, The place seems a little understaffed but when they do work they are quick to act

review.title: May, 2007
review.reviewText: Narrow and hot room, but kind staff and reasonable price.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I was happy to find this hotel. It is close to pretty much everything you want to visit and the staff is very attentive and helpful. If you don't have city view you not miss anything really I was out for the most part of my trip. I would stay again.

review.title: A great value and reasonable comfort
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Adante for 5 nights in April. It was conveniently located within walking distance of the Powell BART and MUNI, and of the larger hotel where our conference was being hosted. The staff were friendly and helpful with check-in and check out. The free high speed in the room needs a cable, but works very well. The breakfast is lacking, but the coffee shop next door is great! The rooms are a bit on the small side, but clean and painted with kitchy but entertaining murals. Our room was on the top floor near the back, very quiet considering the location. The only draw back was no bar fridge in the room.

review.title: great hotel but not so great neighborhood
review.reviewText: a tidy and friendly hotel with a nice internet cafe attached. Neighborhood is not uniquely San Francisco, but access to other areas is fast. Good access to public transportation, the 38 stops right out front and the subway and cable cars are just a short walk away. Use Montgomery Station to get the subway instead of Powell Street Station, especially at night, when you are returning to the hotel the 38 stops at Montgomery Station 24 hrs a day.

review.title: Good location, good hotel for the price you pay
review.reviewText: I was a little worried about the location of the hotel based on some comments we had read on various websites but we had no problems at all safety wise. It is in a good location - very close to union sqaure etc and there is a bus stop right outside taking you to various destinations accross the city too. Staff were extremely helpful and there was free coffee, juice, toast and muffins every morning. Room was very clean and well kept. Only downside was that our room was a little dark and we had no view as the window backed onto an alleyway. However, I would definately recommend this hotel for people on a budget looking for a base from which to explore san francisco and I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Convenient and affordable
review.reviewText: For a hotel option during conventions at Moscone this one gets the job done. It's clean and Moscone is a nice walk - about 10 minutes. It does have wired Ethernet in the rooms, but I had problems getting it to work, although tech support was responsive if ineffective. Fortunately, they also have wireless in the lobby. My only complaint is that the doors and walls are a bit thin. Fortunately, everyone kept quiet and I was able to sleep. Rooms are small, but fine for one person.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Adante was quite satisfactory. Our room was small, but clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. They could improve on breakfast. It consisted of muffins or toast. Dry cereal or even some fruit would be a nice addition.

review.title: loved the decor!
review.reviewText: good clean hotel, good location, loving the lions and tigers painted on the walls of our room! found the staff to be friendly and helpful, great location, only a ten min walk to union square

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: It was quite uncomfortable staying in this hotel. You could hear the people above you and all around you due to thin walls. The sheets made me itch like crazy. Our bed cover obviously had not been washed because it smelled pretty bad. There is no A/C and it got pretty hot at times. Despite the condition of the room, the staff was friendly and helpful, but I would not stay there again.

review.title: definitely worth your money
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, less than 10 min. walk to union square, one block away from walgreens, about 15 min. walk to BART station, where you can catch trains to SFO @ $5.15. Nice staff, very helpful and friendly. Of course the room is small, but it is not a problem for 2 people.

review.title: Budget Hotel met expectations
review.reviewText: As long as your realize you are getting a cheap hotel within blocks of Union Square at a good price then you really can't complain. Yes, the rooms are small and a bit rough around the edges, but the bathroom I had was huge and recently redone. Very nice. The area is fine, as long as you head to Union Square and not the Tenderloin area, which is also close by. Homeless types are around, but that is very common in San Fran. Definitely stay here if you want to keep costs down but still be near the city.

review.title: Affordable, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Adante was exactly what I was looking for in a hotel. Not too expensive but comfortable with great service. The rooms were a little small, but they were homey and clean. Continental breakfast was so-so. Coffee not good, OJ okay. There is an affordable cafe next door that I spent most of my coffee time in...great happy hour specials too. Valet service was a plus, even though it was an extra cost. One more drawback is no wireless in rooms, you either need an ethernet cord or you can go down to the lobby for wireless service. All in all, though...I liked this hotel and would stay in it again.

review.title: nasty and horrible neighbors
review.reviewText: We could not sleep at all because of the noise from the street. People were fighting and shouting all night around the hotel, and many guests were talking and shouting in the hallway at night. It was a nightmare staying there. I will never never never stay there again. I travel a lot, and I have never experienced such a bad night. The breakfast is not for human beings.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: Pleasant place compared to the price

review.title: Best offer!
review.reviewText: just ten minutes walk from union square,great starting point for exploring the city; nice staff and rooms (try to get one that does not face the front - thus you have no view but great silence at night), very clean - bottom line: worth every dollar!

review.title: Good hotel for price in great location
review.reviewText: I learned about this hotel on this site, and the reviews were quite helpful, and accurate. The staff was very nice, great location, rooms quite small and simple... One big inconvenient was that our room was so hot. Wer only stayed two nites and were gone all day so didn't bother askig the front desk about this. I definetly recommend it to people who want a simple, nice hotel in good location, for a very reasonable price.

review.title: Sooo Looking Forward to my next visit!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I had such a wonderful stay at the Adante. Even though the building itself was a bit antiquated, the hotel was very well kept up. The room had a tenament feel to it but was suprisingly clean and tidy. I found the staff to be remarkably pleasant and helpful. The interior view of other guests windows wasn't the greatest, but it did not take anything away from my experience. I highly recommend the Adante & I look forward to my next stay, which I am already planning.

review.title: Does what it says on the can
review.reviewText: Decent hotel that gets on with things with no fuss. Friendly and human reception. Decent price for a comfortable clean hotel room. Not for those who want fancy fripperies!

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Clean, safe and quiet hotel with great customer service and a convenient location.

review.title: Long, but worth reading......would go back.......hopefully soon
review.reviewText: Things that we loved about the Adante: we got in early and were allowed to check in by 12:00 instead of carrying our luggage around till the normal 3:00 check-in. The staff was very nice and helpful. The bus line is right in front of the hotel door. Yes, the hotel room is small, barely fits the bed and not too many drawers, but we used the night stands and were able to empty out our luggage. You just have to be organized. The bed was so comfortable which was great after a long day of walking. The shower gave lots of hot water and good pressure every single time. Because of the great price we stayed four nights and are so glad that we did. Yes, it is downtown San Fran so as others have mentioned, you will see the homeless in the vicinity, just like any other citys downtown area. Around the hotel, it was maybe one or two here and there, definitely not like the Union Square area where they panhandle and come up to you. There were a few times that I woke up to hear banging or yelling in the alley, but turned around and went back to sleep. There was not a single time that I didn't feel safe there. Half a blk away is Dotties cafe, great for breakfast but get in line by 7:00 am if you want a table. We recommend two people split the Open Road plate because it is a lot of food for one, and we can eat, no diets for us. We never had any problems with the hotel. My husband kept saying every day how he would go back there to stay.

review.title: quite impressed
review.reviewText: very clean and friendly staff. well located and easy for public transportation. rooms small but very clean. good resturants within walking distance. very good value.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean. The building is old but maintained. We were happy with the location!!!! I personally wouldn't stay here again but I think it will be a good hotel for the cost for many others. Long story short, our stay was nice until I brought something up to the attention of the staff. I had to talk with manager about the attitude with one of the staffmembers and another issue. He listened but I left feeling I was just being humored and the staff member was believed over me. I am big on customer service and respect, so this put a damper on my view of this hotel. This is a great place to stay if you plan to be sightseeing all day and just need a place to sleep or change your clothes.

review.title: it is a good cheap hotel.
review.reviewText: Based on its price, it is a good hotel to live in San Francisco downtown area.

review.title: Small rooms but a great place - highly recommended
review.reviewText: We found the Adante staff to be very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although a bit cramped for space. However, since we spent most of our week at a business meeting and doing the "touristy things" the lack of space was not an issue for us. The location was perfect with easy access to bus and cable car services. Last year we stayed at a $200/night place in Washington and can't remember anything about that hotel since the expensive places all seem to look about the same. The Adante actually has "character"...some of which is provided by painted murals in the halls and rooms. Although the murals are not my taste in decor they set this hotel apart from the run of the mill expensive places. If we ever return to San Francisco this would be our first choice for a hotel. The rooms also had internet service, and the Adante provided the internet cable for the entire week for a few dollars. There is also an easy to use safe in each room for storing jewelry and other personal items.

review.title: Probably the best for what you pay for in San Francisco
