review.reviewText: Good location, situated in front of a bus stop, free in-room wired internet access, wireless in lobby, extremely helpful staff, opposite a laundry, surrounded by good food within 2 to 3 blocks. In-room safe, and iron & ironing board sums up the plus-es. Only gripes are the size of the room (quite on the small side) and the noisy sound when the toilet light is turned on (rather silenced by closing the toilet door.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Small rooms but very affordable. Had a water leak in the room 2nd night and after reporting it we were upgraded to a larger suite with extra amenities. Nice staff very willing to satisfy.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel is pretty cheap and the staff is really friendly and helps you out. we were nervous that the rooms might be dirty because of the low price, but they were extreamley clean, especially the bathrooms, better than other hotels that ive been to that cost more per night. our room was also painget with small murals on each wall, it was really cute. i definitley recomend going to adante.

review.title: it is very good to stay.
review.reviewText: we are very satisfied to stay adante hotel. there is no complains about this hotel as one of japanese tourists from Tokyo. the cost is very affordable but room is still comfortable and clean as a comparing to the other hotel like this in San Francisco. we will be staying this hotel again.

review.title: Great Location, Nice Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for walking around SF. Union Square and all the shops are very close (and free wifi in Union Square). The front desk people are the NICEST front desk people I have ever met. Anything from directions to suggestions to what to do they were 100% helpful and nice. Bring a cable to connect to the free internet in the room, or go to the cafe downstairs for free wifi. The walls are a bit thin, but not a problem really cause you're not there to hang out in the hotel room. The bathroom in our room was new and huge, very nice. I would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Small rooms, but good location!
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were small, but clean. Hotel is 5-6 blocks from the main transportation system of Union Square (10-15 minute walk). Union Square is a great central location in San Francisco. Very few TV chanels. Big plus - free internet connection in the room. Overall - great place for people traveling on a budget and great location.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: If your looking for a hotel.. as a place to sleep with a friendly overall staff .. this is for you..No real amenities or anything.. Nothing special with the rooms.. just a bed a clean bathroom and a comfortable bed...

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: got a upgrade to a room with king-size and yakuzi in the room.

review.title: nice and clean hotel, friendly staff, I recommend it
review.reviewText: Well located hotel, on the heart of San Francisco, with nice rooms with tv and internet access. very affordable.

review.title: Adante Hotel San Fracisco is a great value
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Adante Hotel while I attended the Macworld Expo from January 8 - 12, 2007. Having never visited San Francisco before, I was not sure what to expect. I was very pleased with what I found at the Adante. If you are a traveler who believes in practicallity you should stay here. The bed was comfortable, the shower head pressure was excellent, and the staff was extremely helpful. They serve a free breakfast every morning that consists of muffins and bread for toast as well as coffee and orange juice. Everything in the room was clean. The internet service was reliable. I walked to Moscone Center everyday which was very pleasant. The total walk time was about 10 to 15 minutes if you walk briskly. If you walk slower it might take 15 to 20 minutes depending on how you hit the cross walks. One last plug...If you like Sushi, try Sushi Boat, its about 4 blocks from the hotel and very good.

review.title: Recomended
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice and very clean room. Great deal for the price we paid. Would stay again

review.title: Just a place to crash
review.reviewText: Stayed here overnight on New Year's Eve. The room decor was cheesy, but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom shower faucet had a leak that caused huge puddles. Overall the room was decently clean and the price wasn't too bad all things considered. If I had more time plan though, I probably would have stayed somewhere a bit quieter and maintained better. Probably the best thing about this place is the location. It is extremely close to all shops and Union Square.

review.title: Nice, quaint hotel except for,,,
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel condition is good. One thing that could be improved is the smell of the elevator. The front desk service is exceptional.

review.title: nice & cheap hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: stayed for 4 nights at christmas. room was in good condition. bathroom was ok. so called continental breakfast was almost ok. different types of muffins would be great. strange radiator in the room. valve whistles in the middle of the night. i warn you: don't take jones st to market st. there are many homeless people. always go to union square from the hotel. take muni line 38 back. there is a bus stop at the hotel.

review.title: Very nice place to stay for the price
review.reviewText: Perfect if you're on a budget and you don't spend a lot of time in the room. A little shabby, and the rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. The staff were great; friendly, helpful and responsive. The complimentary internet was convenient. The coffe bar off the lobby was too. The location was very nice, a 5 minute walk to the mall on Market, with lots of shopping and restaurants on the way.

review.title: Peace and quiet?
review.reviewText: If you looking for a place to find peace and quiet then this may not be the ideal hotel as you can easily hear annoying conversations in the adjoining rooms.

review.title: Good Choice for Budget -Minded Travelers
review.reviewText: We were warmly greeted upon check in. The [Standard] room didn't face the street, so it was very quiet at night. Bathroom was well kept(for being a "2-star"). Staff was helpful reserving the shuttle to SFO. Great transportation access (Muni buses, BART). A very pleasant experience

review.title: Excellent for the price
review.reviewText: Given its price, this hotel was very good. Well located (very near to Union Square), and at walking distance from almost anything of interest in San Francisco. The room smelled like the previous host smoked a lot, but the hotel was careful to install an ozone odor system, without us even asking.

review.title: I shall return!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, very central and close to Little Saigon, Chinatown, financial district, etc. There are quite a number of panhandlers in the area, many of whom are delusional, but they seem harmless. It could be intimidating to women or novice travellers. Although there is no air conditioning, it wasn't a problem given the time of year I went. Could be problematic during summer months. Although the room was very small, it was spotless and the bathroom was reasonably sized and the shower always had hot water. The bed was very comfortable - and I am fussy when it comes to beds!

review.title: Would use it again and recommend to other
review.reviewText: For the price, this hotel's location is great with easy walking distance everywhere. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was comfortable and clean.

review.title: Excellent quality/prize
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room are well decorated and clean. Great location, walking distance from Union Square, Cable car, Market street...

review.title: Quaint hotel on main thorofare
review.reviewText: This is a quaint little hotel on Geary street. Pretty good location for exploring the city on foot, we have managed to see all the sights that tourists are supposed to see mainly by walking up and down the hills. If you are not up to walking the bus stop is right in front of the hotel. I would not recommend renting a car in San Francisco unless you have a lot of money laying around. All in all it is a nice place to stay, a little pricey but service is good, rooms are comfortable and lots of hot water in the shower (good if you get caught in a cold rain).

review.title: Small rooms, good location
review.reviewText: This is a cheap hotel, so you can't expect too much. The rooms are very small. Mine did not even have a closet, just a rod with hangers in the corner. Also the front desk was short staffed. I waited over half an hour to check in. For the price and location, however, I would consider putting up with these minor hassles.

review.title: Good Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and were fairly satisfied with our stay. The desk clerks were all incredibly friendly, despite our 1am arrival time. They offered some services for the city, but were not incredibly pushy when we turned down the offers. Our only complaint with the maintenance would be a slightly frightening elevator which was an experience to take up to our 7th floor room. Our only disappointment with our room was the size, which was very cozy, but the basic hotel room amenities were provided. The Internet hookup with a desk in room was very nice as well. We wouldn't recommend walking by yourself late at night as the area borders one of the seeder areas of town but we felt fine paired up. We would recommend this hotel to those on a budget. The access to Union Square, bus line, and cable cars were convenient, but walking up hill daily from Union Square was one of the unavoidable hastles of the city. Good staff, good hotel, a recommend in our book.

review.title: I thought this hotel was great
review.reviewText: A nice place to stay. Nicer than other places I stayed that were twice the money. The murals on the walls in the rooms were pretty overwhelming at first, but they grew on me. The bathroom was pretty big, and very clean. All in all I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Enjoyable visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Adante before. While the rooms are small, they are clean. The location is great as well. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel and Union Square is only a few blocks away. The BART is also fairly close. It is an affordable hotel and I likely will stay there again.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: In town for a wedding on a major conference weekend. Decided to take a chance. No regrets, would definitely stay there again. The rooms were very adequate, clean, comfortable, and well appointed. The staff could not have been more helpful. Overall good experience.

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Adante with my Sister for 3 nights. Ideal location near Union Sq and cable cars. Staff on reception were very helpful and were happy to book any tours of transportation. Breakfast was Continental and perfectly adequate. Room theme a little strange but apart from sleeping we were never in the hotel, far too much to do elsewhere. Would certainly stay again.

review.title: Adante Hotel - Cramped but Clean
review.reviewText: The service staff were very helpful and the motel rooom was very clean. The maid stuff did a great job of cleaning the room. My only complaint was that the only place to work/sit at a chair was at a small student desk that shared its desktop with the 25inch TV and coffee maker - very little room to do work if you have to. Great value for the price.

review.title: Very clean, comfortable and a good value
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice with helpful staff, a small, clean, quiet room, free wireless internet in the lobby and a continental breakfast (good, fresh muffins). I'd definitely go back. The location was easy walking distance to Union Square, but you do want to be careful at night.

review.title: Small and older, but friendly and clean
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights on a business trip. Our room was small as was the bathroom. But, the hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. For the price and location it was a good value. Free wireless in the lobby and a coffee shop on premises was nice.

review.title: Worth to live in
review.reviewText: This Hotel is very safe to live in. The main door is lock during the night and each room has a safe for customer to store their important things. The bedroom is quiet and I can sleep well at night. The staff at front desk is courteous and helpful. Besides, the price is reasonable so this Hotel is worth to live in. I will recommend to my friends.

review.title: Great service & location-- terrible condition
review.reviewText: Our room was painted with an aquarium theme, taking away from its supposed "European charm." Additionally, there was lipstick on a coffee mug in the bathroom and the room didn't have air conditioning. It was quite warm in San Francisco last week, so we did not sleep comfortably. On the other hand, the concierge was very polite and helpful, the location was great-- right off of Union Square and the bed was fairly comfortable.

review.title: Convenient and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The Adante is just three blocks from Union Square which makes it close to China Town and the cable car line. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room so the size of the room didn't matter much. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous. There is no A/C but we didn't need it with the very comfortable temperatures. For the price, convenience and staff hospitality, the Adante is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it.

review.title: Perfect Choice
review.reviewText: I was looking for someplace nice, not a chain, and close to Union Square and the Adante fit all the criteria! The staff was very friendly and helpful and there was someone always there. The hotel itself is very cozy and clean. The room was small but had all the amenities. The cafe that was connected was also nice and had an ATM and internet service. The rooms also had internet capabilities. Union Square and all sorts of restaurants were within walking distance, so it was also very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: good place to stay for the money
review.reviewText: Great downtown location. Hotel staff was very courteous and provided great tourist information. Nearby public transportation. Felt very safe in this downtown location traveling alone with my son. Thanks Adante!!

review.title: A good budget option
review.reviewText: Helpful, friendly reception staff. Small bedroom/bathroom but clean and comfortable.The bar attached to the hotel is basic but friendly. They have the best Happy Hour prices we could find in SFO! The hotel is on the boundry of the good/bad ends of Geary St. Just turn left when you leave the building!

review.title: Decent Place, Nice Staff
review.reviewText: I booked the room at the last minute, checking in the same day. The hotel is nice enough, just ignore the neighborhood. The room walls have a marine theme painted on them, which I found both quaint and interesting. Great staff! Upgraded the room at no charge because my companion thought the pre-arranged room smelled smokey. Easy access to transit (bustop in front of the hotel), 3 blocks from Union Square. Good value for the City, would stay here again. Did I say great staff?

review.title: Good standard hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hotel Adante in S.Francisco for 4 nights and I will define my stay as very satisfactory. I asked for a quiet room in the back and got that. It is all what you expect on a budget hotel with friendly staff. The only thing I missed in the room was a refrigerator, but otherwise I don't have any other complaints.

review.title: cute and helpful!
review.reviewText: the staff was amazing..they even took pictures for us! the only bad thing was if u made a right out of the hotel instead of a left u were kind of in the ghetto.

review.title: location,location,location
review.reviewText: It was our first trip to SF and the Adante did everything they could to help us make it one of our best trips. The rooms were small but clean, and we were only there to shower and sleep. The staff helped with any questions on how to get to where we wanted to go, had maps available an even X'ed the spots on it for us. Also about the area, we were all women travelers and were out until 1am a few times and never felt threatened. We would definately go back and stay again.

review.title: Good place for a one-nighter
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location--very close to Union Square--at a good price. The desk and housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful. Our queen room was very small, so I personally would not consider staying here for longer than one night since the two of us felt a bit cramped. The hotel was very quiet on a Sunday night (except for the noisy bathroom fan) and the mattress was comfortable.

review.title: first trip to san francisco
review.reviewText: this hotel was located not too far from all of the major san francisco attractions and would be a great place to stay if you're looking for a city location.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Stayed couple of nights on a business trip. Small, but nice and clean. Do not expect 5 star facilities, but, for the price you pay, it is very nice. Room I stayed was small, but big enough for two. Front desk people are very nice, too.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: This is a well situated hotel with helpful staff.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Great beds...very fluffy. I really did enjoy the hotel, it's just the rooms are almost too small for the bed.

review.title: Surprisingly nice
review.reviewText: We decided to avoid the larger chain hotels and were pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and very clean rooms. The bathrooms are huge, and very modern. The bedrooms are somewhat small, but this is an old hotel -- so we were not surprised. If you are looking for a good, inexpensive hotel near Union Square you won't be disappointed. The breakfast is only muffins and toast, but there are a number of excellent restaurants nearby. The hotel does not come with views or amenities .. it is clean, comfortable and a good basecamp for your San Francisco adventures.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: Awesome Perfect in all ways

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: Adante is a great hotel, the staff is very helpful and the hotel is situtaed close to Union Square. It's a perfect walking distance to everything! The only minus is the homeless people on the streets close to the hotel.

review.title: Tenderloin
review.reviewText: Located on the edge of the tenderloin, this hotel was not bad considering the location and cost. Our room was small; however, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. My son was with me, we were woken up several times each night by people coming back from the bars and noise in the alley. If you are looking for something cheap and centrally located, this is the right hotel. If you are looking for rest, relaxation and pampering, this is not the right choice for your stay.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small but very nice. No complaints at all.

review.title: Good budget hotel
review.reviewText: This is a well-maintained, clean budget hotel. A few minor criticisms: the elevator is very slow and holds 5 people max; the radiator in the room makes quite a bit of noise when you first turn it on, although it does quiet down eventually; and the continental breakfast is only toast, blueberry muffins, orange juice and coffee. Other than these few things, I enjoyed my stay. The staff were friendly and helpful, although it's true that there did seem to be quite a few homeless people in the neighborhood. Still, in San Francisco there are homeless people everywhere. I would have no problem staying here again.

review.title: Place to stay if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: If this is your first trip to San Francisco and you want to experience the City life, this is not the place to stay. The neighborhood is not great. Lots of businesses close around 9pm, so the only activity you will have in this area are the homeless. However, this place is clean and well managed and the employees are friendly and helpful. Their internet cafe comes in very handy.

review.title: Good deal for the money.
review.reviewText: Small rooms but clean and in good conditions. A lot of parking facilities just around the corner (starting from 15$). I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Loved Adante!
review.reviewText: We couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The cost and the location were perfect. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We loved the "young" feel to the hotel and the fantastic hole-in-the-wall taqueria next door. We plan on staying there again next year!

review.title: Should be more stars
review.reviewText: I have stayed at others with these stars but this was much better than those.

review.title: Good price and location
review.reviewText: The people who work on front desk are wonderfull. The bedroom are small but clean. Good just to sleep and go out during the day.

review.title: Good Basic Accomodations
review.reviewText: Located downtown. Easy access to public transportation. Vintage hotel, small but comfortable rooms. No air conditioning but wasn't needed. Felt safe and secure. Near several types of restaurants, the theater district, and Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel for travelers on a budget
review.reviewText: This hotel was relatively cheap, considering its location is San Francisco, and beautifully decorated. It was clean, although small rooms, and its valet parking is actually the best way to go if you bring your own vehicle to town. However, the neighborhood is not the best, and the insulation in the hotel is non-existant, so you hear everything in the hallway at nighttime. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone on a budget.

review.title: Nice Hotel with Free Internet Access in Room with Reasonable Price
review.reviewText: The staff are nice and the price is nice with free Internet Access and breakfast. If you need to have toasts, please prepare to wait for long queue Recommend to bring an ethernet cable for free internet access in room.

review.title: Good location, but quality is questionable.
review.reviewText: Location is good and the price is as good as you can get. But the rooms are run down and the walls are paper thin. The bathrooms are very old and I wore flip flops in the shower. The crowd is younger due to the price and location.

review.title: Small....But You Can't Beat the Locale
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel for aanyone not wanting to spend a fortune for lodging in SF. You get a bed, a TV, Internet access and a bath. What more do you need if you are flying solo (or double). I recommend the Internet Cafe in the lobby...good coffe, drinks and food at decent prices.

review.title: better than i expected
review.reviewText: for the price, i can't imagine anything better. nice accomodations for the budget traveler.

review.title: Very quaint and affordable
review.reviewText: We weren't sure what we were getting into booking a hotel with a 2 star rating, but we were both pleasantly surprised. Although the room was small it offered a very comfortable bed, very clean room and quite a nice atmosphere. Certainly all the extras of a 5 star hotel would have been nice, but we enjoyed ourselves nicely during our 6 day stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget (or just frugal like me) and doesn't plan on spending much time there. For us it was a place to freshen up and sleep while we spend the majority of our time in the city. Centrally located very close to Union Square and fantastic shopping; just be mindful of your surroundings with a 1 or 2 block radius. Although we never felt ourselves in any threatening situations, other might have; perhaps those of older years or inexperienced travelers. The hotel staff was quite friendly and accommodating. We will stay there again.

review.title: old, small, but clean!
review.reviewText: we stayed here for a business trip in June at the convention center. we booked too late and there wasn't a whole lot of options left. however, this hotel ended up being very cheap and a very okay place to stay. i normally stay in 4 star hotels, but this ended up being great for the price. Although, if you need air conditioning in the summer, please don't stay here. they have fans, and i was fine, but my associate needed the air in his room. also, be prepared to walk stairs as the elevator broke down while we were staying there. and luckily we are so fit, that we could walk up 7 flights of stairs as we were staying on the 7th floor.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: great hotle sraff, rooms extremely tiny

review.title: Good budget hotel
review.reviewText: Clean hotel and rooms. Typical international mix of guests. Room was on the small size. Convenient location, especially for bus users.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: No complaints. Walking distance to Union Square and trolly lines and next door to a very cheap parking garage. Will come back to this hotel again.

review.title: Good Location and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location in downtown San Francisco. A lot of cheap eateries and convenience stores nearby. Though a little dodgy at night, especially a few streets away. Be sure to have your map handy so that you don't make wrong turns. Room a little small but well kept. Bathroom nicely done up and comfy enough. No kettle for boiling water though. Morning muffins, bread and coffee nothing fancy but will suffice. Overall, value for money and good location.

review.title: Best for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and it was very quite where my room was. The iron in the room wasn't working in the morning and one call to the front desk was all it took, a working iron was delivered promtly. The size of the room was fine, it wasn't too small as others said they were. A continental breakfast to get you started in the morning, what more can you ask for.

review.title: Convient Location, Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText: The rooms were a little smaller than I had expected, but when it came to questions or directions, the staff was knowledgable and provided maps to show you how to get places. The room was wonderfully painted and well-maintained. The trolley stop is also just a couple blocks away. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Depending on your plans in SF, the Adante is in a great spot. A lot of places are in walkable distance - Chinatown, Union Square, Market St, Nob Hill, North Beach, restaurants, AMC movie theatre, cable car and bus access, etc. We had a great time because everything was so accesible. There are a lot of hotels in that area, but we got Adante for a good price on Expedia. We were worried about cleanliness, but we were very satisfied with the cleanliness of our room. Front desk is very helpful too.

review.title: Great Hotel for Lower Budget
review.reviewText: We stayed for a long weekend at the hotel with our little daughter. Hotel location right downtown and about a five minute walk to Union Square. Continental breakfast consists of coffee and muffin/toast with jam. Lot's of shopping and seighseeing without having to use taxi and other public transportation. Great hotel for low to medium budget travellers. We would certainly stay at the same hotel again. Size of hotel room are a little bit small.

review.title: Great for the money
review.reviewText: Adante hotel is great for the price. A little further from the BART station than I expected, but it was only about a 10 minute walk. The complimentary light breakfast was nice.

review.title: i will stay here again if i come back
review.reviewText: front desk people are very professional, nice and helpful. There is no microvewave in the room. So when i ask where to reheat the milk before i went to bed, the front desk gentlemen opened the bar(it is already closed at that time) and let me use the microwave in the kitch. The room is small, but the location is great.

review.title: Well located, reasonable accomodation
review.reviewText: With a room away from the street, one floor up, what more convenient place to spend a few nights in a great city. Helpful friendly staff. Internet best accessed from room plug in, rather than wi-fi in the foyer.

review.title: Very good place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in centre town close to everything nice, quiet hotel not expensive

review.title: Cozy but tiny
review.reviewText: The rooms at the Adante were tiny. We were traveling with 2 adults and 2 children and were constantly tripping over each other. Also, while the staff were generally pleasant and helpful, two errors -- one with our bill, and one with repairs needed in our room -- were potentially problematic. They were resolved, but should never have happened. For two people who planned to use the hotel room only to sleep, the hotel is fine. For more, look elsewhere.

review.title: Great front desk service!
review.reviewText: The front desk help were really knowledgeable about local places to visit. They gave us a map tailor made for hotel guests, which proved to be invaluable throughout the trip! I even called them when I couldn't find a building I was looking for!

review.title: Good quality for low price
review.reviewText: Good quality for low price, very convinient location

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I recommend this small comfortable hotel, located near all major attractions.

review.title: the best hotel you can get price that you pay
review.reviewText: Rooms are little bit small but the location and quality of the hotel was a good experience. It is really cheap and located in a good spot.Hotel staffs are really helpful. There are bunch of nice and cheap restaurant around it. Everything so close by with walking distance. you dont even need to rent a car if you just want to hang out in downtown. Definitely recommends to everyone if you want to save some bucks and stay in good location. They even offer continental breakfast (esp. muffins are amazing) plus they have good coffee shop with wireless internet.

review.title: Good Bargain in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Adante Hotel has moderate resources (NO pool, NO exercise room etc) but its staff are friendly and helpful. It is a good bargain for people who want a moderately-priced, clean hotel as a base for visiting San Francisco. If you are planning to spend a lot of time hanging around the hotel then you should look elsewhere.

review.title: Try getting a better on the same street for a few Dollars more
review.reviewText: I would say if you are just in Frisco to tour and see sights for a few nights and just want to rest your head, then sure this hotel is cheap and I mean cheap and close to attractions.The rooms are not clean at alllllll and they smell. The rooms have no AC and the fan just is not any help. Raw sweage smell every moring and I had my window closed(nasty). Pay a few extra bucks and stay in a nicer hotel on the same street.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: Good location - the cable car and metro (to travel throughout San Fran and to the airport) is only a few blocks away. Centrally located between all the major attractions. Good breakfast. Courteous staff.

review.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel !
review.reviewText: This lovely hotel was ALL it was advertised to be - outstanding location, beautiful decor, very clean with a charming European feel. Close to all SF modes of transportation that we needed to make our trip flow. I won't return to beautiful San Francisco without staying there again, and recommend it highly to value-minded travelers like us.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Nice cozy place to stay if you're on a budget. Hotel staff were friendly and attentive, though none of the house keeping staff speak English. The room was very small. But this was to be expected. Only two real issues (which were minor): shower water pressure and temperature were inconsistent; room key cards demagnetized about 3 times during our stay.

review.title: it could be a choice
review.reviewText: it's not a very excellent one,but not bad and the people at the front desk are always ready for the customers. But the room is a sort of small and in dark... probably cheaper than some better ones,of course,hehe

review.title: most definitely for the economist or backpacker - very reasonably priced
review.reviewText: hotel staff were very friendly - no room service though which is one of the reasons why it is a lot cheaper than most hotels close to Union Square. Booked a standard room and really noticed the difference in not having my King size bed!!!! Very convenient to all amenities - 5 mins walk from cable car and Union Sq. A few homeless people tend to gather around Geary St though - beware!!!!!

review.title: good enough
review.reviewText: The Hotel is nice, and it's well located.

review.title: Convenient yet tiny
review.reviewText: My wife and I went to San Fran for our anniversary. We were mainly looking to experience the city and wine country, not for a romantic getaway. The hotel was just around 4 blocks from Union square, which is a major shopping district for San Francisco. Generally the cleanliness of the rooms weren't a problem, but our room was incredibly tiny, and the decorations were silly. The conintental breakfast was also toast, blueberry muffins, and orangejuice. We were there for 5 days and everyday it was the same.

review.title: great value and location
review.reviewText: Very close to Union Square and within easy distance of public transit, this hotel is a great value. The friendly and well-informed front desk staff were quite helpful, and the room was VERY clean. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Great value, good friendly service & good location
review.reviewText: Older hotel w/ character, very clean, convenient location, lacks air conditioning which wasn't a problem but could be at other times of year. Staff and service was friendly and above average.

review.title: Good Value for Short Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, rooms were clean and simple. Location is a little edgy (most of San Fran can be like that) but great for Avis car hire pick up. If you are looking for a one night stay before heading out to Yosemite etc its a good spot.

review.title: One of worst hotel experience have ever had
review.reviewText: The walls are paper thin so you hear everything in the other rooms. They did not have enough blankets! in the hotel so we only had one blanket and could not get more. The toilet malfunctioned twice--they looked at the first time, said they fixed it, and then the next day the toilet overflooded again. You complain and they just look at you like a lost child. From the manager all the way down to the other workers, they don't know what they are doing. The hotel is also not in the best location. Next door there is some kind of Kebab place and if you are a female you can not--and this happened twice- sit outside without the staff coming out and trying to pick you up. If you have ever been to a third world country and are female, you would what kind of mentality and experience I am talking about.

review.title: Good Deal for the price
review.reviewText: I was happy with my stay at the Adante. Small rooms? Sure, but most European Style Hotels have smaller rooms. Sketchy neighborhood. Fine, I traveled alone and after waiting at a nearby bus stop by myself once, I opted to take a cab home. During the day its perfectly fine. Going west of that block while alone, at night might not be ideal, but walking to and from Union Square is not big deal. The staff has always been super helpful and nice. Remember what you are paying in comparision to the other on shared bathroom hotels in the area.

review.title: Good place to stay if your on a limited budget
review.reviewText: We would not stay there again just because of the location,the hotel itself was clean and in good repair and a bargin for San Francisco.

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean and the location was very good. No aircondition - and the room was quite hot - it would have been nice with A/C. Breakfast was very simple - but free of extra charge.

review.title: No good
review.reviewText: Reading your reviews I was disappointed with this hotel. Although it's 3 blocks from Union Square, the neighborhood is awful. Not a safe place for toursits. Cheap price is not the only important issue, safety counts more.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: Although the room is kind of small, it's really good deal at a great location.

review.title: Good, moderately priced hotel
review.reviewText: This was a good deal for a centrally located hotel. I encountered small quirks with only moderately warm water and sketchy TV reception, but those are par for the course in hotels. On the plus side, the hotel offers a very convenient location, morning munchies, and an on-site cafe. Throw in free high speed internet access in your room and a laundromat across the street and it adds up to a very pleasant place to spend a week.

review.title: Great place in a good location
review.reviewText: confortable room, good location, the service was good, a very plesant hotel. We've had a great time!

review.title: small and comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is small and not too fancy, but it is perfect if you do not plan to hang out in your hotel the whole time you're in SanFran. Seems to be a big hit with European guests. Location was good - it was a 2 block walk to Union Square. Handpainted murals all over the rooms are a nice touch. The internet cafe had great cappucinos and happy hour beer specials!

review.title: warm
review.reviewText: The holel was charming, gave a sense of warmth. Felt like home right away. Loved the little internet cafe next to the lobby. San Francisco is a great city and yet I remember the hotel as much as anything. I would recomend it and would return

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: we went here because it was cheap!!.. there was high speed internet, tv, a desk, and not room for much else.. i felt a little crampped and looked in envy at the larger rooms on our 3rd night there(we stayed for 6 nights)... but it was freakishly cheap.. and clean and quiet... the walls are really thin but no one was making a lot of noise..

review.title: I Really Didn't Want To Leave
review.reviewText: My experience with the Adante would be difficult to improve. Given the modest nightly rate, the hotel's thoughtful amenities--in-room coffee maker w/supplies, bedside clock radio, high-quality bath toiletries--seemed thoroughly five-star. The hotel's adjoining internet cafe was a marvelous thing. The building's location could scarcely be better, and the staff was entirely delightful.

review.title: nice stop
review.reviewText: This hotel met my expectations. It was clean, friendly and responsive. Its humble, though a small room it was clean and had all the necessary additions ( safe, iron, phone, fan). I will stay again.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: wonderful staff. little cafe is great for a beer and internet access. good chinese across the street. will stay there again.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: It was in a great location, near market place, china town and fisherman's wharf. The hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful. It was a quaint and charming, old-time San Francisco place and we really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: quaint and comfy
review.reviewText: the smaller room is pretty inconveniently small but perfect for a traveler who is only planning on using his/her room for sleep and showers. however, the larger room is worth the extra money if you need the space. it's perfect for entertaining if you need that sort of thing and the space is more than adequate, especially in my circumstance where i had tons of luggage due to the nature of my trip. the staff was also pleasant and knowledgable.

review.title: So- so
review.reviewText: I guess the best thing of this hotel are their very helpful hotel staff. Amenities were stripped to the very basic. The rooms were very...very small. Its convenient though, located near Union Square and such. Reccomend this hotel for budget travellers only. Oh, by the way, don't place any high hopes for their breakfast, jsut muffins and hot drinks only.

review.title: We'd stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located about 4 blocks from Union Square, THE shopping district in San Francisco, and about 4 blocks up from Market Street. The hotel definitely isn't anything fancy, but it (and our room) was neat and clean and comfortable. High speed internet access in the room is provided, which was a plus for us. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Inexpensive, but good quality
review.reviewText: For an area with many hotels, most of which are expensive, I was very happy this pick. The rooms were clean, they had a continental breakfast very morning and the staff was very friendly.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Clean, roomy, trendy, and comforatable.

review.title: European hotel in downtown SF!
review.reviewText: Adante's charm surrounds you with a feel of being in Europe. The location, the internet cafe/bar in the lobby, the small but most comfortable room was just the ticket for our first trip. We were in San Francisco to see the city and the location was IDEAL for those wanting to be in the middle of downtown and not wanting to pay ridiculous rates...3 blocks from Union, in the Theatre district...a bus stop AT THE FRONT DOOR...play your cards right and after a long day of walking the hills, you can get dropped off for some internet and beer at happy hour! Great and friendly staff full of ideas...not luxurious, but perfect for budget conscious travelers...would go back tomorrow!

review.title: Nice boutique hotel, beds need work
review.reviewText: Everything was very quaint and attractive, but our queen-size bed in our tiny room was not comfortable - i hated the sheets, the pillows were awful, and the mattress was old. Still it's in a great location and a good price. If you're not a fussy sleeper it's probably ideal.

review.title: friendly, fair price
review.reviewText: price was good on the budget staff was very helpful. A little far from pier 39 but a short walk to buses and cable cars.

review.title: Adante
review.reviewText: The hotel is really cute with lots of paintings (murals, etc.) and other fun touches.  The desk staff were friendly.  The bedroom was a bit small, but the bathroom was large.  It was convenient and the area, although it seemed a little "iffy", was fine, even for a single woman at night.

review.title: Just sleep there and enjoy San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Pros: I booked for a low price. Central location, friendly staff. Coffee and soggy muffins for breakfast.

Cons: Old building, quite small rooms. My TV did not have remote control and they never brought me one. Free internet only if you have your laptop with you, othewise you have to pay. Expedia advertizes "valet parking" and "Self Paking" which I thought was free, but had to pay $25 daily...

Overall:  Do not expect much. Just sleep there and enjoy San Franscisco. Such a beautiful city can make-up for everything. I am overall satisfied.

review.title: A little too close for comfort
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and staff was great.  The hallways are very narrow, two people can't walk side by side.  The rooms are very nicely painted and decorated but once again very tight.  We were out about most of the time,sightseeing so it really was not a big problem.  The internet cafe adjacent to the hotel was very nice and very convenient.  We got an awesome deal so for the price we paid.  I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Good location but small rooms with no AC
review.reviewText: The Hotel was nice although the rooms were very small and did not have AC.  I would stay there again because for the price its not bad at all, in the summer it might be a good idea to stay somewhere with AC.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Nice and clean, small rooms, i guess i should of expected it in a city. Free breakfast offered was not worth it.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Located in vibrant section of San Francisco.  Near Bart and Cable Car.  City Bus to beach runs from front of hotel.  I particularly enjoyed chair and table on street for watching people.  Continental breakfast very minimal but coffee good.

review.title: Surprisingly good for the price
review.reviewText: I stay in the City when I have a conference event and don't want to drive the hour home late at night(and back in rush hour).  I also don't want to spend much.  This is the best of the affordable hotels I've found so far in terms of price/performance.  The murals are funky but acceptable!

review.title: Perfect hotel for small budget travellers
review.reviewText:
All you'll ever want from a low-budget hotel: perfect service, good condition, and clean rooms. The artistic murals give the hotel just that little extra that makes you simply enjoy staying at the Adante Hotel.
It's located three blocks from Union Square, close to the Powell-Mason streetcar turn-point, the shopping district, the SF MoMA and many other touristic attractions. You'll find a complete choice of cuisines, for every meal of the day, for every kind of budget, within walking distance. 
I'd highly recommend the Adante Hotel to small budget travellers who want to enjoy San Francisco at it's best.

review.title: Not bad. But I'm exploring elsewhere.
review.reviewText:
while the complimentary high-speed internet in the rooms is nice (if you supply your own cable) the hotel itself is only "okay." my first two nights they "upgraded" me to a king room because they didn't have a queen bed room for me. while this might seem like a good thing, it was simply an inconvenience and honestly, the king room wasn't that much better.

the decor of this hotel is mediocre to bad if you're used to reasonably modern hotel design. the knockdown texture of the walls is creepy because they seem to have slathered ever surface with it and the painting and mural are "quaint" at best. the first room smelled very strongly of luv my carpet and the second did too to a lesser degree. the bathroom of the smaller room has only a small metal shelf to toiletries. while the bathrooms themselves were clean, the decor for some reason made them feel not as clean as they actually were.

the coffee shop downstairs is nice and has a good vibe. overall, it's not a bad place and for the price it's probably a good value. some of decor decisions aren't to my taste, but if you want a good location and a cheap price, it's not a bad way to go.

review.title: Great Hotel at a Great Price
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Adante Hotel.  Located in a great neighborhood, close to Union Square, Bart station, cable cars, dance club Ruby Sky!  We were on a budget and were very pleased with how nice the hotel was...breakfast was provided, and room was very clean.

review.title: Good price/quality deal
review.reviewText: for the price, the hotel was good, comfortable beds, good shower, nice size TV and overall a good price/quality deal. the fan in the bathroom is a bit loud and the hotel can be slightly noisy at night. in addition, the breakfast cannot really be called a breakfast. a muffin and a cup of watery coffee.

review.title: Very Pretty and Worth The Money
review.reviewText: We were very impressed at the hand-painted murals and trimming along the top of the walls.  It gave it a very at-home feeling.  We thought it looked so nice that we even considered painting our house like.  We didn't get the room we reserved, so we had to stay in one room for one night and then moved to a new room the next day, which we were not too thrilled because we had to come back to the hotel during the day to move.  The rooms were very clean but not well maintained.  We had to open the windows when we were out to air out both rooms.  The first was filled with cigarette smoke (even though the hotel is supposed to be non-smoking); the second room had a good but extremely strong smell.  In both rooms, bathroom and closet doors squeaked.  In one of the bathrooms, the glass shelve was not securely attached to the wall so it was slanted and we couldn't put anything thing on it without it rolling off and the toilet was running all the time.   The TVs had really bad receptions; the remote controls were not working (probably out of batteries).  They had a steam heater which makes a really loud and obnoxious sound of metal banging against each other during the night that can wake you up (and keep you up) if you're a light sleeper like me, but it didn't bother my husband.  We thought it was worth our money and would come back there again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice older hotel, close to BART and Trolly

review.title: Not for everyone
review.reviewText: The Adante is not for everyone.  The room was small (really, no place to sit and work except the bed), light/fan combo in the bathroom noisy and steam radiator loud.  However, the location is great, staff helpful and friendly, and the price was right.

review.title: A Gem in the middle of a large city!!
review.reviewText: Very pleasantly surprised.  Coziness, and rooms had alot of  character.  Requested a room in the back for quiet, turned on the bathroom sink went to get my tooth brush out of my bad and the water shut off.  The next morning the same thing happened, the lights turned on and off by them selves, but only on two occasions.  Yes the room had a ghost, she was pleasant and dressed in period clothing of the turn of the century.  I mentioned this to the front desk and they knew of her. An added bonus to the history of San Francisco

review.title: FRIENDLY AND ATTENTIVE STAFF- A GREAT VALUE!
review.reviewText:
My stay here(approx. on & off for 3wks.) has been very pleasurable and problem free. The staff from Management to Housekeeping were always efficient, courteous and helpful.

The complemintary high speed internet access is fantastic and great for those that need to be on their laptops for long periods of time.  The only negative aspect of my stay,but really nothing to dwell on, was perhaps the complimetary continental breakfast. It's unexciting and the same each day(blueberry muffins,O.J, coffee).

Overall, a great San Francisco value and will always highly recommend it to those travelling to the City and even for those that live here and just want a quite, private get-away for a while.  Great stay!

review.title: I'll Be Returning
review.reviewText: I stayed overnight after I attended a play in San Francisco.  The hotel is beautiful, the people were friendly and I only wished I had booked two nights instead of one.

review.title: Very good condition
review.reviewText: It was really nice to stay there. There is free wireless internet service in each room. There is free comprimentary breakfast and coffee and juice. The front person is kind. However, he sometimes gave me wrong information about signtseeing, but it was O.K. Overall, it was great to stay there. I recomend your guys to stay there.
